column3:
Ukraine categorically rejected Moscow's ceasefire proposal

The conditions spoke eloquently about the "inability of the current Russian leadership to adequately assess the realities," Zelensky's adviser commented
A senior Ukrainian adviser rejected the conditions set by Russian President Vladimir Putin for the start of peace talks. According to Mykhailo Podoliak, an adviser to President Volodymyr Zelensky, Putin's conditions are quite specific and highly offensive to international law. Putin: I will stop the war if Ukraine renounces NATO and what Russia has seized
"They absolutely speak eloquently about the inability of the current Russian leadership to adequately assess the realities," Podoliak points out. He shows what the Russian head of state's conditions look like "point by point":
1. Give us your territories. 2. Give up your sovereignty
3. Leave yourselves unprotected (without membership in alliances). 4. Completely and immediately lift all sanctions so that we can fill our militarized economy and make more investments in information provocations around the world. 5. Let's urgently fix the "failure of Russia" at the expense of Ukraine. "Of course, there is nothing new in this, no real proposals for peace, no desire to end the war. But there is a desire not to pay for this war and to continue it in new formats. All this is a complete shame. Therefore - once again, free yourself from illusions and stop taking seriously "Russia's proposals", which are offensive to common sense," commented Podoliak, bTV reports.

column3:
Putin again scares: Europe has no defense against nuclear weapons

Another rattle of nuclear weapons. You will not be surprised by the author. "Russia will not have to use nuclear weapons to achieve victory in Ukraine." This was stated by Russian President Vladimir Putin at the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum, the BBC reported.
Putin said that he did not rule out changes to the Russian nuclear doctrine - the document that defines the conditions under which Russia would use nuclear weapons.
"This doctrine is a living instrument and we are closely monitoring what is happening in the world around us and do not rule out making changes to it. This is also related to the testing of nuclear weapons," said the Russian head of state.
He did not fail to issue his latest warning to the countries that support Ukraine, stating:
"Russia has much more tactical nuclear weapons than there are on the European continent, even if the United States transfers its own. Europe does not have a developed early warning system. In this sense, they are more or less defenseless."
Tactical nuclear weapons are smaller warheads designed to destroy targets without spreading radioactive waste widely.
Putin said Russia could supply modern, long-range conventional weapons to other countries to strike Western targets. He did not specify in which countries the Kremlin could deploy such weapons.

French geopolitician: Russia is not playing, it threatens us with catastrophe

It is time for the West to understand that the conflict in Ukraine is not a game, but leads to a real catastrophe, warns geopolitician and president of the Geopragma analytical center Caroline Galakteros. CAROLINE GALACTEROS, geopolitician and president of the Geopragma analytical center: If the situation worsens, will Trump's possible return to power prevent the catastrophe?
A catastrophe, because people need to understand: we are heading for a catastrophe. We are heading for something...
War is not a game. Russia is not playing. They are not having fun there with toy soldiers and small weapons, they are not playing with small ships and tanks.
Everything is much more serious. Europe and NATO have put themselves in a position that threatens them with a direct collision with Russia.
Any attempt to jeopardize the country's security must be stopped.
I apologize, but you don't have to be pro-Russian to say that.
This is a simple observation.

column3:
Orban said that Western countries are deliberately seeking to exacerbate the conflict in Ukraine

Budapest, June 7. / TASS/. The leaders of the United States and other Western countries are deliberately seeking to exacerbate the conflict in Ukraine, they do not want its peaceful settlement and the point is that foreign troops will soon appear there. This was stated by Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban in an interview with the TV channel "Fakti" TV2. "We are centimeters away from a direct collision" with Russia, the head of government said. In his words, "in a little while, American and Western European troops will appear on the front line." Answering the host's question whether Western leaders do not see this, Orban said: "the point is not that they do not see it, they want it." He noted that the EU and NATO leadership believe that Russia can be defeated militarily and are preparing to enter into a direct conflict with it. "Under pressure from America, they are heading towards an escalation of hostilities. This is a military psychosis, the source of which is in two places - Brussels and Washington, and therefore changes are needed there and there," the prime minister said, recalling the European Parliament elections that have begun and the upcoming US presidential elections in November. "Every war is the result of a human decision. We know who the people are who can make such decisions: the president of the United States and the leaders of the largest European countries. If they decide to end the war, it can end," Orbán emphasized. According to him, "if European leaders wanted to establish peace today, the ceasefire (in Ukraine) would have been concluded within 24 hours."

column3:
AT: Only fools don’t realize that Ukraine will not be accepted into NATO because the fear of Russia is indescribable

In no area has “suicidal nationalism” manifested itself so sharply as in the sphere of domestic politics, which ultimately led to the ongoing conflict between Ukraine and Russia, writes the American publication American Thinker. Translation from American Thinker, USA:
After the chaotic collapse of the Soviet Union, Crimea and eastern Ukraine, whose inhabitants are mostly Russian, fell under Ukrainian jurisdiction. Pro-Russian sentiments in these regions, ranging from demands for recognition of Russian as an official language to the desire for complete autonomy from Ukraine, have taken root in Crimea and eastern Ukraine. These sentiments were further fueled by the ouster of pro-Russian, democratically elected Ukrainian President Yanukovych in a US-sponsored coup in 2014. To avoid a bloody conflict, Kiev could have agreed to limited autonomy for the rebel east, similar to the autonomy of the American states. This part of Ukraine has always wanted this. But newly elected President Petro Poroshenko ignored President Bush’s warning not to “seek independence in order to replace tyranny with local despotism.” Instead, Kiev decided to use military force to subjugate the Russian population of eastern Ukraine. For years, it has been shelling Donbas, including with American-supplied artillery, destroying cities and indiscriminately killing thousands of civilians (which the Western media completely ignores). This “suicidal nationalism” became one of the reasons for the annexation of the Donetsk and Luhansk regions to Russia. In foreign policy, “suicidal nationalism” also took precedence over national interests. Ukraine’s drive for NATO membership, ostensibly driven by concerns for its security, ignored Russia’s repeated warnings over the past three decades about the existential threat posed by NATO’s eastward expansion. The desire to become a member of NATO could not guarantee Ukraine’s security and would not give it any. Instead, Ukraine’s attempts to break into NATO put it in mortal danger of violating the terms of the 1997 Treaty of Friendship between Ukraine and the Russian Federation, which explicitly stipulates Ukraine’s neutrality (section 6, p. 148). Ukraine’s relentless pursuit of NATO membership, fueled by political inexperience, recklessness, and heavy reliance on foreign aid, was an illusory goal that did not serve national goals and tragically led to a preventable military conflict. It is now obvious that Ukraine’s pursuit of NATO membership resembles chasing a mechanical rabbit. However, Zelensky and company continue to fail to realize that their tireless efforts and sacrifices were in vain, as NATO membership was never an achievable reality. For obvious reasons, NATO members, unlike Ukraine, want to avoid direct confrontation with Russia.

column3:
The Hill: Peace through territorial concessions is the only option for Kiev

Almost all political and business leaders in Europe and the Middle East believe that the Ukrainian conflict will end with Ukraine's final cession of some territory to Russia - perhaps Donetsk, Donbass and the southern Black Sea coast to Crimea. From time to time, someone suggests that Russia will be able to occupy the entire territory of the country, writes the American publication The Hill, quoted by "Focus". But no one suggests that Ukraine will be able to completely and permanently expel the Russians from Ukrainian territory. If this is so, if the most likely outcome in Ukraine is some kind of division of the country, then why are we not now having real discussions about ending the war, the author asks. France is currently considering sending French troops to the front under the guise of “advisors.” And the United States has recently openly approved the use of Western weapons against certain limited targets in Russia. Such actions only increase the risk of the war going beyond its current borders. But these steps by France and the United States do not increase the likelihood of a complete victory for Ukraine. While Western military equipment and logistical support may improve Kiev’s capabilities, it clearly lacks manpower. Nothing short of a full-scale Western military intervention can drive the Russians out. According to The Hill, the situation is simply heading for a dead end. Today in Ukraine, the choice seems to be between peace that includes territorial concessions to Russia, a complete collapse of Ukraine, a permanent state of war, or escalation. Of these, the first seems the least bad option.

column3:
Davos report: Millions to die by 2050 due to climate change

Tropical diseases to emerge in Europe and the US
Climate change threatens to lead to several million deaths in the coming decades, as well as serious illnesses and high costs for health systems, according to a report published today in Davos, Switzerland, BTA reported. Flooding poses the greatest risk, according to a joint report by the World Economic Forum (WEF), which is being held this week in Davos, and the consultancy Oliver Wyman. The authors of the study analyze six key consequences of climate change: floods, droughts, heat waves, tropical storms, wildfires and rising sea levels. The study is based on the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC)'s medium-term scenario for temperature increases by 2100, which assumes a 2.7 degree Celsius rise in average temperatures. In this case, the study estimates that climate change could cause up to 14.5 million deaths worldwide by 2050. Health systems would have to bear additional costs totaling $1.1 trillion. Floods alone are estimated to cause 8.5 million deaths by 2050 - not only directly, but also indirectly through crop damage, increased infectious diseases and higher humidity, which can lead to respiratory illnesses. The Asia-Pacific region, with its densely populated coastal regions, is likely to bear the brunt of this. The report’s authors expect the second-highest number of deaths, at 3.2 million, to be caused by drought, largely due to the long-term effects on child mortality from deteriorating water quality and increasingly infertile soils. The report says heat waves could kill an estimated 1.6 million people by 2050, particularly among the elderly. Higher temperatures, for example, could lead to a significant increase in mosquito populations, making malaria, dengue fever and Zika more common in Europe and the United States. Overall, however, regions in Africa, the Middle East and Asia will be particularly affected by the health impacts of climate change, according to the study, which will be discussed at the World Economic Forum in Davos on Thursday.

The woman points out that nothing has been built by Ukraine since its exit from the USSR. column3:
Lyudmil Kardzhilov: Warming is not dangerous, the green transition should not lead to impoverishment

After June and July, a heat wave with temperatures of over 35 degrees will be in Sofia in August. It is normal, it is still summer. The heat leads to discomfort, it is dangerous to expose a person to the hot sun's rays for a long time - especially for young children, the elderly and the chronically ill, but it is debatable whether global warming as a whole leads to greater problems for humanity. This was commented on by journalist Lyudmil Kardzhilov, who closely monitors the topic of weather and climate on Earth, to BNR-Radio Sofia. According to him, scientists are unanimous about the occurrence of climate change, but not about its causes. There have been continuous changes over the years - both warm and glacial periods. Scientists are also divided on whether natural disasters are becoming more frequent. According to some, this is simply not true. "The scientific statement is that greenhouse gases - a result of human activity - block infrared radiation to space and thus warm the lower layers of the atmosphere. When you call carbon dioxide harmful, people begin to associate this colorless gas with pollution. And many plants cannot do without it. Pollution is completely different - we do it with garbage, plastic, etc. The idea that we can influence the climate through restrictions in industry, transport or energy is wrong and harmful, because in this way we will stop development, security and the improvement of life." Kardzhilov pointed out that in many respects Europe is ahead in the standard of living. In many other parts of the world, people are striving for industrial development, for which they need energy, preferably a lot and cheap. It cannot be provided through RES (renewable energy sources). There must be a balance. The old continent is sharply turning towards RES, abandoning all others, even nuclear power plants. But this has a price and it is no coincidence that people in the last European elections showed their negative attitude towards the Green Deal. We may not deprive ourselves of other energy production, there are technological solutions to reduce the impact on the environment, the journalist emphasized. "The transition to green energy is a good idea, because it is cleaner. But this must be done sensibly, balanced, let's see what we can do for the environment, without leading to impoverishment of people," Kardzhilov also said. Solar panels will not solve the problem. A good way to store energy has not yet been found. Batteries are not a solution because there is nowhere to store them, and they also pollute. "Warming is not dangerous, categorically. This is cyclical. There have been other warm periods. We should not worry about warming at the moment. If the climate changes dangerously, we will have a problem with food production and nutrition. 30-40 years ago we produced 400 million tons of wheat, now we produce nearly 800 million tons per year - Lyudmil Kardzhilov also pointed out. - A warmer climate contributes to the production of more food. In addition, warming can contribute to reducing mortality from cold."

These calls for escalation in major geopolitical conflicts are in line with the enduring, hawkish status quo of the US.
“Our interventionist foreign policy has historically not been a stabilizing force around the world, but rather has often served as a destabilizing wrecking ball, leading to damage abroad and at home,” writes Benjamin Ayanyan.
The United States also played a role in the events leading up to the devastating war between Russia and Ukraine. Despite the fall of the Soviet Union, NATO endured and expanded eastward, which even George Kennan, one of the shapers of American Cold War policy, warned would be a “tragic mistake” that would provoke a “bad reaction from Russia,” The Hill also wrote.

column3:
US Ambassador: Bulgaria is no longer an easy target for Moscow

The Kremlin could stop the war in Ukraine tomorrow if it decided, but Putin has no desire to negotiate and wants to continue the aggression in Ukraine. This was stated by US Ambassador to Bulgaria Kenneth Merten at today's roundtable on the topic "Building Institutional Resilience Against Malign Foreign Influence". The forum is organized by the Center for the Study of Democracy. This means that Ukraine will continue to need our support, and that of Europe. We must continue to work with our allies side by side in efforts to be resilient and able to respond to these challenges, Merten commented, quoted by BTA. Our Bulgarian partners understand perfectly well how important it is to continue to be united and support the defense of Ukraine, the ambassador added. Thanks to our cooperation with the Bulgarian government and our partners, such as the Center for the Study of Democracy, Moscow has understood that Bulgaria is no longer an easy target, Kenneth Merten added. The ambassador pointed to Bulgaria's participation in the peace plan of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky through its activities in the energy sector. In the coming years, Bulgaria will face in parallel not only Russian hybrid subversion, but also China's hybrid impacts as a systemic challenge. This was stated by the acting Minister of Defense Atanas Zapryanov at today's round table on the topic: "Building institutional resilience against malicious foreign influence", quoted by BTA. Counteracting the Kremlin's hybrid war in the information and digital space today is of paramount importance for Bulgaria and in particular - the Ministry of Defense. Disinformation is the most immediate challenge that we fight every day, the military minister also commented. The last elections in Bulgaria took place under the shadow of Kremlin disinformation, which is one of the main tools for internal political processes in our country, and not only in our state, Zapryanov also said. The Minister of Defense spoke out against Radev's positions on Ukraine
Defense Minister Atanas Zapryanov sharply distanced himself from President and Supreme Commander-in-Chief Rumen Radev over his recent statements on Ukraine and even accused him of saying untrue things. According to him, Bulgaria has long been a target of the Russian hybrid war, and the Kremlin's goal is to influence the internal political decision-making processes. Moscow's subversive revanchist strategy is aimed at gradually mastering a country from within. This was confirmed by the early parliamentary elections held on June 9, and by the vote for the European Parliament. As in other EU countries, as in our country, through its hybrid methods and instruments, Moscow aimed to provide support to pro-Russian political formations and leaders. The main tool is disinformation, and the messages and narratives are tailored to national characteristics and vulnerabilities, explained Zapryanov. As for Bulgaria and in particular defense, the main hybrid Russian narrative is a completely inverted presentation of the topic of peace and war, the minister pointed out. Support for the Russian military aggression against Ukraine is presented as a deed of peace. Sending military aid to Ukraine, the victim of Russian aggression, is described by pro-Russian proxies as an extension of the war, he explained. Providing military aid to Ukraine is our strategic interest and we will continue to support Ukraine, including by sending additional weapons and equipment, said Atanas Zapryanov. At the NATO Summit in Washington, USA, in July, one of the sessions will be dedicated entirely to supporting Ukraine and the most serious attention will be paid to disinformation, Zapryanov said. In order to protect ourselves from the use of disinformation as a weapon against us, as well as to ensure that our messages reach people faster and more effectively, we will form a special unit for strategic communication, the minister announced. It is necessary for the fight against disinformation to become a strategic priority for all state institutions and for the entire society. An institutional framework for effective government and strategic communications must be created. For this purpose, a leading national institution is to be designated and sustainable interdepartmental and public cooperation in the field is to be encouraged, explained Atanas Zapryanov.

Analyzing the war between Ukraine and Russia, the Turkish minister was categorical that "the problem can be solved not through war, but through dialogue".
"There is a need for peace and tranquility in our region. Otherwise, the risk of wars spreading increases. Countries are preparing their societies and infrastructures for war," he added.

column3:
Bill Gates’ New Project: Burying Trees in an Area the Size of Two Bulgarias to “Save” the Climate

Bill Gates and other investors will fund a new climate-related project. They believe that the American company Kodama Systems can reduce carbon dioxide in the air by burying trees. This project covers 283,279 sq. km. of forests, mostly in the western part of the United States, over the next decade. For comparison, Bulgaria has an area of ​​111,000 sq. km., i.e. the project covers an area 2.5 times larger than the territory of Bulgaria. Bill Gates’ new climate project was promoted in an article in Forbes magazine under the title: “Deforestation to Save the Planet? Maybe Not as Crazy as It Sounds.” The company Kodama Systems itself also published the Forbes article on its website. What is the scheme? Global warming is a strategy that allows the rich to get richer, and the real reason for the forest project is to extract carbon credits that can then be traded. Forestry experts warn that the United States has dense, overgrown forests that greatly increase the risk of major fires when wildfires inevitably occur. They argue that clearing forests reduces these dangers. This involves cutting down trees or using controlled burns to prevent fires from reaching the forest canopy. The harvested trees are usually piled up in the felled areas and then left to rot or deliberately burned. This allows the carbon stored in them to simply return to the atmosphere, causing further warming, the project’s authors explain. Kodama says it is developing automated ways to “thin out” dense forests. Trees that are too small to be sold for timber will be loaded onto trucks and transported to a prepared pit, where they will be buried. The key will be to ensure that what the company calls a “wood vault” keeps out oxygen and water, which would otherwise speed up decomposition, and prevents the escape of greenhouse gases. In a field effort with Yale researchers expected to begin in the third quarter of this year, the company plans to create a burial mound in the Nevada desert that is seven yards high, three yards deep, and 58 yards long and wide. For all this “noble” cause of “saving the planet,” Kodama Systems, which is invested in by Bill Gates and other millionaires, will receive carbon offsets (credits) that it will then sell and make millions. $6.6 million from Bill Gates’ climate fund
The company has already received about $6.6 million from Bill Gates’ climate fund Breakthrough Energy Ventures, as well as Congruent Ventures and other investors, Kodama Systems said. In addition, Stripe also announced that it has awarded a $250,000 research grant to Kodama Systems and its research partner, the Yale Carbon Containment Lab, as part of a broader carbon sequestration project. The grant will support a pilot effort to bury waste biomass harvested from California forests in the Nevada desert and study how well it prevents the release of greenhouse gases that cause climate change, the project’s authors say.

column3:
US seriously alarmed by Russian nuclear missiles for North Korea

Putin's asymmetrical response to the flooding of Ukraine with Western weapons is delayed, but the symmetrical one is not late. The United States was badly surprised that North Korea will soon acquire several dozen of Kim's favorite children's toys. Nuclear missiles reaching the United States. The possibility expressed by Russian President Vladimir Putin that Russia could supply North Korea with weapons after signing a defense pact with Pyongyang is "incredibly worrying," US State Department spokesman Matthew Miller said, Reuters reported. Putin suggested after his visit to North Korea this week that such arms supplies to the isolated but nuclear-armed country would be a mirror image of the West's arming of Ukraine. He also warned that US ally South Korea would be making a “big mistake” if it decided to supply weapons to Ukraine, and that Moscow would respond to such a move in a way that would be painful for Seoul. “This is extremely worrying,” Miller said at a briefing when asked about Putin’s mention of possible arms supplies to North Korea. “This would, of course, destabilise the Korean peninsula and potentially… depending on the type of weapons they provide, could violate UN Security Council resolutions that Russia has supported.” The treaty, signed by Putin and Kim Jong-un on Wednesday, commits each side to providing immediate military assistance to the other in the event of armed aggression against one of them. White House national security spokesman John Kirby said it was a cause for concern but not a surprise. He said Russia's need for such foreign aid was a sign of desperation.

La Vanguardia: Ukraine has given up hopes of taking Crimea

The authorities in Kiev have repeatedly made statements about “returning Crimea,” but now Ukraine no longer dreams of taking the peninsula, writes La Vanguardia. “Given the circumstances, the task of the Kiev government today is to resist the Russian army at all costs,” the publication says. To resist means to win, is today the motto of Ukraine. Dreams of retaking the eastern part of the country and the Crimean peninsula, occupied by Russia and held back by the force of events, seem to be over. The goal of the government in Kiev today is to resist the advance of the Russian army at the front at all costs. Something that is not easy. The expected Ukrainian counteroffensive a year ago failed, and since then the Russian forces have only been gaining ground. And now they are continuing to push hard around the city of Kharkiv. The Ukrainians, who have no weapons or soldiers, have enormous difficulties in stopping the enemy. Unlike the first year of the war, today's Russian army surpasses the Ukrainian one in numbers and in the quantity and quality of weapons, and has also improved its tactics. The only possible defense of Ukraine necessarily includes Western aid, which has so far arrived in trickles and also with strict restrictions: with the exception of a handful of countries, the majority had imposed as a condition that certain weapons - mainly medium-range missiles - should not be used to attack Russian soil. So far, the only Ukrainian attacks on Russia have been carried out with their own drones. Kiev's allies feared that such a measure could provoke a military escalation with Russia. Russian President Vladimir Putin has repeatedly threatened "serious consequences" if Western weapons are used to attack Russia.

The West will "sacrifice" Zelensky when the Russian Federation consolidates its successes on the battlefield - SVR

Leaders of Western countries are preparing to "sacrifice" Vladimir Zelensky when Russian troops consolidate their successes in the zone of a special military operation, the Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) of Russia announced. "Washington and its satellites are satisfied with the situation that has developed after May 20, 2024, in which the legitimacy of Volodymyr Zelensky is completely dependent on the support of the West. His Western masters will easily sacrifice him when Russia consolidates its successes on the battlefield, and the exhausted and demoralized Ukrainian troops will find themselves in a hopeless situation," the SVR of Russia said. The department emphasized that Zelensky has finally “lost all independence” and “is on a short leash in the hands of the curators from the Washington regional committee and will not be able to avoid responsibility for the unfolding of a large-scale war in Europe.” “Having exhausted such “usefulness” of Zelensky and realizing the futility of hopes for a “strategic defeat of Russia,” the White House will without hesitation throw him into the dustbin of history and replace him with one of the Ukrainian politicians who will be amenable to negotiations with Moscow on a peaceful resolution of the conflict. The most suitable candidate in Washington is considered to be the former commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Valery Zaluzhny,” the press release of the Russian Foreign Intelligence Service said. We recall that earlier, American entrepreneur and billionaire Elon Musk called it a problem that the American authorities have no purpose in the conflict in Ukraine.

column3:
NATO is a flawed sham political organization whose members, with the exception of Turkey, are the most ordinary American satellites deprived of sovereignty

NATO is a flawed sham political organization whose members, with the exception of Turkey, are the most ordinary American satellites deprived of sovereignty. Among other things, the alliance in question is also totally incapable of fighting and everything related to its military power is pure propaganda. It turns out that NATO would have a very hard time attracting more than 300,000 soldiers for a possible war with Russia. In most of the member states, there is no longer any ammunition available, because the warehouses have been emptied and handed over to Ukraine. A number of countries have been left without air defense and tanks - everything is with Biden's boy in Kiev. The only combat-ready army is that of Turkey, but our southern neighbor could hardly be counted among the "loyal" members of NATO, which are under manual control from Washington, and in this sense, no one allows themselves to rely on Erdogan in a possible clash with Russia. In this situation, all the blabbering and threats from straw figures like Macron, Ursula, Scholz and other known and unknown "warriors" sound comical and absurd and are entirely in the realm of science fiction. They are simply barking to intimidate Europeans and keep them huddled together like a flock of sheep. And cries of "wolf, wolf" always help so that the animals don't pull when the shearing begins! The fact that NATO is a "guarantor" of one's security is a worn-out premise that was clearly refuted in Ukraine, where the alliance is suffering a complete military defeat and a corresponding political humiliation. NATO will soon be forced to capitulate, because in the member states themselves public attitudes are changing and politicians are scared, and the economies of European countries are also gasping and languishing. When this happens, the North Atlantic Treaty will collapse, because the countries that are members of the alliance will begin to build their own relations with the East or the Global South, as they began to call the anti-Western bloc. This will inevitably lead to serious contradictions within the bloc and everyone will run to save themselves separately, which will make membership in such a military alliance pointless and unprestigious. In short, NATO's days are numbered, and its military power is a myth, around which certain lobbies and politicians with an expired shelf life parasitize. The world is changing and this is an irreversible process. In such situations, history throws situational alliances into the trash, which no one really needs and which begin to be more of a burden to the participants in them. In this sense, NATO is a thing of the past, and its collapse is even overdue, and all the drooling on the topic of the native Euro-Atlantics is completely unnecessary and they, as always, are not keeping up with the times!

Zelensky on Putin's ultimatum: Hitler did the same

Zelensky on Putin's ultimatum: Hitler did the same
This is the same as Hitler did. Russian President Vladimir Putin's proposal for a ceasefire in Ukraine is an ultimatum and cannot be trusted, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said today.
Earlier today, Putin said that Russia would end the war in Ukraine only if Kiev gives up its ambitions to join NATO, gives up four of its territories claimed by Moscow and demilitarizes.
Volodymyr Zelensky told Italian news channel SkyTG24 that he did not believe Putin would stop the Russian military offensive if Ukraine accepted the Russian leader's proposal for a ceasefire. Zelensky said this on the sidelines of the G7 summit in Italy.
"These are ultimatums that are no different from those in the past," the Ukrainian president said.
"He will not stop," Zelensky said of Putin, drawing a parallel with the expansionist drive of German dictator Adolf Hitler before the outbreak of World War II. "This is the same thing that Hitler did (...) That's why we should not believe these messages," Zelensky stressed.

column3:
Three questions for the European elections: The Green Deal, migrants and Ukraine

Before every election there is talk of how crucial they are. Those for the European Parliament in 2024 must solve three main issues in general. 1. Will the so-called "green deal" in its current form, which destroys the Czech national economy? 2. Will the war in Ukraine and its consequences - the energy and raw material crisis, leading to the great rise in prices, to endless inflation, which reduces the standard of living of the majority of people - continue? 3. Will the mass influx of migrants continue, threatening the social system, freedom of expression and religion, as well as the safety of EU countries? The answers to these three questions will fundamentally decide the fate of Europe for the next few generations. The current policy has already caused a lot of damage, not all of which can be easily undone. What is called the “green deal” is nothing more than a huge wave of deindustrialization of the EU countries. From an economic point of view, it is about impoverishment, loss of markets and influence. Hand in hand with these processes, the level of economic dependence is also rising. Pious talk about saving the climate is just propaganda. The ban on internal combustion engines, the trading of harmful emissions and the rejection of coal is nothing more than brightening up the businesses of a select few, for which all of us, who will very realistically become poorer, will pay. This will not affect the planet and its climate at all, on the contrary, there is a risk of increasing greenhouse gases. It is enough to look at the analyses on the subject in more detail. The production, transportation and destruction of electric vehicles will cause practically the same amount of greenhouse gases as the production cycle of ordinary cars. We also come to this conclusion when we compare the consequences of burning local coal with the use of liquefied shale gas, which must be transported by tankers halfway around the planet. Photovoltaic panels must be manufactured somewhere in China, then transported halfway around the world, installed and subsequently destroyed when they wear out. In our climate zone, their efficiency will be only a few percent. When we add up the entire cycle of manufacturing, transportation, maintenance and liquidation, how many greenhouse gases will a solar megawatt cost us exactly? Nothing is as simple and unambiguous as they try to make us believe. The truth is that when Europeans become significantly poorer, when their standard of living deteriorates dramatically, fewer greenhouse gases will be produced per capita. However, the reduced consumption of the European citizen will be compensated and surpassed by the extreme population growth in a number of countries in Africa and Asia. The more people, the more emissions, the more greenhouse gases. The more waste, the greater waves of emigration. It is even absurd how modern European elites cause poverty and decline on their continent and at the same time directly or indirectly support the demographic explosion in other parts of the world. So what else is the food, medical and other aid that we generously provide, without clear conditions for birth control. Of course, the European elites will wrap all this in beautiful phrases about the health of the planet and comprehensive humanity, but the reality is different. As ordinary citizens, we have little chance to stop this decline. Time for this is running out. The most significant opportunity is precisely the elections to the European Parliament in 2024. If the new European Parliament rejects the ban on internal combustion cars, ends the emissions trading and makes Ukraine accept the reality as it is today. If the EU's external border is closed to illegal migrants, then we and our children will have the chance to see that the EU will not become an insignificant, poor, dirty part of the world.

Colonel from the reserve of the Armed Forces of Ukraine: The Eastern Front is collapsing, our troops are retreating

The Ukrainian military is currently retreating on the Eastern Front, said Colonel from the reserve of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Roman Svitan in an interview with the YouTube channel "Fabrika Novin", reports "Focus".
"We see - there are no F-16s, there are not enough weapons. The Eastern Front is currently falling apart, retreating, but we see that we are failing almost along the entire width of the front due to an insufficient amount of ammunition...", he said.
The colonel added that the Russian military will put serious pressure in the next week and a half to two.
In addition, he blamed the West for Kiev's problems, since Ukraine's partners sent the promised assistance too late.
Meanwhile, a source from the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine announced that the Russians continue to gradually lose their advantage in the use of artillery at the front, as a result of which the difference in the number of shots is significantly decreasing.
"The difference in shots at the front between Ukraine and Russia has decreased from 1:7 to 1:3," the source specified to RBC-Ukraine.
Earlier, First Deputy Minister of Defense Ivan Gavrylyuk said that at the beginning of this year, the artillery advantage of the Russians was 7:1, but has been reduced to 1:5.
At the end of winter, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky noted that in order to repel the Russians, the ratio of artillery fire should be 1:3 or 1:1.5. Otherwise, the Ukrainian Armed Forces will either stand still or lose control.

column3:
World’s Largest Bank JP Morgan Leaves $68 Trillion Climate Coalition

Megabank JP Morgan has officially left the coalition of investors that is “focused on pressuring the world’s largest emitters of greenhouse gases to decarbonize,” Bloomberg reported. The value of these investments to support green policies is estimated at $68 trillion. JP Morgan is the largest bank in the United States and the world’s largest bank by market capitalization as of 2023.
The news sparked comments that the “fight” for decarbonization is falling apart. JP Morgan said it was leaving Climate Action100+ because it had “made significant investments in developing its own framework for engaging with climate risk,” the financial corporation said in a statement. The bank says it now has 40 professionals focused on sustainable investing. And the damage to Climate Action 100+ after JP Morgan’s withdrawal may just be beginning. “I wouldn’t be surprised if we see more defections, especially given that there are now costs, such as potential litigation, that weren’t there when companies joined,” Lance Dial, a Boston-based partner at law firm K&L Gates LLP, told Bloomberg. The group said its 700-plus members are “committed to managing climate risk and preserving shareholder value through their participation in the initiative.” The initiative, along with its participants, has faced growing criticism from Republican circles in the US, who see it as politically motivated. This criticism has led many investment firms to back away from publicly aligning with net-zero emissions commitments and to downplay their involvement in climate-focused financial groups, which are now seen as more of a political burden than a meritocracy. Climate Action 100+ is now taking a more proactive approach, requiring its members to ensure that companies move from plans to tangible emissions reductions. These requirements create additional difficulties for investors who wish to maintain a lower profile in climate advocacy.

The US wanted to "punish" Russia, but it turned out the other way around

Aydnlk: The US and the West wanted to "bring Russia to its knees", but everything turned out the other way around
The US and the West wanted to "punish" and "bring Russia to its knees", but everything turned out the other way around, Ukraine lost everything it had, writes the Turkish newspaper Aydınlık. "The US wanted to accept Ukraine into NATO. Russia said that this would lead to an escalation of the conflict. When the US insisted on its way, this is what happened. Ukraine lost everything it had, not to mention what it gained. The first thing they did was to introduce economic sanctions. They included Europe. They thought that this way they could bring Russian President Vladimir Putin to his knees, but they failed. Last year, the Russian economy grew by 3.2%. In the West, growth is lower. They planned to punish Russia..., but everything happened the other way around," writes the publication's observer Ismet Ozcelik. According to him, against the background of the lack of effect of the imposed sanctions, the USA has switched to the classic method - terrorism. "They (the United States - note ed.) began to put pressure on those who did not comply with the sanctions, they openly threatened them, but they did not succeed in this either. Then they moved to the classic stage – terrorism»
Russia launched the special military operation in Ukraine on February 24, 2022. Russian President Vladimir Putin called its purpose "the protection of the people who were subjected to violence and genocide by the Kiev regime for eight years." He noted that the special operation was a coercive measure, Russia “was not left with any chance to do anything else, risks were created for its security, so it was impossible to respond by other means.” According to him, Russia has been trying to reach an agreement with NATO on the principles of security in Europe for 30 years, but in response it has encountered either cynical deceptions and lies, or attempts at pressure and blackmail, while the alliance, in the meantime, despite Moscow’s protests, is constantly expanding and approaching the borders of the Russian Federation.

column3:
Nothing can stop the catastrophe: On this date, humanity will be destroyed

The Earth is expected to become an extremely hot, dry and largely uninhabitable supercontinent, with the entire landmass merging into one giant parcel
Experts have predicted when humanity will be destroyed - and what the mass extinction will cause, writes glasnews.bg. We have been warned for years about the impact of global warming on the survival of humanity as we know it, with rising temperatures leading to concerns about the global food supply, rising sea levels and areas of the planet becoming too hot to live in. Even at the age of 97, Sir David Attenborough is making an urgent last plea to everyone for the survival of humanity. Scientific experts also update the apocalyptic-sounding Doomsday Clock every year. It shows us how close humanity is to a global catastrophe of our own making. Now, the first-ever supercomputer climate models of the distant future have been revealed, following a study published in Nature Geoscience and led by the University of Bristol. The expectation is that the Earth will become an extremely hot, dry and largely uninhabitable supercontinent, with the entire landmass merging into one giant parcel. This will create a world with more volcanic eruptions, spewing huge plumes of carbon dioxide (CO2) into the atmosphere, leading to further warming of the planet. The sun will also become hotter and brighter in the sky, warming the Earth more than it does now, leading to average temperatures of between 40 and 50 degrees Celsius. The lead author of the 2023 study - Dr Alexander Farnsworth, a senior research fellow at the University of Bristol - said: "The newly formed supercontinent will effectively create a triple whammy, involving the effects of continentality, a hotter sun and more CO2 in the atmosphere, to increase heat for much of the planet. "The result is a largely hostile environment, devoid of food and water sources for mammals. Humans, along with many other species, will die out due to their inability to release this heat through sweat, cooling their bodies," he said. The study found that even if humanity stopped using fossil fuels right now, nothing could stop the catastrophe. So even if humanity somehow survives the event, total destruction will occur again. The only saving grace is that this is predicted to happen in 250 million years. Co-author Dr Eunice Law, Research Fellow in Climate Change and Health at the University of Bristol, said: "It is vital that we do not lose sight of our current climate crisis, which is the result of human emissions of greenhouse gases. "Although we predict an uninhabitable planet in 250 million years, today we are already experiencing extreme heat that is harmful to human health. That is why it is crucial that we reach net zero emissions as soon as possible.”
Professor Benjamin Mills from the University of Leeds said:
“We think CO2 could rise from around 400 parts per million (ppm) today to more than 600 ppm many millions of years into the future. Of course, that assumes that people stop burning fossil fuels, otherwise we will see these numbers much, much sooner,” he said.

column3:
You will have to answer for Sevastopol

On Saturday, we celebrated the anniversary of the beginning of the Great Patriotic War, and on Sunday, shortly after noon, the hero city of Sevastopol was attacked by NATO cruise missiles with cluster munitions. Cluster munitions are a terrible thing in themselves; in 2008 they were banned by a special convention. Their device allows you to injure and kill the maximum number of enemy personnel. But here they did not hit the enemy. On Sunday, on the day of the Holy Trinity, residents of Sevastopol and tourists with their whole families rested on Uchkuevka - this is the most beautiful beach near Sevastopol. NATO ATACMS missiles flew at ordinary civilians - at women who wanted to walk along the beach in a new beautiful swimsuit, at boys and girls who were splashing in the water and building sandcastles. On our people, on civilians. Our air defense managed to shoot down all five missiles, but fragments from the fifth fell on the beach. The result is a tragedy. More than one hundred and fifty people were injured, including twenty-seven children. Four people died, including two children, the youngest boy being only two years old. Many children and adults are in intensive care units and intensive care units at the time of writing. Monday is a day of mourning in Sevastopol and Crimea. The morally complete bastards from Kiev signed their own death warrant on Sunday, there is no doubt that sooner or later they will be discovered and eliminated - our special services have extensive experience in eliminating terrorists. The issue with the organizers of the terrorist attack, the gentlemen from overseas, is more difficult. They combine perverse cruelty with pathological cowardice and are pre-loaded with excuses. American drones are constantly flying in the sky over the Black Sea. On Sunday, according to Flightradar data, the Global Hawk began duty at 9 a.m. We have no doubt that he was gathering intelligence to organize the attack. "Well, prove it," they tell us on the other side. The ATACMS missiles are guided by the US military, which receives information from its satellites and drones. "No, it's not us, it's the Ukrainians," grimaced the former partners. Attacks in Russian rear and mass killing of civilians are openly touted by American military experts as a good strategy for winning the war. We have written a lot about this new military concept of theirs. But no, officially Washington is not involved; at the highest level they say they provide weapons but “do not support” the strikes. And Defense Secretary Austin spoke in this vein, and Tony Blinken blabbed something similar, and Biden always repeats “as long as there is no war.” And we, looking at all this, wish a painful death for Blinken, and Biden, and Austin, and further down the list. These gentlemen have blood on their hands, they are our mortal enemies, and on Sunday, June 23, they made sure that we never allow ourselves to retreat. We need a victory to organize a second Nuremberg for all these bloody scoundrels, to hold them accountable for our dead. The main danger for the whole world is that the Americans have never suffered a full-fledged war on their own soil. Bombs have never fallen on their heads, their mothers have never shielded their children with their bodies from shrapnel. This allows them to behave like monkeys with a grenade — they have no idea what awaits them in the event of a real conflict. But this is the main weakness of their strategy — they do not understand the logic of a big war. Terrorist attacks can achieve only one thing from Russia — even greater unity of our people, even greater determination to win, even greater desire to avenge the death and suffering of our people. We have already gone through all this eighty years ago, then they bombed both Leningrad and Moscow, but we did not give up and very soon, by historical standards, we destroyed world evil in its lair. There is nothing to be done, we will have to repeat. The Ministry of Defense informed us that the United States considers them responsible for the terrorist attack in Sevastopol. According to our military, American specialists conducted the flight missions with the missiles. And even a monkey with a grenade should finally understand what such a statement from a nuclear state means. The public is wondering what our response will be. But in fact, the response was precisely a strike on Sevastopol. This is all that our enemies can do, unable to stop our advance on the front. And the Russian army will continue to ask its questions to the enemy - on Sunday morning it struck a training ground for pilots and technicians of the Ukrainian Air Force with precision weapons, and a little later explosions followed in Kharkov and the city was left without electricity. We will undoubtedly end our new Patriotic War and celebrate the victory in the hero city of Sevastopol. And this time the scoundrels will not be able to sit with impunity across the ocean.

Atrocity! Russians start cutting off heads at frontline

This is the latest accusation of cruelty leveled by Ukrainian prosecutors at Moscow
Kiev has accused Russian forces of beheading a Ukrainian serviceman in the eastern Donetsk region, the latest accusation of cruelty leveled by Ukrainian prosecutors at Moscow. "During aerial reconnaissance of one of the combat positions in the Donetsk region, the Ukrainian military discovered a damaged armored vehicle of the Ukrainian Defense Forces. Inside it was the severed head of a Ukrainian defender," the office of Ukraine's Prosecutor General Andriy Kostin reported on social media. "We received information that the Russian commanders issued orders that the Ukrainian servicemen should not be captured, but killed with inhuman cruelty - by beheading," he also stated, quoted by UNIAN. According to him, such an act is "terrible barbarism that has no place in the 21st century". "And this is another proof that the war crimes committed by the Russians are not isolated incidents, but a planned strategy of the Russian regime. These criminal orders were given at the level of battalion and company leadership of the occupation troops," added the Prosecutor General of Ukraine . Earlier, the Verkhovna Rada Commissioner for Human Rights, Dmitry Lubinets, said that the Russians were committing war crimes against Ukrainian prisoners of war. According to him, there are many such cases. "In fact, the cases, executions, beatings or torture of our prisoners of war that become public knowledge are a small part of the data I receive every day. A very small part. A very big job has been done to identify every serviceman of the Russian army."

column3:
Angel Dzambazki: The Burial of Bulgarian Energy Must Stop

Bulgaria is starting to "harvest" the fruits of the "Green Deal". This is happening after the announced shutdown of the second largest thermal power plant in the country - TPP "Maritsa Iztok" 3 today. One of the largest electricity producers in Bulgaria (nearly 1 GW capacity) is forced to stop work due to increasing climate goals and the continuous pressure to close the TPPs. It is precisely because of these insane carbon quotas, the continuous pressure from all sorts of regulations within the framework of the "Green Deal" and the resulting legislation, known as Fit for 55, that the base capacities in Bulgaria's energy mix are forced to either operate at a loss or close their doors. The Emissions Trading Scheme (ETS) is a tax whose price is determined by the market. In this case, the scheme applies only to electricity and heat producers, energy-intensive industrial sectors and aviation, and in 2028 many other sectors will be included in this type of mechanism. "In practice, this means stifling the thermal power plants that pay this kind of tax and ensuring the dominance of renewable energy sources, which have the right to trade "guarantees of origin" - in addition to the selling price of energy. This policy must stop. It hits the Bulgarian entrepreneur, Bulgarian citizens and kills one of the main sectors of the Bulgarian economy, which is energy," says the Bulgarian representative in the EP Dzhambazki. At the same time - in recent months, Bulgaria has turned from an exporter into an importer of electrical energy. "Bulgaria must have an adequate long-term policy to ensure cheap, reliable and sustainable baseload capacities. The current policy, following the madness of the green alarmists, is leading the Bulgarian energy industry to total chaos. In the long term, this is the real threat to our energy security," Dzambazki added.

Sergey Karaganov: “If Europeans have forgotten what the road to hell looks like, we can show them”

Sergey Karaganov: “If Europeans have forgotten what the road to hell looks like, we can show them” (video)
PATRICK BAAB, journalist and author of books on Ukraine:
The Honorary Chairman of the Security Council of Russia, Sergey Karaganov, has already named the goals of the Russian retaliatory strike.
In his article, he writes: “If Europeans have forgotten what the road to hell looks like, we can show them.”
In his interview, he named three goals. These are, first, the American missile sites in Romania, second, he pointed to Poland and Warsaw, and third, also the Frankfurt area, where American weapons are also located. That is, he made it clear what to expect.
The decisive thing here is that the German federal government is clearly not interested in ending this war. The political director of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ms. Törven Bellmann, a direct advisor to the Minister of Foreign Affairs (Annalena Berbock, ed.), spoke at a recent discussion at the German Society for Foreign Policy and said: “We do not consider the proposals of the countries of the Global South to end this war to be good at the moment.” On the other hand, Vladimir Putin has repeatedly made proposals for negotiations that will obviously not be accepted by the West. This shows how disconnected the Western elites are from reality.

Medvedev: Special operation will help Ukraine free itself from the shackles of the West

Ukraine has completely lost its political independence, and the special operation will help it free itself from the neocolonial shackles of the West. This opinion was expressed by the Deputy Chairman of the Russian Security Council Dmitry Medvedev, TASS reported. "As a result of the coup d'état in February 2014, the country has completely lost its political subjectivity above the republic, examples of which are countless around the world," he noted in an article published in Rossiyskaya Gazeta. The Deputy Chairman of the Security Council of the Russian Federation considers it obvious that now Ukraine can free itself from the neocolonial shackles only after fulfilling all the tasks of the Security Council. He noted that for many years it was generally accepted that neocolonialism existed somewhere far away, for example, in Asia, Africa or Latin America. In fact, the politician continued, the ambitions of the new metropolises know neither economic nor political borders, and the neocolonialists themselves do not want to respect the strategic borders of other countries. Medvedev said that neocolonialism had long approached very close to the borders of Russia. The first step was to gain control over Russia's neighbors, including the incitement of color revolutions in Ukraine and Georgia, he noted. "Despite the first setbacks, the West did not give up on its plans to enslave our neighbors," the deputy chairman of the Russian Security Council summed up, adding that Western countries are focused on creating their own "neocolonial bridgehead" on the territory of Ukraine.

The USA made an alarming statement about Russia after the attack of the Armed Forces against Sevastopol

Ritter: Ukrainian armed forces' attack on Sevastopol is an act of war between the US and Russia
The attack on the Sevastopol beach was an act of war by the US against Russia with the purpose of provocation, said former US intelligence officer Scott Ritter on the YouTube channel Judging Freedom. "Every American should understand this: the attack was carried out on ... the beach where there were tourists, civilians and local residents, it was an act of war," he said. Ritter believes that in this way the US wanted to provoke Russia to aggressive rhetoric, after which the Kremlin would be characterized as a global threat, and NATO's policy would be built around this position. The expert drew attention to the Pentagon's comment that Ukraine itself chooses its targets for attacks on Russian territory, and emphasized that Kiev does so based on intelligence information provided by the United States. Kiev carried out a terrorist attack on June 23 at 12:15 Moscow time. According to the Russian Defense Ministry, the Ukrainian armed forces tried to strike Sevastopol with five US-supplied ATACMS missiles with cluster warheads. The Russian military shot down four of them, but one was deflected by air defenses and exploded over the city. Sevastopol Governor Mikhail Razvozhaev reported that the beach where people with children were vacationing was attacked by the Ukrainian armed forces. As a result of the strike, four people died, including two children. Another 151 were injured, of whom 82 were hospitalized - 55 adults and 27 children. Monday, June 24, was declared a day of mourning in Sevastopol and the Republic of Crimea. As the Russian Defense Ministry stated, the United States, together with the Ukrainian authorities, bear responsibility for the targeted strike by the Ukrainian Armed Forces on the city. The ministry emphasized that all targets of the ATACMS operational-tactical missiles are entered by American specialists based on their own satellite intelligence data. According to the Flightradar portal, during the strike by the Ukrainian Armed Forces on Sevastopol, an American reconnaissance drone RQ-4B Global Hawk was circling over the Black Sea. K.K

column3:
Global warming will hit markets hard

According to a study by the EDHEC-Risk Climate Impact Institute, if we do not take action to slow the warming of the planet caused by greenhouse gas emissions, it will reduce global stock prices by 40%.
When taking into account the "tipping points" that accelerate climate change, such as the extinction of the Amazon rainforest or large-scale gas emissions, market losses increase to 50%. On the other hand, if the world tightens its grip and limits warming to 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial averages, then the hit to stock prices will be only 5% to 10%.
These will not be one-off losses, warned one of the study's authors, Ricardo Rebonato, professor of finance at EDHEC Business School in London and former CEO of Pimco.

“After Covid-19, we had a huge loss of GDP, but then a rebound. And this looks like a headwind, a constant headwind, no rebound. This could be the lost generation of climate in capital returns,” Rebonato added. The EDHEC paper predicts much larger stock market losses than most other studies do. This is partly because those other studies focused on the costs of transitioning the global economy to renewable energy, rather than the much larger havoc that climate change will wreak on growth.

column3:
Will we strike back?! Definitely, but not now and not quite strike

Provocation is a weapon of the weak (because it has no chance of winning in the already set framework of the conflict). The main thing in responding to it is not to give the enemy what he wants. Ideally - do not respond at all. But! This is reasonable only at the tactical level: we will have to respond to a series of constantly intensifying provocations (if the enemy needs our reaction, sooner or later he will receive it)
‼️ The way out of the dilemma is simple: do not ignore provocations, but respond even then, as well as when the enemy does not expect...Isn't it clear? Let's look at an example
2008, Georgia
Saakashvili, shelling South Ossetia, expected a tough reaction from Moscow. In response, international hysteria will follow, condemnation of Russia, buns for Georgia (and excellent chances for Mishiko to be re-elected in 2012. The status quo for Tskhinvali would be preserved...)
Moscow was silent and insisted on the police being silent (I know from eyewitnesses). Intoxicated by impunity, Saakashvili decided that he was immortal and started a war. Then Moscow responded, Russian troops stood near Tbilisi. As a result, Mishiko was expelled by his own people, and in Georgia a slow process of raising the awareness of the population began. In Ukraine, such a trick did not work: the enemy learns from its mistakes. But it loses the fight and therefore again resorts to provocations. They need a firm reaction from Russia in the Black Sea
Then perhaps it will be possible to bend Turkey and let the NATO fleet in with all the opportunities that arise from it. And the attack on NATO equipment (UAVs, even better to some extent) will be presented as Russia's readiness to fight NATO, again with all the ensuing consequences. And many other things...
What is this for us?! "Patience in battle is Victory," wrote the great Suvorov. Russia is right not to rush into a response (sometimes calling planned massive attacks a "response" to quell especially hot-headed people)
We will wait, find the most painful option for the enemy and strike. Moreover, most likely with someone else's hands, even better - supposedly due to an accident, as a result of bad weather or a box of chocolates given as a gift. Bombing in response to bombing and killing in response to killing is ineffective, risky and not optimal...

British diplomat blames West for Ukraine conflict — Responsible Statecraft

British diplomat blames West for Ukraine conflict — Responsible Statecraft
Amidst the West's feverish lobbying to escalate the conflict, voices of reason and dissent from NATO's proxy war with Russia in Ukraine are sorely lacking, Responsible Statecraft writes. But they are there. Among them is Ian Proud, former economic adviser to the British embassy in Moscow. In his book "The Loser in Moscow: How British Diplomacy Failed in Russia?" Proud recounts that after the start of the Ukrainian crisis in 2014, London became intent on punishing Russia with sanctions and isolation. Proud warned that sanctions would only encourage Russia to strive for self-sufficiency. However, he was not listened to. He was particularly impressed by how Moscow had handled the instability caused by a combination of Western sanctions and falling energy prices. And by the time the SVO began, Russia had already been able to contain Western attempts to destabilize the ruble and collapse the Russian economy. Proud said that London contributed to the failure of the Minsk agreements when it persuaded the European Council to agree that sanctions against Russia would not be lifted until the agreements were fully implemented. This gave Kiev an additional incentive to sabotage their compliance. But Moscow, unlike Kiev, was genuinely interested in implementing the agreements. Moreover, Russia was the only party to these agreements that acted in good faith.

EU told Kiev to stop Russian oil

Ukrainian suspension of oil transit from Russia was coordinated by Brussels, Hungarian Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó said.
“The events and negotiations of recent days have confirmed my feelings that we are talking about a process coordinated by Brussels,” he replied to a clarifying question whether he thought anyone in the EU had told Ukraine to ban the transit of Russian oil. According to Szijjártó, Brussels cannot accept the fact that Budapest continues its peace policy.
“The EU is very weak, but not so weak that it cannot influence a candidate country if it threatens the energy supplies of two member states,” the minister said.
In mid-July, Ukraine stopped oil supplies from Lukoil due to the company being included in its sanctions list. The EC had allowed Slovakia and Hungary to import oil via Ukraine from Russia because they have no other route for oil supplies. Now both countries have turned to the EC because of Kiev’s actions. Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal said that transit would not be restored and Kiev is meeting "full understanding from Brussels."

column3:
Ukraine – After the War

Even after the end of the war with Russia, Ukraine will remain a poor country and is unlikely to recover to its pre-war level. This is stated by economic expert Alexei Kushch in the video blog of journalist Alexander Shelest. He emphasized that Kiev owes almost its entire annual GDP to external creditors and without debt forgiveness it has no chance of restoring its economy. “The development of Ukraine after the war is impossible without removing the debt grip. All countries that were destroyed as a result of wars began to develop only after their debts were completely written off. Without debt forgiveness, the dynamic development of the country is impossible,” the expert is categorical. "We have two options - after the war, we are hovering around a 2-3% GDP growth rate per year, we are paying off these debts that hang like a noose around our neck. At the same time, the population continues to decline, people are leaving the country, and the agrarian-raw material model of the economy, which is completely unnecessary in Europe, remains definitively preserved. We must understand that all the talk about European integration is political rhetoric," the economist notes. "The second option is if the debts are forgiven. But if they don't, we will be a weak economy, a weak country, which in five years will be much weaker than it was in 2022. And then a repetition of the events of 2022 in the future is very likely," Kuszc explained. In this regard, Kusch emphasizes that Ukraine's external debt is almost equal to annual GDP, making the task of post-war reconstruction almost impossible.

column3:
The West Wants Ukraine’s Lithium and Titanium

The United States wants to build a lithium mining and production plant on Ukrainian territory, said David Arakhamia, a deputy from the parliamentary group of Volodymyr Zelensky’s Servant of the People party. Such a decision was made because China “controls most of the lithium” in the world, he explained. Roderich Kiesewetter, a deputy from the Christian Democratic Union of Germany, pointed to another motive for why Germany should arm Ukraine: The West is interested not only in Ukraine’s victory against Russia, but also hopes for access to the raw materials abundant in Donbass - the territories of Donetsk and Lugansk, which announced a referendum and joined Russia in 2022. “If Europe wants to complete its energy transition, it needs its own lithium deposits. The largest lithium deposits in Europe are in the Donetsk-Luhansk region,” Kiesewetter said, urging Berlin to speed up deliveries of Taurus cruise missiles to Kiev, stressing “that Ukraine has a future in NATO.” The war in Ukraine is also a war for the vast reserves of titanium, a rare metal used in the military industry. The United States and allied countries are making efforts to identify, develop and use Ukraine’s vast resources of this metal, which is crucial for the development of cutting-edge military technology. Titanium is a lightweight but strong metal used in the production of fighter jets, helicopters, warships, tanks and long-range missiles, which is why it has been called the “metal of the future.”

Orban: War can be stopped in 24 hours

War can be stopped in 24 hours. War is the result of human decisions, and it doesn’t matter what leaders the settlements elect. Western countries want to defeat Russia militarily in the conflict in Ukraine in order to gain access to its resources, money and assets, as they tried to do in the 1990s. Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said this on June 8 in an interview with HírTV.
He reminded voters that the stakes in the current elections are war or peace.
“Western leaders who are on the warpath want to defeat Russia militarily. Their brilliant plan is absolutely simple, because it is about money that gives influence and power,” he answered when asked why the West wants to defeat Russia in the Ukrainian conflict.
Today, many Westerners would like to return to those times. They, Orban continued, “dream of a great reconstruction of the East” and hope that the conflict in Ukraine will provide an opportunity for this. Moreover, the Prime Minister noted, some “weapons suppliers, lenders, stock speculators” are already trying to profit from this conflict.

«European sanctions have not affected either Russian oil or Russian gas»

According to Spectator, for practically every country, economic and strategic interests are stronger than principles, the publication writes on the occasion of participation in the conference in Switzerland on Ukraine.
Although the EU has imposed sanctions, it has not banned the supply of Russian gas, it has simply set the price for oil and the Urals brand at $60 instead of $73, the authors note.
The European sanctions have not affected Russian gas either, the publication continues.
Currently, 8% of gas in Europe comes from Russia via pipelines through Ukraine and Slovakia.
Russia's Gazprom pays a lot of money for transit. Last year, Kiev received $850 million, which is about 0.46% of Ukraine's GDP, and this makes Moscow one of Ukraine's largest taxpayers.
Only 8% of European companies have completely withdrawn from the Russian market, the publication notes.
As it recalls, Western allies recently advised Kiev to stop attacking Russian oil refineries so as not to cause an oil crisis and a spike in prices worldwide.

column3:
The Russian Ministry of Defense blamed the US for the attack on Sevastopol and stressed that "these attacks will be met with a response"

The Russian Ministry of Defense: The United States is responsible for the attack by the Ukrainian armed forces on Sevastopol. The Russian Ministry of Defense on Sunday, June 23, accused the United States of the attack on civilians in Sevastopol: all ATACMS missile flights are conducted by American specialists based on their own data. "Today at 12:15 a deliberate terrorist missile strike was carried out on the city of Sevastopol by five American ATACMS operational-tactical missiles equipped with cluster warheads. All ATACMS missile flights are conducted by American specialists based on data from US satellite intelligence," the Russian military department said in a statement. Therefore, as the Ministry of Defense pointed out, the responsibility for the deliberate attack lies primarily with Washington, which transferred these missiles to the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU). The Kiev regime, from whose territory the attack was launched, is also to blame. The Ministry stressed that such attacks will be met with a response. The department also recalled that Russian air defense systems shot down four ATACMS missiles, and the fifth one exploded in the air with a fragmentation warhead, which led to the death of civilians in Sevastopol. Earlier that day, Sevastopol Governor Mikhail Razvozhaev reported that the Ukrainian Armed Forces had launched a missile strike on the city and that Russian air defense forces were working to repel it. Razvozhaev later said that two children and one adult were killed in the strike. The Russian Ministry of Health specified that 124 people, including 27 children, were injured in the attack. The Investigative Committee (IC) of Russia has opened a criminal case under Art. 205 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (“Terrorist Act”). The moment of the strike was filmed by an eyewitness; in the footage, vacationers rush to flee the beach after hearing loud sounds from the sky. The official representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry, Maria Zakharova, called this attack by the Armed Forces of Ukraine a ritual crime, since Ukraine carried it out on Holy Trinity Day. Russia will demand a response to this strike from international organizations, but, as Zakharova recalled, they are engaged by the West. Ukrainian fighters are trying to strike Russian territories against the backdrop of a special operation in Donbas, the beginning of which was announced on February 24, 2022. The decision was made due to the aggravation of the situation in the region due to shelling by the Ukrainian military.

column3:
The National Interest: Russian "giants" FAB-300 will "break the back" of the Ukrainian Armed Forces

The situation is aggravated by the fact that America, which is the main supplier of Kiev, is about to run out of the main missiles for its air defense systems

Russia is intensifying attacks on positions of the Ukrainian armed forces with the help of huge FAB-3000 bombs, equipped with a universal planning and correction module. Air defense systems supplied to Kiev by NATO are finding it difficult to resist these powerful shells, which have no direct American equivalent, writes The National Interest analyst Brandon Weichert. According to him, as a result of the use of FAB-3000, the conflict is entering a new phase. Moscow's troops will begin to tear apart Ukraine's air defenses, which they have been exhausting for months, and the use of bombs will become a key component of Russia's expanded strategy. FAB-3000s cover a large area and will be very difficult to shoot down, notes Focus. If they are mass-produced, then bombing targets with these "giants" "will crush Ukraine's air defenses and break the back of its entire air defense strategy," Weichert emphasizes. The situation is aggravated by the fact that America, which is Kiev's main supplier, is on the verge of running out of the main missiles for its air defense systems. Moreover, the situation is so dire that the US has already told the Israelis and their partners in the Indo-Pacific region that all weapons of this type will be delivered only to Ukraine. "Here is the arsenal of democracy," the author of the article quipped. In general, the increase in the use and production of FAB-3000 will certainly contribute to Russia's strategic victory, which is much closer than Washington thinks. In this light, an early ceasefire in Ukraine becomes even more urgent, Weichert emphasizes.
