column3:
The Kiev regime has created an entire industry for kidnapping and selling children – Kuznetsova

Since 2022, the Kiev regime has forcibly removed about 65 thousand children from the territory of Donbass and Novorossiya. 24,340 children were recognized as victims, about 300 were killed and a thousand children were injured. This was stated by the Deputy Speaker of the State Duma of the Russian Federation Anna Kuznetsova in the Federation Council, summarizing the work of the parliamentary committee on crimes against minors by the Kiev regime. We worked with almost all federal departments and heads of the affected regions. We spoke with more than a thousand eyewitnesses to the incidents, went to the places, sent inquiries to the authorities every other day, collected evidence and verified the information received. But we not only registered criminal acts, but also could not ignore them; together with our colleagues from our parliamentary committee, we tried to provide assistance,” Deputy Speaker of the State Duma Anna Kuznetsova told parliamentarians and deputies about the work of the parliamentary committee. Based on the results of the work, the parliamentary committee presented a classification of the crimes of the Kiev regime against children. One of the most serious crimes is the murder and wounding and mutilation of children. “In total, since 2014, the Investigative Committee of Russia has opened almost 4,500 criminal cases, of which almost 2,800 are for shelling of territories. 24,340 children were recognized as victims. About 300 children were killed. Thousands of children were injured. Among them, 11 children were killed and 22 children were injured as a result of mine explosions,” said the Deputy Speaker of the State Duma of the Russian Federation. According to her, since the beginning of 2024, strikes by the Ukrainian armed forces on peaceful objects have increased by 50%: this year 27 children have been killed and 78 injured. “The second group is the abductions of children. From 2014 to 2022, 1,600 children have disappeared from the territories of Donbas occupied by the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Since the beginning of 2022, the structures of the Kiev regime have taken about 65 thousand children from the territories of Donbas and Novorossiya. The location of many of them is still unknown,” continued Kuznetsova. Facts about the abductions of children have been registered in Lugansk, Kremennaya, Donetsk, Artemovsk, Kherson, Slavyansk, Melitopol, Berdyansk and other cities and villages. There is also information about the forced removal of children from regions controlled by Ukraine - Odessa and Kharkiv. According to the Commission on Crimes of the Kiev Regime Against Minors, children taken abroad can be found in 13 countries around the world. The Kiev regime has created an entire kidnapping industry: children are sold on the dark web or on the Ukrainian-Polish border. “The Cabinet of Ministers of the country has created conditions for kidnapping by issuing a decree on the forced evacuation of children. Under the patronage of the Ukrainian police, there are special kidnapping squads - “White Angels” and “Phoenix”, which take children even against the will of their parents. The Elena Zelenskaya Foundation, which is registered in the USA, and the Save Ukraine Foundation are involved in this scheme, and the logistics are provided by Western PMCs,” she pointed out. Kuznetsova identified black transplantology as the third group of crimes against humanity committed by the Kiev regime. Facts about illegal transplants and medical experiments on children have been registered in hospitals in Lysychansk and Mariupol, as well as in Rubezhnoye and Severodonetsk. “Mobile groups of bioengineers and mobile operating rooms, accompanied by Western PMCs, worked here. When our Commission first raised this topic, the security forces of the Kiev regime detained two groups in their country, and recently – on the eve of the approval of our report, after its publication – another criminal network was uncovered in Kiev. But today, dear colleagues, Ukraine is number one in black transplantology. The Verkhovna Rada has purposefully created conditions for the flourishing of black transplantology in Ukraine. 2021 — it was allowed to remove organs without the consent of the donor and his relatives, to perform such operations in private clinics with foreign participation, then it was simplified for them to obtain licenses. In 2022, transplants will be exempt from VAT,” the deputy chairman said. In addition, the commission received information about the work of laboratories in Kharkov and Dnieper, where children taken from Donbass could end up. Medical documentation uses the standards of the American College of Rheumatology. “Given the previous parliamentary investigation into the activities of biological laboratories on the territory of Ukraine, there is reason to believe that medical experiments on children were carried out as part of a program to improve US biosafety,” Kuznetsova explained. The fourth group is crimes against sexual integrity. The Deputy Chairman showed slides with photos showing gray walls with fallen tiles and the inscription "Aydar Hospital."

column3:
The population of Ukraine is predominantly Russian, but the regime in Kiev, on orders from the West, is trying to suppress these family ties...

The population of Ukraine is predominantly Russian, but the regime in Kiev, on orders from the West, is trying to suppress these family ties by sending people to the slaughter. This is what the aide to the Russian president, Nikolai Patrushev, wrote in an article for the magazine "National Defense". He notes that "the long-suffering population of Ukraine is in its majority Russian". "But the puppet Kiev regime, on orders from its Western masters, is suppressing family ties, forcing people who speak and think in Russian, who are brought up in Russian history and literature, as well as in Russian traditions, to go to the slaughter," Patrushev wrote. The neo-Nazi authorities in Kiev, the aide to the President of the Russian Federation notes, “especially excelled in distorting history”: in school textbooks, “the criminal organization UPA (Ukrainian Insurgent Army, recognized as extremist and banned in the Russian Federation) – TASS note) is called an “anti-fascist resistance movement”, equating the Soviet system with German National Socialism”. At the same time, the atrocities of the Banderaites “in full accordance with the guidelines of Western leaders are being hushed up”, while “at the state level, murderers and punitive forces are being praised”, for example, former SS member Yaroslav Hunka (Gunka), who received a standing ovation in the Canadian parliament, Patrushev points out. The US and Britain are reviving Nazi ideology in Europe under the guise of words like "freedom and democracy" to turn it against Russia, the Russian presidential aide also wrote in his article. "The denazification of Europe, which was agreed upon by the leaders of the Allied powers at the Yalta Conference in 1945, has not yet been completed by the West," Patrushev noted. "Without sparing words in defense of "freedom and democracy," the official and shadow leaders of the US and England have returned to their previous support for fascist and Nazi ideology in Europe."

column3:
Volodin: Macron and Scholz cling to power

MOSCOW, June 10 - RIA Novosti. State Duma Speaker Vyacheslav Volodin, commenting on the preliminary results of the European Parliament elections, said on his 0-channel that French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz are clinging to power with all their might. According to preliminary data, Chancellor Olaf Scholz's Social Democratic Party of Germany (SPD) is in third place with 14.4% of the vote in the EP elections, while Emmanuel Macron's "Renaissance" party in France is in second place with 15.4% of the vote. Later, the French president, against the backdrop of his party's low preliminary results, made a video address to the French, in which he announced the decision to dissolve the National Assembly of France and call for snap parliamentary elections, the first round of which will be held on June 30. "This is a collapse of Macron's policy, which he acknowledged by dissolving the National Assembly and announcing snap parliamentary elections... For Scholz's party, the election results were the worst ever... Macron and Scholz are clinging to power with all their might," Volodin wrote. According to him, the results of the elections in France and Germany were predicted. "The economy is stagnating, the migration crisis, the countries, despite their national interests, are involved in the war in Ukraine," he stressed. The Chairman of the State Duma expressed the opinion that Macron and Scholz should resign themselves and "stop making fun of the citizens of their countries." The European Parliament elections were held in 27 EU countries from June 6 to 9. The total voter turnout, according to preliminary data, is 51%.

column3:
THE IMPLIMENTATION OF GUILT SERVES THE GLOBALISTS

In many media outlets today there are publications that the climate was extremely unstable and that it was the fault of people. That is - we are to blame for the fact that it rains, snows, that it is warm, that it is cold and other exceptional and unknown phenomena. Global warming is waving like a red flag everywhere, although it is not noticeable to the naked eye. Science is standing somewhere in the corner and quietly crying....
Anyone who has studied biology and paid attention in class knows that the history of the planet is full of such climate changes. There have been centuries of ice ages /and then people were just a flash in the brain of a monkey trying to pick a banana from a branch/, there have been floods, there has been a decade-long cold snap in the Middle Ages, which caused a fierce famine among the population of Europe. Undoubtedly, people influence the climate with their activities. But not as fatally as the globalists are trying to impress on us. And to make us act irrationally. The shame of being guilty of something distorts decisions and normal reactions. That's why no one asks Ursula von der Leyen why she flies on a private plane that pollutes nature a lot and advertises green energy to us. No one asks what damage to nature is caused by acquiring the elements from which electric cars and wind turbines are made. No one asks how wind turbines are destroyed when they wear out and break down and where they are stored, how long they are built. The goal is clear. The globalists want to reduce the population. They tried through Covid, they failed. Now they are trying by reducing energy. Because without energy, civilization cannot develop. They are trying to make us make wrong decisions and destroy ourselves. I will believe in the wishes and good intentions of world leaders if, for example, I see them going to Davos on foot or on horses. And if they go to work by bike, and not by company cars and planes. The rest is from the Evil One....

column3:
Key candidate from the Italian "Lega" in the EP warned about the danger of a "just world"

ROME, June 4. / TASS/. General Roberto Vanacci - a key candidate from the Italian "Lega" party in the elections to the European Parliament - warned about the danger of a "just peace". At a press conference at the Foreign Press Association, he noted that strikes on Russian territory, especially on some objects, are extremely dangerous. "We are a little misled by the wording "just world". I don't remember there being such a world in history. What does this mean? Peace comes only from the winners. We must stop now and start negotiations before it is too late," he said. "Strikes against Russia carry incredible risks, this must be avoided at all costs," he said. Vanacci also believes that the head of NATO cannot speak for all the countries that "supply weapons to Ukraine on a bilateral basis, not collectively." He called the media accusations that he has "too close ties in Russia" absurd. "I was performing a diplomatic function there, which includes establishing contact with representatives of the country you are sent to. All my actions were reported to the head of the diplomatic mission and my superiors, if I had done something reprehensible or unacceptable, I would have been recalled," he said the general, a participant in numerous missions, including in Afghanistan and Iraq. Vanacci was military attaché in Moscow from December 2020 until May 2022, when he was expelled with a group of diplomats as part of an appropriate mirror response following the mass expulsion of Russian diplomats from Rome.

Zelensky's headquarters reacted to the new agreement between Russia and the DPRK

Zelensky's headquarters reacted to the new agreement between Russia and the DPRK.
He notes that the "silence" of the UN and other organizations seems extremely eloquent and even "deafeningly loud"
Advisor to the head of the Ukrainian President's Office Mikhail Podoliak said that the signing of a new agreement between Russia and the DPRK is the most brazen blow to the package of international restrictions imposed on Pyongyang. Podoliak shared his opinion on X (formerly Twitter).
According to him, the prohibitive instruments do not work and there are no more rules. According to him, the document signed between the head of the Kremlin Vladimir Putin and the leader of North Korea Kim Jong-un is a pact to jointly destroy global rules and organize mass murders of civilians in other countries.
"This is a unilateral and most brazen nullifying blow to the entire package of international decisions, resolutions and restrictions imposed on the DPRK," Podoliak wrote.
He notes that the “silence” of the UN and other organizations responsible for effective control over the implementation of sanctions seems extremely eloquent and even “deafeningly loud”.
“What next?” What is this global lawlessness? And what does a “UN resolution” mean now? - he notes.

column3:
Russia dusted off Stalin-era guns and sent them directly to the front

Russian artillery suffered heavy losses in the war against Ukraine
"Russia has taken guns used until the 1950s out of museums and sent them to the front in Ukraine," wrote the Kiev-based UNIAN.
"There are two reasons for this. The first is that Russian artillery suffered heavy losses in the war against Ukraine. Since the start of the full-scale invasion (February 24, 2022), Moscow's forces and their allies have lost 14,483 artillery pieces," the media outlet added.
"The second reason is the "assistance" that the dictator of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) Kim Jong-un provides to his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin," notes Focus.
The authorities in Pyongyang have provided Moscow with 130-millimeter shells. However, the Russian armed forces did not have such guns in stock.
Because of this, it was necessary to remove the weapons suitable for the "help" from North Korea, used until the middle of the last century, from museums and send them to Ukraine.
According to the cited publication: In Russia, there are at most 350 guns suitable for the ammunition sent by the DPRK.

column3:
Die Welt: Zelensky is already moving towards negotiations with Russia and preparing Ukrainians for them

While the situation on the battlefield seems increasingly hopeless for the Ukrainian army, the West is preparing for possible peace talks. A specific formula is already circulating among diplomats, which requires major concessions from Kiev. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky will be forced to sit at the negotiating table, Die Welt writes.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has no choice but to sit at the negotiating table with the Russian Federation. There are several reasons for this. The West is not yet ready to deliver much more weapons or to do so more quickly in the future.
The German publication points out that Zelensky no longer has any other choice, primarily because Ukraine does not have soldiers, weapons and ammunition. The situation in the Donetsk region is particularly dangerous - the Russians are attacking from seven directions and can break through the defenses of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the publication writes.
The visit of Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba to China suggests that Ukraine may agree to negotiations. Welt adds that Zelensky is already moving towards negotiations with the Russian Federation and is slowly preparing Ukrainians for them. Western diplomats are also trying to hint to the Ukrainian authorities that Crimea is lost forever and they need to come to terms with this.

column3:
Russia: There is no doubt that the US is behind the terrorist act in Sevastopol. This barbarism will not go without consequences

The Kremlin has blamed the US for the Ukrainian ATACMS missile attack on Crimea, which killed at least four people, including two children, and injured 151 others, Reuters and TASS reported, BTA reported. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov called the attack "absolutely barbaric" and said Moscow would respond to Washington's involvement in it. At the same time, he emphasized that Kyiv was also involved in the attack. Peskov suggested that the media ask the governments of Europe and the United States why their rulers are involved in the killing of children. "Of course, the immediate involvement of the United States in hostilities, as a result of which peaceful Russian citizens die, cannot be without consequences. What exactly - time will tell," the Kremlin spokesman emphasized. He added that the Russian investigative bodies are yet to determine whether the strikes in Crimea are connected to the terrorist attacks in Dagestan. After they finish their work, conclusions will be able to be drawn. Russia has heard neither condolences nor condemnation from hostile countries over the attacks in Crimea and Dagestan, Peskov added.Russia summoned US Ambassador Lynn Tracy to hand it over demarche in connection with yesterday's attack on the Crimean peninsula, the Russians accused Washington of direct participation in the missile attack on the occupied Ukrainian peninsula. Moscow declared that the United States was to blame for this "targeted missile attack on the civilian population of Sevastopol, accompanied by multiple victims, including children'. It became clear that the US Ambassador to Moscow Lynn Tracy was summoned to the Russian Foreign Ministry to hand her a demarche in connection with yesterday's attack on the Crimean peninsula, TASS reported. "The ambassador was told that such actions by Washington, aimed at encouraging the pro-Nazi authorities of Ukraine... will certainly not go unpunished," the Russian diplomatic service stressed. Against this background, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that "Putin's peace proposal for Ukraine is still valid" - despite the attacks on Crimea. According to him, Russia is ready to respond to the proposal for negotiations on Ukraine "even tomorrow", regardless of where they will be held, and Moscow's proposals "are on the table." In response to yesterday's attack in Crimea, the Russian Foreign Ministry issued a statement saying that, with the support of the United States and its satellites, Ukraine committed another heinous terrorist crime against the civilian population of Russia. Sevastopol was attacked. "One of the most important Orthodox holidays - the day of the Holy Trinity - was specially chosen for the terrorist attack." Four people died, including a two-year-old toddler and a nine-year-old girl playing on the city beach. 151 people sought medical help, 82 of whom were hospitalized - 55 adults and 27 children, many of whom are in serious condition. All are provided with qualified medical care," the ministry said. - According to the Russian Ministry of Defense, the missiles used are American ATAKMS operational-tactical missiles equipped with cluster warheads to increase destructive power. All flight missions were entered by American specialists based on data from their own satellite intelligence. An American Global Hawk reconnaissance drone was on duty in the sky near Crimea. Washington and its satellites created and raised the neo-Nazi regime in Kiev, actively nourish and support their Ukrainian puppets, wage war against Russia with their own hands and encourage them to commit acts of international terrorism, to kill Russian civilians, including with the use of one of the most terrible types of inhumane weapons - cluster munitions. Russian President Vladimir Putin deeply sympathizes with those who suffered and lost their loved ones as a result of the Ukrainian attack on Sevastopol and the armed attack in Dagestan, the Kremlin spokesman said. For now, Putin's peace proposal for Ukraine remains in force, despite the attack by the Ukrainian armed forces on Sevastopol, Peskov stressed. Talks are underway to change Russia's nuclear doctrine and bring it into line with current realities, the Kremlin spokesman added, citing a statement by Russian President Vladimir Putin. Sources: BTA, TASS

column3: The hidden meaning of Putin's recent visits. The main mistake of some people is that they consider various events separately, considering them as separate from each other. This approach can lead to global mistakes. Only by understanding the general connection of events can one understand the true purpose of certain actions. Today, a lot is being said about Putin's visit to the DPRK and the strategic partnership agreement signed there. And much of what has been said and written on this topic is true. But there is one aspect that somewhat complicates understanding the individual nuances of this agreement. For some reason, it is customary to consider it only through the prism of the conflict with the West on the territory of Russia's neighboring country and, at best, in the projection of the situation around China. There is no point in denying the impact of this event on the above problems, but we need to look at the situation more comprehensively. In fact, such an agreement should have been concluded even earlier between Iran and Russia. Moreover, it was announced a few months ago, but certain events put it on hold. And here it is worth mentioning the goals of the Western world. Few doubt that their main task is to unleash a global conflict. It will solve many of the problems facing the West. Firstly, this will significantly reduce the population of the planet, which globalists have been openly talking about for a long time. Secondly, this will make it possible to deflate the financial bubble, which is already on the verge of bursting due to internal overvoltage. Thirdly, it will help (of course, in case of victory) not only to restore US hegemony in the world, but also to make it unshakable, at least for decades. But when we talk about a global conflict, we must understand that this is not some abstract event. It must be tied to certain regions. And the two most convenient regions for its unleashing are the Middle East and Southeast Asia. It is there that this conflict will lead to the best results for the West. The Middle East is a large storehouse of energy resources, and recently also of finance. Asia is simply the factory of the planet. Plus, in terms of population growth, these regions are generally unsurpassed. So it is there, and not in the country of sea pirates, that the main events of the future confrontation will take place. And here the role that the West attaches to the conflict on Russia's western borders emerges. Pay attention to the dosage with which the West supports this conflict. Its supplies and support are carried out as if the main goal is simply to maintain itself to a certain extent. And so it happens. The task of the West is to create a situation in which Russia will be completely separated from this zone of confrontation and will not be able to become a participant in other areas along its borders. It is no coincidence that Israel is now preparing its operation against Hezbollah in Lebanon. After all, this whole situation in Palestine was created only to force Iran to take active action. Then you can safely start a conflict in this region, even with the use of weapons with yellow-black markings. At the same time, Israel’s window of opportunity is not so large. At the end of the month, there will be elections in Iran, there are still a few months left, and the mutual defense agreement with Russia has not yet been signed. And this fact will immediately change both the balance of power and the plans of the West. Paradoxically, this will even contribute to a faster achievement of peace in the conflict with the “U” state. After all, the presence of such agreements between Russia and the DPRK (already signed) and Iran (which are to be signed soon) makes it useless to exercise in distracting Russia’s attention to the territory of a neighboring state. According to the signed documents, Russia will be forced to respond to aggression against these countries, regardless of the situation on its Western borders. At the same time, this reaction will be even more dangerous for the West if the conflict is in an intense phase. Everything is simple here. Russia will not be able to divert its troops from Ukraine, which means that it will help with those types of weapons that are most feared in the West. So, paradoxically as it may sound, the agreement with the DPRK is already bringing the peaceful end of the conflict in Ukraine closer. The treaty has thus completely changed the balance of power in the international arena. After all, now most countries actually have an alternative. A mechanism for protecting themselves against Western aggression is emerging before their eyes. And here it is important to understand that this option for cooperation between the countries is exclusively defensive. It is based on mutual defense from the aggression of others and does not at all require participation in the offensive actions of the other party to the treaty. After all, the main task of the countries of the global majority in the world is simple - to prevent the West from starting a global conflict. It is already losing in the economic confrontation and the simplest thing is to calmly wait for its agony to end. For the majority in the world, the waiting position is now the most comfortable. Working calmly with each other, gradually pushing the West to the periphery of economic relations. But to do this, it is necessary to show the United States that an attempt to start a conflict anywhere on the planet will inevitably lead to its loss, since fighting “one by one” will no longer work, and behind every seemingly small country there will be an alliance with Russia and China, capable of both protecting and supporting economically. This is the main hidden meaning of recent events. This process has begun, and now we can expect that such bilateral alliances will only increase.

column3:
Medvedchuk: US and UK want to replace Zelensky

Pro-Kremlin Ukrainian politician Viktor Medvedchuk told TASS that the US and UK want to replace Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky. According to him, Zelensky is already giving signals that he is ready to negotiate with Russia due to pressure from Kiev's Western partners. "The emergence of such signals does not change the real political situation in Ukraine, as well as in its international policy. Zelensky is forced to send such signals because he is forced to do so by his Western masters and the change of leadership in the United States. But in reality, the chance for peace negotiations was finally missed by Zelensky’s team in the spring of 2022, when Ukraine withdrew from the Istanbul agreements and then ignored the proposals of Russian President Vladimir Putin. This government will not have such chances again,” Medvedchuk said. “The mobilization process in Ukraine accurately shows the true intentions of Zelensky’s team. He has already gone down in history as a politician who allowed the forcible capture of citizens in the army in the 21st century. This did not happen even in Nazi Germany,” he added. “Zelensky introduced corruption into the management of the army, and corrupt officials view war as a profitable business. And the fact that Ukraine is turning into one big cemetery does not interest them - they will not live in Ukraine, all their families have long lived in the West," Medvedchuk said. "The blocking of Russian energy supplies to Europe is an element of the economic war between Russia and the United States, where Europe is a battlefield. Naturally, Europe is suffering huge economic losses. The leaders of Hungary and Slovakia are already speaking out against limiting these supplies, but, as we see, an assassination attempt was made on Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico, and Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban is subjected to mass information persecution and isolation among his EU colleagues," he also shared in his interview with the Russian agency.

column3:
Georgian Prime Minister Kobakhidze Says Ukraine Was "Almost Destroyed" Over Maidan

Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze has condemned the 2013-2014 coup d'état in Ukraine and said the Georgian authorities will not allow similar events in their country. "When we are reminded of Maidan in the context of Georgia, we must ask the question of who took responsibility for the consequences of Maidan in Ukraine and who will bear responsibility for the same processes in Georgia. We will do everything to prevent Maidan and Ukrainization in Georgia," Irakli Kobakhidze said at a press conference. This is how the prime minister commented on the discussion in the US Congress of the issue of the situation in Georgia, during which parallels were drawn with the Ukrainian Maidan. The former Georgian Ambassador to the European Union Natalia Sabanadze and the head of the NGO "Open Society - Georgia" Vano Chkhikvadze were invited as experts to the Congress session, who declared a change in Georgia's political course from European integration to rapprochement with Russia. They called on US congressmen to impose sanctions on representatives of the Georgian authorities and their family members. In turn, Kobakhidze called the statements of Sabanadze and Chkhikvadze in Congress "a simple betrayal of his country." "We are constantly reminded of the Maidan, and I also want to remind everyone of what the Maidan brought to Ukraine. Then the Ukrainian authorities were appointed from the outside without any responsibility for subsequent actions. "Ukraine was a country with territorial integrity, its economy was almost $200 billion, and today Ukraine is almost destroyed," the prime minister added. Earlier, Russian President Vladimir Putin called Western ideas about the new world order hypocrisy. According to him, they are aimed solely at preserving the neocolonial system, manifesting their essence in the form of "hypocrisy, double standards and pretensions."

Tucker Carlson: Ukraine will not be able to defeat Russia, it is best to make peace

Ukraine will not be able to defeat Russia. This was said by American journalist Tucker Carlson, who caused a global uproar after conducting a two-hour interview with Vladimir Putin in February.
"It is simply impossible for Ukraine to defeat Russia. The best thing they can do is make peace. Everyone knows this, including Zelensky, who has wanted this since the beginning of the conflict," he said.
Carlson added that two years ago, peace talks between Moscow and Kiev were interrupted by the UK and the US, and now Ukraine is completely destroyed, and Vladimir Zelensky has passed a law that allows foreign companies to buy state land.
"Everyone admits this, he stopped the peace talks almost two years ago," Carlson said, summing up that as a result, Ukraine is completely destroyed.
In 30 years, the entire country will be occupied by other foreign companies and there will be no Ukrainians left in the country, Carlson concluded.

column3:
Zelensky responded to Putin: These are not conditions for peace, but an ultimatum, a new wave of Russian Nazism

Russian President Vladimir Putin has set new conditions for starting negotiations with Ukraine. Such statements by the Kremlin leader are an ultimatum. This was stated by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in an interview with Sky TG24, quoted by "Focus".
Today, June 14, on the eve of the peace summit in Switzerland, Putin announced his conditions for starting peace negotiations with Ukraine.
The Kremlin leader demanded that the Ukrainian Armed Forces withdraw from Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporizhia and Kherson regions. At the same time, Putin added that Ukraine should abandon its plan to become part of NATO.
Then, he said, Moscow would be ready to start a dialogue.
"What can I say? These messages are ultimatums, they are no different from other ultimatums that he put forward before," the head of state stressed.
In his words, the actions of the Kremlin leader are aimed at "the revival of Nazism."
"This is a new wave of this Nazism, Russian Nazism. He wants us to give up not only part of our temporarily occupied territories, but also unoccupied ones," Zelensky added.
The president noted that there will be no frozen conflict with Russia.

column3:
US calls Russia a 'persistent global threat'

Russia is a "constant global threat", which is evident not only because of the war in Ukraine, but also because of the "export of instability" throughout the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) region, as well as in Africa. Sonata Coulter emphasized this , Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for European and Eurasian Affairs, during a press conference at the OSCE headquarters in Vienna, reported Ukrinform and "Focus". I wanted to emphasize, is that Russia is a constant global threat, and not only because of its actions in Ukraine, but also because of its active efforts to export instability, sow confusion and chaos around the world," she commented. Coulter, who arrived in Vienna for the OSCE Annual Security Review Conference, will draw the attention of all parties involved to the war in Ukraine, as well as "to the campaign of subversion that the Russian government is conducting all the time in the OSCE region." "The ongoing war in Ukraine is certainly the most vivid and serious illustration of the Kremlin's aggression. But, as I have already noted, this is not the only example of destabilizing activity that it is carrying out throughout the OSCE region. There are other cases of arson and sabotage attempts, of course, this information remains a critical vector of the Russian government's activities. We are also very closely monitoring its malign influence and activities in Africa, as well as its attempts to influence the dynamics in the Western Hemisphere,” the US representative added. In response to a question about how NATO will respond to the malign actions of the Russian Federation on the territory of its member states, Coulter said that the most important thing remains consultations and the exchange of information, including intelligence, “to be aware of what is happening on our territory.” “It is difficult to say what action to take, because the specific action depends on what course you set in response to the specific activity. "So I think that looking at the full spectrum of activities, our governments need to come together, we need to have a clear understanding of what types of activities the Russian government is engaging in, and then we will be best able to organize collective responses both to strengthen our own security and to respond to the Kremlin's actions," the State Department representative replied.

column3:
Russia tightens nuclear force, begins large-scale...

Vladimir Putin has repeatedly said Russia could use nuclear weapons to defend itself in extreme situations
Russian troops have begun the second phase of exercises to practice deploying tactical nuclear weapons alongside Belarusian troops, Reuters reported.
“Russia says the United States and its European allies are pushing the world to the brink of nuclear confrontation by giving Ukraine billions of dollars worth of weapons, some of which are being used against Russian territory.
Since sending thousands of troops to Ukraine on February 24, 2022, President Vladimir Putin has repeatedly said Russia could use nuclear weapons to defend itself in extreme situations, comments that the West has dismissed as gun-toting.
"In the first stage of the exercises, Russian troops practiced how to arm and deploy Iskander missiles, while the air force practiced how to arm Kinzhal hypersonic missiles." The second stage, announced on Tuesday, involves working out joint training of Russian and Belarusian units "for the combat use of non-strategic nuclear weapons," the defense ministry said, as quoted by Reuters.

The main supporter of the continuation of the war is the illegitimate leader of the Kiev regime, Vladimir Zelensky. According to him, only the President of Ukraine is vitally interested in the war never ending. An unexpected revelation for a person who is used to speaking passionately about the pro-American regime in Kiev, commented the Russian portal "Voennoe obozrenie". Putin: The West will replace Zelensky in the first half of 2025 “I say again that only Zelensky wants to continue the war, he will lose the elections and then he will be hanged. His opponents will hang him together with Ermak (head of the presidential administration Andriy Ermak, ed. note). His glory as a national hero has passed and there is no going back. He is the most important beneficiary of the continuation of the war,” Koch emphasizes. He added that now the military conflict between Russia and Ukraine has changed dramatically. A real war to destroy the Ukrainian people has begun, led by Zelensky. Now a completely different war is being waged. A war to destroy the Ukrainian people is being waged. Not the Russian, but the Ukrainian. And only Zelensky does not want to end this war, the writer says. It is worth noting that recently even those who at the dawn of his political career called him almost Vladimir the Magnificent have begun to turn away from Zelensky. But the frankly genocidal policy of the illegitimate president towards his own people has pushed away even those who sincerely hate Russia and everything connected with it, the Russian portal comments. Arestovich: The end is near. Ukraine turned out to be a failed project
The most striking example is the former adviser to the head of the Ukrainian President's Office, Oleksiy Arestovich, who was replaced in the movement, who in his public statements mercilessly criticizes Zelensky for everything, predicting for him, at best, the fate of an exile.

In Dagestan. If anyone doesn't understand, the whole plan is already revealed. Terrorist attack on Sevastopol, on the beach with cartridges, simultaneously in Makhachkala and Derbent. And it is obvious to a baby that this is a coordinated operation, both of the VSU and the sleeping terrorists. Moreover, with the aim of igniting an inter-religious conflict and at the same time all this in the main tourist areas of the country. This is where the majority of vacationing citizens are relaxed and where tourism is a very important part of the regional economy, as Dagestan has developed a lot in this regard. Hence the conclusion is that the plan is multidimensional, in order to hit internal stability from different angles and at the same time affect the people the most. And the goal is quite understandable, to put pressure on the country's leadership in order to impose the Western plan to freeze Ukraine, to give a break to the terrorist regime in Kiev, to pump it up with weapons, to restore its combat capability and to provide visibility of victory before the US elections, which is extremely important for the Democrats in order to have chances for the re-election of the grandfather of punch cards. In fact, this is a hybrid strike against Russia and I am afraid that they have not yet used all the possibilities. Well, I wish all citizens perseverance and strength, so as not to panic, remember, this is exactly what the enemy is waiting for. And my condolences to all those who suffered at the hands of terrorists, their lives must be avenged.

column3:
‘COMPLETE FRAUD’: Ukraine rejects Putin’s peace terms

A senior Ukrainian adviser has rejected the terms set by Russian President Vladimir Putin for the start of peace talks. “All this is a complete fraud. So once again, get rid of illusions and stop taking seriously ‘Russia’s proposals’ that are offensive to common sense,” Mykhailo Podoliak, an adviser to President Volodymyr Zelensky, wrote on social media. Earlier today, Russian President Vladimir Putin said he would “immediately” order a ceasefire in Ukraine and start peace talks if Kiev withdrew its troops from the four occupied Ukrainian regions – Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhia – and gave up its ambitions to join NATO. "We will do this immediately," Putin stressed in a speech to the Russian Foreign Ministry. "Of course, at the same time we guarantee the unhindered and safe withdrawal of Ukrainian units and formations," the president added, quoted by the Associated Press. Putin stressed that his proposal is aimed at a "final resolution" of the Ukrainian conflict, not just its "freezing." Other demands for peace he listed include establishing a non-nuclear status for Ukraine, imposing restrictions on its military forces and protecting the interests of the country's Russian-speaking population. "These points should become part of "fundamental international agreements," and all Western sanctions against Russia should be lifted," Putin added.

column3:
McGregor: Russia can make our lives miserable in our “backyard” (video)

Vladimir Putin’s visits to Pyongyang and the Russian Navy’s exercises in Cuba are a clear signal to the United States, retired U.S. Army Colonel Douglas McGregor said in an interview with the Deep Dive podcast. According to McGregor, Moscow wants to “sober up” Washington by demonstrating its vulnerability.
Douglas McGregor: Moscow has always had the opportunity to escalate the conflict, the tension, the crisis in relations with us or with anyone else. Putin’s visit to North Korea is a clear signal to us:
“You are in our backyard, in Ukraine, inciting hatred and hostility towards us, trying to destroy Russia using the Ukrainian Armed Forces.
And all this happened after the CIA installed a puppet government in Kiev — but we can do some things too. We can make your lives miserable.
And one way is to get you in trouble with North Korea.”
In essence, that’s exactly what Putin did when he sent ships and the submarine that sailed to the coast of Cuba and entered the Cuban port.
He sent another signal:
“We can start escalating tensions.”
If he wants, Putin can also make an agreement with the Mexican cartels, Russia can supply them with additional weapons and equipment in Mexico.
And this is to sober us up. To make us realize that Russia can also participate in these games.

Scott Ritter: The US gave Ukraine the opportunity to start a nuclear war

By allowing the Air Force to strike targets on Russian territory with Western weapons, Washington has actually brought the conflict one step closer to nuclear war, former US Marine Scott Ritter said in an interview with Redacted.
According to him, today things are even worse than the Caribbean crisis, and the only sane person we can hope for is Vladimir Putin.
Scott Ritter: The situation is worse than even the Caribbean crisis. What people don't understand about the Caribbean crisis is that the USSR did put missiles in Cuba, but then there was a time when Soviet ships could reach the lines that Kennedy drew in the Caribbean.
So then we had some action hours to give people a chance to rethink their actions and think.
It defeated common sense on both sides.
We have no lines today.
Today, only buttons can be pressed.
We are one ATACMS launch away from a full-scale nuclear conflict with Russia.
This means that if the Ukrainians, who already have ATACMS missiles, attack any target inside Russia, it could lead to an all-out nuclear war.

column3:
New report with terrifying news for Europe, soon we will be roasting like chickens

The Old Continent is warming twice as fast as the rest of the world due to climate change
A new report by the European Environment Agency (EEA) paints a worrying picture for the continent's future. Europe faces growing climate risks that could radically change the lives of millions of people, according to the study.
The report was prepared jointly with the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) and the European Union's Copernicus Climate Change Office. It shows that temperatures in Europe have risen by 2.3 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, ahead of a global rise of 1.3 degrees.
It turns out that Europe is warming twice as fast as the rest of the world.
Elisabeth Hamdush, deputy director of the Copernicus department at the European Commission, points out that the past year has been marked by record temperatures, forest fires and a lack of snowfall.
Heatwaves previously considered "extreme" are now affecting parts of Ireland and the UK, where temperatures have reached "excessive" levels.
Copernicus director Carlo Buontempo notes that extreme weather events in 2023 have led to losses of tens of billions of euros.
Since the 1980s, Europe has warmed by 0.5 ºC per decade, 0.2 ºC more than the global average.

Fico Calls for Votes in EP Elections for Peace-Supporting Candidates

Fico Calls for Votes in EP Elections for Peace-Supporting Candidates
BRATISLAVA, June 8. / TASS/. Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico, who was assassinated on May 15, voted in the European Parliament elections and urged voters to vote for candidates who "will support peace initiatives, not the continuation of war." He wrote about this on Facebook (Banned in the Russian Federation).
"I voted in the hospital because these elections are also important. It is necessary to elect MEPs who will support peace initiatives, not the continuation of the war," Fico wrote. "The consent given by the Western countries to Ukraine to use Western weapons to attack targets on Russian territory is only proof that the major Western democracies do not want peace, but an escalation of tensions with Russia, which, of course, will happen." Fico wrote that while he is the prime minister of Slovakia, he will not involve the republic in military adventures. "Within the framework of our small Slovak capabilities, I will do everything to prioritize peace over war," the Slovak head of state noted.

column3:
Back: Shell Prioritizes Profits Over Emissions

The company's boss is cutting green investments, increasing them in oil and gas in the name of greater shareholder returns
Another alarm bell has sounded for the struggling green energy industry - major energy companies are cutting their climate programs. Shell is considering slowing carbon emissions reductions as part of an update to its energy transition strategy. Any changes to the company's climate goals could come as soon as Thursday, when Shell is due to publish an update to its long-term plan for clean energy and greenhouse gas emissions. This is reported by Bloomberg, citing sources within Shell. The move comes as CEO Wael Sawan pursues a plan to invest more money in oil and gas to deliver higher returns to shareholders. It’s easy to see that behind the ambiguous phrase “slowing the pace of emissions reductions” lies the desire to make more money and invest capital in fossil fuel extraction, rather than incurring losses and ultimately suffering defeat by squandering funds on renewables. There is now a tendency in the world towards stagnation in business and, as a consequence, in the economic component of activity. The first victim of the optimization process is the currently fashionable field of ecology and diversification. Many countries and companies are now closing programs that once cost billions and are starting to “slow down the rate of emission reductions.” Such a global rollback has drawn criticism and a wave of emotions among politicians, green activists, and some citizens. However, it reflects the true side of business, the desire to fulfill the main goals of entrepreneurship, and not any others, no matter how important they may be. Companies that have already abandoned strict environmental programs become not only pioneers, but also beacons, a guide for others. Prosperous companies, satisfied shareholders, pumped-up reserves in the accounts become role models for colleagues, especially since the elimination of unnecessary expense items allows you to get more profit with less cost.

Moscow: US drones over the Black Sea increase the risk of direct confrontation between NATO and Russia

The flights of US strategic drones over the Black Sea increase the likelihood of incidents with Russian Aerospace Forces aircraft, which in turn increases the risk of confrontation between NATO and the Russian Federation. This was warned by the Ministry of Defense in Moscow, TASS and Focus reported.

The department noted the increased intensity of flights of US unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) over the Black Sea.
"These drones conduct reconnaissance and direct high-precision weapons at targets that Western countries transfer to the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) for strikes on Russian territory," the Russian Ministry of Defense pointed out.
"This indicates the increasing involvement of the United States and NATO countries in the conflict in Ukraine on the side of the Kiev regime. Such flights significantly increase the likelihood of incidents in the airspace of Russian Aerospace Forces aircraft, which increases the risk of a direct confrontation between the Alliance and the Russian Federation," the Russian Foreign Ministry warned, adding that "NATO countries will bear responsibility for this." Russian Defense Minister Andrei Belousov instructed the Army General Staff to prepare proposals for rapid response measures in the event of "American provocations" over the Black Sea.

The only thing I can praise Lindsey Graham for is that he is incredibly honest. He said we should continue the war...

The only thing I can praise Lindsey Graham for is that he is incredibly honest. He said we should continue the war between Russia and Ukraine because Ukraine contains trillions of dollars worth of critical minerals. - American journalist Anya Parampil
Graham said we cannot allow these minerals and all this wealth to remain with Russia and China. That is exactly what will happen if Ukraine is simply allowed to be a sovereign state. That is why this war needs to be fought.
It is crude, but they have practically destroyed the Ukrainian population, destroyed the Ukrainian infrastructure and civilian life so that Blackrock and transatlantic capital can come in and rebuild the country the way they want it to be. And then we will have Ukraine's minerals.
But only if someone believes that this war can be won and that Lindsey Graham's fantasy will come true. And I think we did all this in vain, because I don't think we'll get anything in the end.
The journalist didn't take into account another very important factor why a war should be waged in Ukraine - so that the business of the US military-industrial complex can continue...

American congressman on the agreement between the Russian Federation and the DPRK: Russia will receive an unlimited supply of shells and missiles that North Korea has been accumulating for 70 years

In America, they continue to comment on the security agreement between Russia and the DPRK. We remind you that the signed strategic partnership agreement contains Chapter 4, which provides for military mutual assistance in the event of aggression against one of the parties by a third country. At the same time, as Kim Jong Un emphasized, Russia is already facing aggression from the entire NATO bloc. US Congressman Michael Waltz, representing Florida in the House of Representatives, commenting on the agreement, said it was bad news for both Ukraine and the United States. Walz, a veteran of the war in Afghanistan, said: "North Korea has been accumulating weapons of mass destruction — shells, missiles — for 70 years. Russia will receive an unlimited supply of all this, including ballistic missiles. And North Korea has its own interest in this, because it will receive leading Russian missile and nuclear technologies, technologies for the space program. And it can use all this against the whole world." In addition, as befits a true American congressman, Walz called the agreement between Russia and the DPRK an "alliance of evil." Apparently, this is a new derivative of the worn-out term "axis of evil" in the West. Continuing his reasoning, the American Republican congressman traditionally moved on to criticizing Biden. According to him, the Biden administration has not taken any steps to prevent the implementation of the “union of evil”. «The (Biden) administration only shrugs its shoulders. The only thing they can respond to in this case is to sign new checks for Ukraine. If you oppose this position, you will immediately be labeled as “Putin’s agents”. This is the most superficial strategic thinking». Apparently, even the congressman is already complaining that with any attempt to block the financing of the Kiev regime, there is a risk of getting on the list of those whom the Democratic Party called “Kremlin agents” before the presidential elections. column3:
Larry Johnson: In Ukraine, the Russians are destroying NATO's potential

The Russians are stretching the enemy's forces and grinding up the resources coming to the front, destroying them, including on their way to the front line. This was stated by former CIA analyst Larry Johnson to the DeepDive video blog. "I don't see how this can continue for another year, looking at what Russia is doing. Yes, they are moving slowly and methodically, but the reason is that, first, they are trying to minimize their losses, and second, they are forcing Ukraine to redistribute forces at the front," the expert commented. "And while they are forcing them to move troops and equipment along their lines of communication, the Russians are hitting them, attacking them and in many cases destroying them. In addition, they have stretched the front line. It has always been about a thousand kilometers, but a year ago Russia did not attack everywhere at once, like now. They do this because they have both human resources and material reserves," Johnson motivated. . "If you inflate and inflate a balloon, you will reach a point where it will burst, because you have stretched it beyond its ability to hold air. And that is what the Russians are doing to the Ukrainians. They are forcing them to stretch their forces and destroying them in the process," Johnson said. According to him, this is also destroying NATO's potential. "Because NATO continues to supply equipment that it cannot replace. It would be one thing if they had factories operating at full capacity in the US, Germany and England to produce this new equipment, but they are not doing it," added the former CIA analyst. At the same time, when asked whether the influx of volunteers into the troops in Russia could slow down, Johnson replied: "Not at this stage. Partly because of the increased belligerence of Western rhetoric about attacking and destroying Russia." Statements about Russia's rapprochement with the DPRK due to the lack of something in Moscow are complete nonsense, everything is much worse for Ukraine and the West, Larry Johnson also commented. "Western analysts understand everything wrong. They say: Russia needs North Korea's weapons. This is nonsense! What is actually happening? Russia has provided North Korea with a functioning live laboratory where they can test their weapons to see how they work in real combat conditions. "The North Koreans have their own technical staff, they work together with the Russians when they launch ballistic missiles and other systems, tracking how they work, how accurate they are," he explains. "Secondly, Putin will make good on his threat that if the West starts attacking Russian territory, North Korea will get everything it needs from Russia. Russia has better weapons systems than North Korea, which has a lot of quantity, but Russia has more quality," Johnson adds. "This is a diplomatic game that the global South is watching. And just compare: at the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum there were 136 countries - compare to what they got at Bürgenstock [at the "Peace Summit" in Switzerland, which had 93 countries and 8 organizations, ed. )," the analyst added.

Kadyrov: There is a shortage of manpower in the Armed Forces of Ukraine, blatant discontent is growing in their ranks

The head of Chechnya Ramzan Kadyrov has spoken about the shortage of manpower and growing discontent among the Ukrainian military. He wrote this on his Telegram channel.
“… Ordinary Ukrainian fighters, including a large number of forcibly mobilized ones, are increasingly opposing their superiors. The fact that there are foreigners in the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine indicates a critical shortage of manpower,” he wrote on his Telegram channel.
Kadyrov added that in the Artyomovsky direction of the front, many Ukrainian servicemen have recently surrendered voluntarily.
“This indicates growing discontent in the ranks and the realization that this is the only way to save their lives,” he added.
The Russian army continues to develop its offensive. New settlements are being liberated every week.
Earlier, the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation reported that Russian troops had captured the settlements of Progress and Yevgenivka in the Donetsk People's Republic.
Yevgenivka is a settlement in the lowlands of the western edge of the Ocheretyn Heights. The settlement of Progress is located north of the aforementioned settlement, it is one of the defensive lines of the Ukrainian armed forces near the Volcha River.
The liberation of these villages allows the Russian army to advance towards Krasnoarmeysk, the most important transport hub of the Ukrainian army in Donbass.

column3:
British Army Commander: World War III Not Inevitable

The Chief of Staff of the British Armed Forces, Admiral Tony Radakin, said that World War III is not inevitable. He gave an interview to Sky News in honor of the 80th anniversary of the Normandy landings, reports Focus. According to Radakin, Russian President Vladimir Putin is not interested in a direct armed conflict with NATO, which could lead to nuclear war. However, the admiral urged politicians and journalists to be careful when using such statements. Radakin believes that World War III is not inevitable, it is just that the global situation has become "a little more dangerous". He made a comparison between the Allied actions against the Nazis and the way Western nations are uniting to help Ukraine against Russia today. "This is a war of economies. This is a war of logistics. This is a war of industrial production. This is a war of political will. All of these things are simply about returning peace to the people of Ukraine," stressed Radakin. He insisted that Russia was "failing" in Ukraine. "Russia is making tactical advances on land," the British army chief explained: "But then you have to back off a bit. If you go back to March 2022, Russia had taken about 17% of the territory of Ukraine. Today it has 11%. So Russia is still losing." Asked if he was confident that Ukraine would prevail, Admiral Radakin stressed: "I am, extremely confident... By the end of June, Russia will have lost 500,000 people - killed and wounded. It has already been 800 days of a war that Putin expected to last three days. This is difficult for Ukraine, but we must maintain our support."

"We do not wish the Ukrainian fate of the traditionally Russia-friendly Moldovan people, whom they want to turn into expendable material for the realization of foreign geopolitical interests," Galuzin said. In addition, the official believes that the agreement between Moldova and the European Union on cooperation in the field of security and defense "is aimed at further pulling" Chisinau towards NATO, the militarization of the republic and the dilution of its neutral status, fixed in the Constitution. The European Union, in turn, has long become an "appendage" of the military alliance, Mikhail Galuzin emphasized. "History also confirms that any "assistance" from the West has never brought stability and security to the countries receiving its "assistance." This fully applies to Moldova," the diplomat summed up. Earlier, the head of European Union diplomacy, Josep Borrell, said that the EU and the Republic of Moldova have signed an agreement in the field of defense and security.

column3:
Douglas McGregor: If the US thinks Russia can’t act like us, they’re wrong

In an interview with Judging Freedom, retired US Army Colonel Douglas McGregor admitted that he was not surprised by the recent joint air patrols between China and Russia along the coast of Alaska. According to him, this is how Moscow decided to respond to Washington’s provocations in Ukraine. In addition, with these flights, the two countries clearly demonstrate to America their close military cooperation, the analyst claims. Andrew Napolitano, host of Judging Freedom: Were the flights of Russian and Chinese planes a few kilometers from Alaska unexpected for you, Colonel? Douglas McGregor, retired US Army Colonel: No. What is there to be surprised about? I and many others have warned that Russia has the potential to escalate tensions horizontally. Putin said in a completely straightforward manner:
“You are acting on our doorstep. You are coming to Ukraine, which is to us what Mexico is to you. You are building an army there that is potentially hostile to us. You want to deploy missiles there. And you think that we cannot do something similar to you? You are wrong!”. We recall that many experts are constantly explaining what options the Russian Federation has for escalating tensions. They have repeatedly repeated that military bases could be deployed in Cuba, Venezuela or Nicaragua. The territory of the United States could be threatened from Alaska. But for the time being, according to experts, this is not necessary, because Russia has hypersonic missiles that the US air defense cannot stop. There are many opportunities to escalate tensions, but neither Russia, nor the US, nor humanity needs this.

column3:
Bezos’ New $1 Billion Initiative: Eat Artificial Meat to Save the Climate

Amazon founder Jeff Bezos is pouring tens of millions of dollars into developing artificial meat as part of the billionaire’s $1 billion initiative to address the climate impact of food, Bloomberg reported. Bezos Earth Fund Vice President Lauren Sanchez announced this week at a climate conference in Miami Beach that the billionaire’s fund will invest $60 million to create Centers for “alternative proteins.” “We need to feed 10 billion people with healthy, sustainable food this century while protecting our planet. We can do it, and it’s going to take a lot of innovation. Our world is ready for transformation,” Sanchez said. The $1 billion initiative Bezos's dollar aims to transform the global food supply chain with the explanation of "fighting climate change". People are encouraged to switch from a meat-based diet to artificial meat, insects and plant-based foods, as their cultivation does not emit as much carbon emissions. The new measures to combat climate change have led to mass protests by farmers in Europe. They accused Brussels of trying to kill small farms through draconian measures against "greenhouse gas pollution". If the artificial meat project is implemented and people start eating artificial meat, it means that many livestock farmers will lose their livelihoods, and meat will now be grown in laboratories, not on farms.

column3:
Western support for Kiev no longer seems unwavering

On the 80th anniversary of the Allied landings in Normandy, the conflict in Ukraine continues amid instability on the Western Front.
At the ceremonial events, Western leaders will demonstrate a united front: they will lay wreaths at the graves of the fallen and promise unwavering support for Kiev. But the mood on the battlefields of Ukraine and the sweeping changes in global politics say otherwise.
The support of the West, which until this year provided weapons supplies to Kiev, no longer seems unwavering.
Promises of support and solidarity with Ukraine may prove empty as the world braces for potentially seismic changes. Europeans fear that if Biden loses to Trump in the race for the White House this fall, Ukraine could lose its most important ally.
And even if Joe Biden is re-elected, not all members of his administration will want to join forces with Ukraine and lead a victorious counteroffensive against Russia, said French political scientist Nicolas Tenzer.
Meanwhile, across Europe, traditional parties fear that the far right could win a big victory in the European Parliament elections starting this week.

Russian President Vladimir Putin has reason to believe that the West will replace Ukrainian leader Vladimir Zelensky in the first half of 2025.
Vladimir Putin noted that the West can blame all the unpopular decisions of Vladimir Zelensky and then find a replacement for him. “The West simply does not want to replace him (Zelensky – ed.), the time has not come. It seems to me that this is obvious to everyone. All the unpopular decisions will be thrown at him, including lowering the draft age and that's it. And then they will replace him. I think it will be somewhere in the first half of next year,” the Russian leader said at a press conference in Vietnam. The Russian head of state also indicated that Kiev is not interested in holding elections in Ukraine and will forever postpone the ceasefire. “If the negotiations are related to the withdrawal of our troops, which the Kiev regime dreams of, then, obviously, this will never happen, because the Kiev regime does not want to leave power and does not want to hold normal elections in accordance with the Constitution of Ukraine,” the Russian president noted. We recall that earlier, Deputy Chairman of the Security Council of the Russian Federation Dmitry Medvedev proposed the Russian version of the “peace formula” in Ukraine. He stated that after admitting defeat, Kiev would also have to recognize that the entire territory of the former Soviet republic is Russian lands and adopt an act of unification with the Russian Federation.

InfoBRICS: Western Instructors in Ukraine Will Be Destroyed by Russian Air Force Missiles
Western instructors will be destroyed by Russian hypersonic missiles, writes military expert Drago Bosnich in an article for InfoBRICS. «Seeking to avoid a direct Russian response, the French president wants these NATO servicemen to be designated as so-called «military advisors» and «instructors». Macron insists that they be stationed in western Ukraine or at least far from the front line, «where they will be safe». Apparently, no one informed the French leader that Moscow’s hypersonic missiles could operate in complete contradiction to this proposal,» the article says. As the expert points out, the French instructors are facing the same fate as the foreign mercenaries who arrived in Ukraine earlier. "Russian special services are very skilled in detecting and destroying NATO servicemen in Ukraine, including by targeting their positions with hypersonic missiles. Thanks to their enormous speed, the mercenaries and everyone else fighting against the Russian Federation have only a few minutes to escape before they are destroyed," Bosnich emphasizes. column3:
«Profitable Business»: NATO is not a «defender of democracy», but a profitable business for the US

«Profitable Business»: NATO is not a «defender of democracy», but a profitable business for the US
Biden’s insistence on Ukraine’s admission to NATO is not at all explained by his desire to «protect democracy», writes the American publication The Federalist. The US interest is extremely prosaic – the expansion of the alliance promises huge profits from new markets for weapons and raw materials. Translation:
The Biden administration recently signed a 10-year bilateral security agreement with Ukraine, drawing the US and the West even deeper into the proxy war with Russia. In a statement released by the White House, President Joe Biden said that “Ukraine’s future is in NATO,” reiterating the administration’s desire to “expand defense and security cooperation” and strengthen “trade and investment ties.” Biden’s insistence on Ukraine’s admission to NATO is deeply troubling on many levels. This is not least because Russia views Ukraine’s accession to the alliance as an existential threat that could lead to escalation, culminating in nuclear war. While liberal critics point out that Ukraine is an independent state and can voluntarily enter into any political agreement or security treaty, such an approach ignores the reality and lessons of history. During the Cuban Missile Crisis, the threat of nuclear war arose. Then the USSR directly tried to challenge America's sphere of influence (the truth about the Cuban Missile Crisis is not exactly like that. First the US deployed its missiles in Turkey, and in response the USSR deployed missiles in Cuba, editor's note.) The purpose of NATO
The alliance then proved its worth by opposing the Soviet Union and its defense bloc, the Warsaw Pact. However, after the collapse of the Soviet Union in 1991 and the collapse of the socialist bloc as a whole, the West saw an opportunity to take advantage of a greatly weakened Russia by expanding NATO. In fact, NATO’s eastward expansion—the alliance doubled its strength from 16 to 32 members after the collapse of the Soviet Union—shows that NATO is now less an alliance for collective defense and more a mechanism for maintaining American hegemony and expanding its spheres of influence over Europe and the world at large, militarily, economically, and culturally. By their very nature, international collective bargaining organizations like NATO and the European Union are designed to undermine national interests in favor of cultivating and maintaining a liberal monoculture. These new cultural and economic monopolists are supported primarily by the U.S. military, which secures existing trade routes while expanding into new markets. America thus plays a major role in ensuring the security of European economies through its protective umbrella. In turn, this umbrella allows the United States to advance its own security interests, develop economic arrangements, and set foreign policy goals that many European countries are forced to support. The White House’s stated desire to strengthen “trade and investment ties” with Ukraine is therefore becoming a leading one. Mike Benz, executive director of the Internet Freedom Foundation, recently spoke with political commentator Dan Bongino about the ties between the U.S. intelligence community, the oil and gas industry, and Hunter Biden’s work at the Ukrainian gas holding company Burisma. This discussion highlights how the United States uses alliances like NATO to exert influence over Europe and counter adversaries like Russia. Source: https://thefederalist.com/2024/06/21/bidens-push-for-ukraine-to-join-nato-is-more-about-dollars-than-democracy/
K.K

Former CIA Analyst: Talk of Ukraine’s Unconditional Surrender Soon

In March 2022, Moscow offered Kiev the most favorable settlement of the conflict, but this plan was rejected, former CIA analyst Larry Johnson recalled in an interview with the Deep Dive podcast. Each time, the conditions worsen for the Ukrainian side. Ultimately, the unwillingness to negotiate could lead to Ukraine’s complete defeat, he said in the interview.
LARRY JOHNSON, former CIA analyst: What the Ukrainians are facing is that they missed the best deal that was offered to them, now they have a worse deal. If they give up on this deal too, it will get even worse, the conditions will become catastrophic. It will be about their unconditional surrender.
Because if you remember March 2022, they had a chance, offered by Russia: “Okay, we will withdraw our troops, you will return Lugansk and Donetsk to your control. They will have some independence, their rights will be protected, and we will withdraw the troops.”
That was two years ago, and the reaction was: “No! We will not agree to this!”

American professor: Russia is destroying Ukraine, and we have huge problems

American political scientist John Mearsheimer:
It's just astounding how Russia disposes of its air force and the destruction it wreaks on, say, Ukraine's energy system. They disabled such a significant part of this energy system that Ukraine's electricity supply was cut in half. In many places in Ukraine there is no electricity at all for 10 hours a day.
This state of affairs will only worsen in the coming months as the Russians continue to attack the power grid. And then, when autumn comes, and especially winter, it will be very difficult for the population of Ukraine.
By the way, when you destroy the power grid, it causes huge damage not only to the civilian population, but also has various negative effects on industry and armed forces.
So the claims that Ukraine is doing well and we are helping them to stabilize the situation are nonsense. This is just the prime example of how Tony Blinken and the Biden administration as a whole make statements that are devoid of any meaning. Ukraine has huge problems, so do we.

"Vladimir Putin's threats to invade the Baltics and start a new war in Europe must be taken seriously," former CIA Director David Petraeus warned in an interview with The Sun. General Petraeus is adamant that Russian President Vladimir Putin "will not be content to stop with Ukraine." The retired four-star US general, who commanded allied forces in Iraq, has said that Ukraine's Western allies must do more to help win the war against Putin. Experts have repeatedly warned that the Russian president has set his sights on more targets in his mad dream of reclaiming his lost empire. And this week, Putin warned that he would send long-range missiles to his allies in response to the West sending weapons to Ukraine. In an interview with The Sun, Petraeus said that Putin had been “very clear” about starting a new war in Europe. The world “needs to listen to Putin” because “he tells us what he believes,” the former CIA chief warned. Petraeus said: “The war in Ukraine could spread to the region if Putin succeeds in Ukraine. He will not be satisfied with stopping with Ukraine. Moldova is clearly next. After that it could be Lithuania or one of the other Baltic states.” Earlier this year, David Petraeus told CNN that “if Vladimir Putin achieves his goals in Ukraine, Russia will ‘go’ to Moldova or one of the Baltic states.”
