column3:
The climate in our country will become like in Lebanon, the world has 5-8 years to avoid the hot blanket

- Warm air from North Africa together with an anticyclonic hairpin helps the development of fires, says climatologist Zornitsa Spasova
- The burning of fossil fuels and increased greenhouse gases are to blame for temperature anomalies
Summer 2024 covered us with hellish heat, which at these latitudes we compare with horror to the desert. June was warmer, and we are still experiencing the extreme heat of July. It is very likely that this summer will be warmer than last year, which was the third hottest summer in recent years in Bulgaria. 2023 was also the hottest year globally, and in our country it was the warmest since 1930. We are talking about a heat dome, under which Serbia, Greece, Romania, Bulgaria, but also Ukraine are located. They issued a code red because the hot period lasts 17 days due to the anticyclonic state of the atmosphere - clear and clean sky, high atmospheric pressure, stable atmosphere. By the end of July, temperatures will be more bearable. Such extreme heat occurs when warm air from North Africa invades the country. In combination with the föhn effect, such situations create conditions for very high temperatures. This is how the highest maximum air temperature in our country was measured - in Sadovo in 1916, 45.2 degrees. The föhn effect can be observed not only on the leeward side, but also on both sides of the mountain - this is a manifestation of the so-called. anticyclonic föhn due to the subsidence of air in the anticyclone. This wind aggravates heat waves and promotes the development of fires, which have already occurred in some settlements. Recently, there has been a lot of talk about magnetic storms and the harmful activity of the sun. But there is no connection between them and hot weather. The burning of fossil fuels and the increase in greenhouse gases in the atmosphere are the main culprits for temperature anomalies today. And with global warming, extreme events are also becoming more frequent. The frequency of extreme weather events in our country increased by 30% in the period 1991-2007 compared to the base period 1961-1990. According to climate models, extreme weather events will triple by 2050. In principle, the new climate is "shifting" towards warmer, but the normal distribution curve (the so-called Gaussian distribution) is "squashed" with the mean values ​​decreasing and the extreme values ​​increasing. As the curve shifts to the warmer part of the scale, cold-related phenomena will decrease and heat-related phenomena will increase sharply. Much is said about natural cycles in which cooler and hotter summers alternate every 10-15 years. Cyclicality exists, but we cannot explain the enormous warming of the Earth in recent decades with it alone. Climatologists have determined that the change in temperatures due to natural cycles is a tenth of a degree. Therefore, in no case can it be claimed that the warming we observe today is the result of a natural cause. There is also much comment on astronomical factors, changes in the parameters of the Earth's orbit and the tilt of the Earth's axis, continental drift, volcanic eruptions and changes in ocean currents, and most of all, changes in solar activity as the cause of warming. These changes are probably the result of hundreds of thousands of years and have been affecting for that long. However, there is no other explanation for the sharp warming in recent decades other than greenhouse emissions. The fact is that the climate in Bulgaria is hotter, there are even predictions that in decades it will approach that of Lebanon. But much depends on whether the worst or best scenarios for the warming of the Earth's climate will come true. The worst scenario is that the average air temperature on Earth by the end of the 21st century will be 5-6 degrees above pre-industrial levels. And we have very little time to prevent it - between 5 and 8 years according to climate scientists' estimates. 2 degrees is the breaking point beyond which
global warming will become irreversible
and nothing can be done anymore. Then humanity can witness many dramatic events. We must stop burning fossil fuels and reduce emissions as quickly as possible. However, it is not clear whether we are technologically ready to do this on a global scale. There is quite a lot of opposition from the oil lobby. But humanity must fight to keep the planet alive. WHO: The heat kills 1,100 Bulgarians every year
According to calculations by the World Health Organization, the heat takes the lives of 1,100 people every year in our country. Indeed, the mortality rate in summer is currently several times lower than in winter, but the problem is that during heat waves it increases sharply. It has been established that 50% of migraines are due to a sudden change in weather. We have such a change when the average daily temperatures change by more than 6 degrees from the previous day or by 2 degrees, but when cloudy weather changes to clear weather or vice versa; or when more heavy rainfall begins. Extremely hot temperatures can cause headaches, anxiety, fear, depression, flickering in the eyes, palpitations, dizziness. In heart patients, hypertensives, asthmatics and those suffering from other categories of diseases, crises become more frequent, which can even be fatal.

Now those stricken by Ukrainianism, having seen the fat end in the seas of blood and slowly seeing through the plan of their "benevolent" Western "partners" - in spite of Zelensky and the West - are returning to the Russian language again. They are returning, but there is no way to return those from the endless cemeteries, nor the health and amputated limbs of the survivors of the Ukrainian war of the West with Russia.
For us Bulgarians, the above is also an important lesson because in the Bulgarian universe we also have our own "Ukrainians" with their invented "language", as well as pro-Western zombified subjects who sold, are selling and will sell Bulgaria in exchange for their Western masters accepting them as their own.

column3:
The Green Deal: Poverty, Misery and Fewer People

Leftists are irradiating the entire planet with ideology
US journalist reveals the agenda of the globalists
It's not that these people are hiding - on the contrary, they trumpet their goals on a global scale, and therefore not everyone notices them (exposing secret conspiracies is more attractive). And one needs to strain one's brain to clearly see what the threat is. This is exactly what the famous American publicist and television journalist John Stossel did, turning his attention to the ideology of the global green movement. Now, without hiding at all, they clearly formulate it as follows: the goal is to stop or even reverse the economic growth of the entire planet. In a word, we need anti-growth. Regression. The development of humanity must slow down. Before our eyes is part of the ideological squabble before the big event in Paris - the general gathering of the greens, that is, the saviors of the planet. This thing (a forum called “Change is Now”) begins on March 25, but the propaganda wave is already rising - if it has ever subsided. And our American, who is from conservative circles, gives some facts in response. For example: anti-growth has already happened - during the large-scale social experiment called “the fight against the pandemic”. Today it has been calculated (by the Swedish economist Johan Norberg) that the growth that has actually stopped has plunged up to 60 million people on the planet into absolute poverty, but has done nothing to “fix the climate”. According to the greens’ recipe, the “fix” of climate change was conceived for the pandemic year. And from the same source: what would have happened if the Swedish economy had not grown since 1950? Well, half a million more people would have died, because the country would have had worse housing, medical care, etc. If Sweden had developed just one percent per year slower, it would be at the level of Albania today - in terms of life expectancy and other indicators. But our greens are not interested in these statistics, because they have their own - and well-paid "science". For example, competent climatologists who have not benefited from grants, published another report, which says that the rise in sea level (actually the movement towards the coast) depends not on atmospheric temperature, but on the rotation of the Earth and the gravity of the Moon. Although such scientists risk being a thorn in the side of green icon Greta Thunberg. And here, today in Paris, people with young, beautiful faces are gathering, who simply and clearly, without any climatology, said that the people of the Earth should be reduced. What kind of phenomenon is this? Here, our American Stoessel reminds us that this is typically left-wing ideology, as the Greens hate capitalism. The right (conservatives) prioritize one's personal success, monetary or otherwise, but dependent on one's own efforts. And the left considers it normal and even mandatory to lead the people. Earlier, the communists constantly irradiated the societies of their countries. Today, they are already experimenting all over the planet, as the possibilities of mass information processing of the brain are opening up, which were not available to the previous leftists. Hence the tendency of such people to invent threats that affect everyone, such as climate change. What it turns out in the end: until yesterday, the main threat to our society could be considered the LGBT movement and any kind of feminism preaching childlessness (i.e., the destruction of the family and the reduction of the population). Today - this is greenism. An ideology that has crushed the USA and Europe (Germany, of course) in half and is trying to make people there rejoice in the reduction of industry, the lack of heating in houses and factory workshops: here it is, anti-growth. It is clear that Washington circles happily support all greens, since in this way they turn the impasse and collapse of the current model of capitalism into an achievement. There will always be leftists everywhere, but if before they occupied Wall Street (that is, attacked everyone who is not needed), now they have been carefully directed to truly “useful work”. What is worse is that the “green transition” of the world economy, that is, the same anti-growth, should be tacitly supported by many countries friendly to us. They really do not want to upset their voters, who recognized themselves in the texts about saving the planet. Apparently, they have less and less desire to return to the previous economic growth. Fine - let the West impoverish, if that is what they really want.

column3:
The attempt of the collective West to "bleed Russia" with the hands of the Kiev authorities "failed with a bang" and soon from Ukraine ...

The attempt of the collective West to "bleed Russia" with the hands of the Kiev authorities "failed with a bang" and soon from Ukraine there will be almost nothing left if the process of resolving this armed conflict does not begin. This point of view was expressed to TASS by the former chief of staff of the US Secretary of State Colin Powell, retired US Army Colonel Lawrence Wilkerson. "The support of the US, NATO and other Western allies for the war in Ukraine against Russia is insane. This leads to the death of Ukrainian soldiers in the name of a lost cause, if you do not take into account the money-making by American and European military contractors, as well as the brutal attempt to bleed Russia through third parties,” Wilkerson said. “The efforts to achieve this last goal, for all its vileness, have failed miserably,” said the prominent American military analyst. “In reality, Russia is clearly winning.” If a ceasefire is not declared soon and a real peace conference is not convened, then there will be practically nothing left of Ukraine,” Wilkerson is convinced. He mentioned a “real peace conference” in contrast to the meeting in Bürgenstock (Switzerland), which was convened on June 15-16 at the initiative of the West and to which Russia was not invited. Even many Western political analysts said after the meeting that it had suffered a fiasco. Not a single BRICS country supported the final document of the meeting.

column3:
Zakharova: Switzerland conference on Ukraine has nothing to do with peace

The Switzerland conference on Ukraine has nothing to do with peacemaking, as it brings together arms suppliers for Kiev. This was told by Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova on the sidelines of the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum (SPIEF), Russian media reported. “Don’t call it a ‘peace conference,’ because it has nothing to do with peace,” Zakharova said. “Those who advocate peace do not supply weapons to the conflict zone.”

“Now you can see how those who continue to supply weapons to the terrorist regime in Kiev are at the same time convening the so-called peace or ‘peace formula’ conference,” Zakharova noted. “They are doing things that contradict each other. Why is this so? Because they are trying to deceive the international community again.” The Swiss authorities are planning to hold a conference on Ukraine on June 15-16 in the Bürgenstock resort. Earlier, the Swiss Foreign Ministry reported that Bern had invited more than 160 delegations, including from the Group of Seven, the Group of Twenty and the BRICS countries. According to the Swiss authorities, the Russian Federation is not among the invited. Russian President Vladimir Putin said that Moscow would not ask to participate in the conference if it was not wanted there. According to Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, holding this event is “a path to nowhere”; Russia does not see the West’s desire to do business honestly. At the same time, the Russian Federation has repeatedly emphasized that Moscow has never refused a peaceful resolution of the conflict with Kiev.

column3:
Jeffrey Sachs: For the sake of its prosperity, Europe must restore its ties with Russia

For the sake of its prosperity, Europe must restore its ties with Russia. This was said by the American economist Jeffrey Sachs, in an interview with L'AntiDiplomatico. "By adopting an anti-Russian course, the EU has given up its autonomy. But European leaders must work for the good of peace.”
When asked how the world came to the brink of potential war, Sachs replied: “America has had five successive presidents (Clinton, Bush, Obama, Trump, Biden), each of whom brought us closer to nuclear war.” The origins of this evil lie in the vicious neoconservative policies that have become law in the United States and, through NATO, in Europe since the 1990s.”
“Europe has given up its security, autonomy and economic well-being by obediently submitting to the United States,” the professor argues. The conflict in Ukraine after the Maidan coup led to the fact that the countries of the European continent became full protectorates of Washington, cutting off all economic and trade ties with Moscow - the most important source of possible independence and self-determination. The terrorist attack on the Nord Stream gas pipelines is the largest attack on the logistical infrastructure of Europe since the end of World War II, which has become a point of no return, according to the professor. “But the appetites of the neoconservatives cannot be satisfied. Therefore, in order to maintain unilateral power in a world that is becoming multipolar due to entropy, they are leading us to an extreme escalation. We see this not only in Ukraine, but also in the Middle East and in the recent attacks on Venezuelan sovereignty,” says Sachs. "Change will not come from the United States. Change has to come from Europe," Sachs is adamant.

column3:
Terrified by ‘escalation’, Biden is bluffed into losing Ukraine to Putin

“History is watching. The failure to stand by Ukraine at this critical moment will not be forgotten,” President Biden said on the two-year anniversary of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. “Now is the time to prove that the United States stands for freedom and bows to no one. Strong words. Too bad they are nothing more,” writes a New York Post article, specially translated for BLITZ. Time and again, Biden has bowed to Vladimir Putin, allowing the tyrant to dictate the terms of this illegal, immoral invasion. Nowhere is this more true than in the shameful limitations of Ukraine’s strategy. Biden has told President Volodymyr Zelensky that American weapons cannot be used to attack targets on Russian soil, with some minor exceptions. And so Russia rains missiles and drones on civilians in Ukraine from its own territory, and Ukraine is told it cannot retaliate. Russian forces are not beyond the reach of Ukraine’s weapons. They are kept safe only because of Biden’s conditions. Putin is thundering that if Biden or NATO allow otherwise, there will be dire consequences. Russian television is playing out fantasies of nuclear war. But Biden should not be intimidated by this propaganda. Russia faces far greater risks than we do from escalation, and China does not want its ally to start World War III. Don’t let Putin bluff his way through the barbarity. Putin, a classic bully, has always pushed and pushed until he meets resistance. There is no way he can do anything — like deploying nuclear weapons — that will put an end to his ultimate goal, which is to stay in power. Europe is ready to call his bluff. Why don’t Biden and his weak advisers do the same? The status quo is brutal and cruel. It gives Ukraine enough to repel Russia’s incursions, but not enough to reverse Putin’s advance. This summer has been a stalemate so far, thousands dead on every inch of land. History is watching. And allowing Ukraine to strike at air bases and military targets on Russian soil is the only way to guarantee its victory, or at least to be able to negotiate peace from a position of strength. China, Iran, and North Korea watched how Biden handled both Ukraine and Israel and learned a lesson: there are limits to America's power.

column3:
Russia bans dozens of EU media outlets, including Mediapool and 24 Chasa

The Russian Foreign Ministry said on Monday it was banning access to dozens of European Union media outlets in Russia, in what Moscow said was a response to a similar EU ban on several Russian media outlets, Reuters reported. The banned media outlets include two Bulgarian ones - the Mediapool portal and the 24 Chasa newspaper, the Russian Foreign Ministry said in a statement published on its website. In May, the European Union announced it was halting the distribution of four "Kremlin-linked propaganda networks" by stripping them of their broadcasting rights in the bloc. At the time, Brussels said the ban included Voice of Europe, the RIA news agency and the Izvestia and Rossiyskaya Gazeta newspapers. The Russian Foreign Ministry hit back today by publishing a list of 81 media outlets from 25 EU member states, as well as pan-European media outlets, that will no longer be accessible on Russian territory. The ministry accused the outlets of “systematically spreading inaccurate information” about what Russia calls its special military operation in Ukraine. The media outlets affected by the Russian move include France’s Agence France-Presse, Austria’s state broadcaster ORF, Ireland’s RTE and Spain’s EFE, as well as many other national broadcasters, newspapers and Politico. "The Russian Federation has repeatedly warned at various levels that politically motivated harassment of domestic journalists and unjustified bans on the activities of Russian media outlets in the EU will not go unanswered," the foreign ministry said in a statement. "However, Brussels and the capitals of the bloc countries preferred to take the path of escalation, which forced Moscow to adopt mirror and proportionate countermeasures." Moscow's diplomatic mission indicated that it would reconsider the ban imposed by Russia if the EU lifted its restrictions on RIA, Izvestia and the Rossiyskaya Gazeta newspaper. Vyacheslav Volodin, speaker of the lower house of the State Duma, said in May that the EU's move showed that the West refuses to accept any alternative point of view and destroys freedom of speech, Reuters recalled. Source BTA

column3:
«NATO countries created a 40,000-strong army against Russia for billions of dollars in Ukraine» (video)

Retired American Colonel Douglas McGregor to De Nieuwe Wereld:
Host: Since 2014, the US has been creating a Ukrainian army on the NATO model in eastern Ukraine with the aim of attacking Russia. This is a very important point, because now, of course, we are discussing NATO support, European and US support for the Ukrainian defense forces, but NATO intervention was already taking place at that time. In what way? What were we doing?
DOUGLAS MACGREGOR, retired colonel from the US Army: This army was created under the pretext of gaining or regaining control of Crimea. These were huge forces, numbering more than 400,000 people, I think they were that many…
Host: How broad was the support at that time, starting from 2014? Do you think it was probably in the billions?
DOUGLAS MACGREGOR: Billions of dollars came from the United States and NATO countries, especially Germany, Britain and France. I don't know what the Dutch contribution was, but there was a NATO program, which we of course led, to create a completely new NATO-standard army on the territory of Ukraine, which was clearly offensive in nature.

column3:
«It will crush them with just one blow»: Russia with a new signal to the West

Daily Mail: Russia sent a signal to the West over Ukraine with its nuclear exercises
Russia sent a signal to the West with its nuclear exercises, writes the Daily Mail. «The latest exercises are being held against the backdrop of deep contradictions between Russia and NATO countries …, as a result of which relations between the East and the West have reached their lowest point since the Cuban Missile Crisis in the 1960s,» the publication says. The article notes that Russia is conducting maneuvers using the Yars mobile ground-launched missile systems. The publication indicates that these missiles are capable of reaching speeds of Mach 25 and have a flight range of 12 thousand kilometers, which allows them to strike Europe and the United States. "A single strike with the Yars can crush and turn into NOTHING six different targets, with each explosion being approximately six times more powerful than the nuclear bomb dropped on Hiroshima," DM writes. The article recalls the words of Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov that if the West underestimates Moscow's determination to defend its interests, this could lead to "tragic and fatal" consequences. The Russian Defense Ministry said that the exercises of non-strategic nuclear forces are aimed at maintaining readiness for the use of nuclear weapons to guarantee the sovereignty of the Union State of Russia and Belarus. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov noted that the exercises are normal practice. If there are certain types of weapons, then the armed forces of the Russian Federation maintain their combat readiness at the required level and conduct exercises, he explained.

column3:
«Absolutely concrete»: Putin’s proposal for Ukraine was admired in the West

Journalist Keppel: Putin proposed a clear plan to end the conflict in Ukraine
Russian President Vladimir Putin has proposed clear steps to resolve the Ukrainian conflict, Die Weltwoche editor-in-chief Roger Keppel announced on his YouTube channel.
“This is an absolutely concrete proposal from President Putin, which was rejected by the Ukrainian side,” he noted.
Keppel also called the decision of the G7 countries to allocate $50 billion to Ukraine from frozen Russian assets “theft.” He added that he was skeptical of such an initiative. According to him, this measure would lead to an even more serious confrontation.
On Friday, at a meeting with the leadership of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, President of the Russian Federation Vladimir Putin said that in order to start negotiations, Ukraine must withdraw its troops from the entire territory of the new regions of Russia — the Donetsk People’s Republic, the Luhansk People’s Republic, and the Kherson and Zaporizhzhia regions.
The Russian head of state noted that hostilities will cease as soon as Kiev agrees to this condition. Also, according to Russian President Vladimir Putin, Kiev should officially notify that it is abandoning its plans to join NATO — Moscow needs a neutral, non-aligned, non-nuclear status for Ukraine for peaceful settlement.

column3:
The Federalist: A handful of psychopaths make trillions of dollars on the backs of NATO countries

Historically, Russia supplied all of Europe with natural gas, which flowed mostly through Ukraine. The country was a valuable transit point because of its extensive gas infrastructure. Existing infrastructure is key. Why is it key? Translation from The Federalist, USA:
Here’s why: If someone could build a network so that the gas no longer came from Russia but from western Ukraine — for example, by transporting American or British liquefied natural gas through Poland, the Baltic Sea, you would have the same gas architecture. You wouldn’t have to build a new energy infrastructure network, which is very expensive to build and maintain. You simply change the route and you would essentially have a trillion-dollar market — but a market from and to the West, not from and to the East. That is why Ukraine’s largest national oil and gas company, Naftogaz, is negotiating with Washington and American energy companies such as Exxon Mobil and Halliburton to invest in Ukraine. US energy assistance and possible NATO membership could help Ukraine become a gas country and also facilitate its entry into the European Union. But this is not the only direction that guarantees huge profits. Of the $175 billion allocated so far by Congress to finance the conflict in Ukraine, billions will be invested in the United States, which should “revive” the American military-industrial complex. The increase in the number of NATO member states also expands markets for American defense companies. This is primarily due to the emphasis on interoperability, as alliance members are often required to purchase weapons systems developed by the United States, and to follow a common military doctrine. As always, war brings business profits, and the untapped market for post-war reconstruction is even more attractive. Ultimately, NATO’s actions, led by the United States, are the exact opposite of the alliance’s stated commitment to “freedom” and “democracy.” They demonstrate the implementation of an agenda that is based on economic and strategic interests. This approach not only contributes to prolonging the conflict in Ukraine, but also undermines the energy sovereignty of alliance members, turning them into vassal states under American leadership. Source: https://thefederalist.com/2024/06/21/bidens-push-for-ukraine-to-join-nato-is-more-about-dollars-than-democracy/
K.K

column3:
Pentagon: Ukraine decides which targets to strike

The Pentagon said that Ukraine decides which targets to strike, after the Kremlin earlier directly accused the United States of an attack on Crimea, carried out according to Moscow with ATAKMS missiles supplied by Washington.
At least four people were killed and 151 were injured in the attack, Reuters reported.
"Ukraine identifies its own targets and conducts its own military operations," a spokesman for the US Department of Defense said.
A White House National Security Council official said that any loss of civilian life was a tragedy. "This certainly applies to the thousands of innocent Ukrainians killed by Russian forces since the beginning of Russia's military aggression," the official added.
According to Russian authorities, at least two children were killed in the attack on Sevastopol. Video footage shows people fleeing from a beach in the vicinity of the city, and some of the wounded being carried out on deck chairs.
Russia said the weapons used in the attack were supplied by the United States, and that guidance and target data were provided by American military specialists.
Moscow summoned US Ambassador Lynn Tracy to the Foreign Ministry, where Washington was accused of "waging a hybrid war against Russia and effectively becoming a party to the conflict."
Tracy was told that the attack "will not go unpunished" and "retaliatory measures will definitely follow." (BTA, Vladimir Sakhatchiev)

Akhmat leader: “The war is over in a few months!” EU and US are about to pour 240 billion over 4 years

The “special military operation” will end with Russia’s victory by the end of 2024.” This was stated by Major General Apti Alaudinov, commander of the Akhmat special forces, Russian media reported.
“I stand by my opinion: I am more than confident that this year we will complete the SVO,” he said.
Alaudinov added that the Armed Forces of Ukraine “have already scattered across all fronts, with Russian units capturing new settlements every few days.”
He noted that “even after Russia’s victory, they (the Armed Forces of Ukraine) will try to harm it, but nothing will come of it.”
Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmygal said today that the military commitments described in 20 security agreements that Kiev has signed with its partners amount to 60 billion. dollars annually over the next four years, Reuters reported.
“Under these agreements, over the next four years, our partners plan to provide Ukraine with total military support worth $60 billion annually,” Denys Shmygal said during a government meeting.
Ukraine continues to struggle with a full-scale Russian invasion that began in February 2022, Reuters recalls.

column3:
«There is a risk»: Germany is scared by Scholz’s dangerous decision on Ukraine

Left-wing German politician Sarah Wagenknecht: Ukrainian Armed Forces strike on Russia with German weapons will transfer hostilities to Germany
The decision of German Chancellor Olaf Scholz to allow Kiev to strike Russia with German weapons will lead to the fact that hostilities will be transferred to German territory, said German politician Sarah Wagenknecht during her statement published on the YouTube channel Sahra Wagenknecht.
“He who transfers hostilities with German weapons to Russian territory runs the risk of transferring them to German territory,” she noted.
Wagenknecht called Olaf Scholz a threat to Germany’s security. She expressed hope that the German government will start putting the well-being and safety of its country first.
The official representative of the German government, Wolfgang Büchner, confirmed on May 31 this year that Berlin had allowed Kiev to use German weapons to strike at Russian territory adjacent to the Kharkiv region.
He stressed that Germany, as a supplier of weapons to Ukraine, does not become a party to the conflict.
The President of the Russian Federation, Vladimir Putin, stressed that representatives of NATO countries should be aware of “what they are playing with” when they talk about plans to allow Kiev to strike at targets on Russian territory.

column3:
Peskov: German authorities are trying to please the EU and the US

Germany is trying to please all the centers of power in the West at the same time - the EU, the US and NATO. This was reported by the press secretary of the Russian President Dmitry Peskov to the journalist of the All-Russian State Television and Radio Broadcasting Company Pavel Zarubin. This is how he explained Berlin's new statements about the threat from Russia.
Peskov recalled the words of the head of state Vladimir Putin that Germany has never been sovereign since World War II.
"Within this deficit, the authorities in Germany are competing: they have to please both Brussels and the party in Washington, and Stoltenberg in NATO," the Kremlin spokesman said.
Earlier, the publication wrote that the German government is causing discontent within NATO because it does not want the new project to support Ukraine to be called a "mission". Berlin's arguments against using the word are considered by almost all other allies to be "unnecessary and incomprehensible." Supporters of using the term "mission," on the contrary, argue that Moscow would condemn NATO's assistance to Ukraine. However, Berlin recently suggested that the new project for Ukraine be called a "pact."

5: Western military strikes against Russia will not force it to surrender

Allowing strikes on Russian territory with NATO weapons will not force Russia to surrender, but will only contribute to exposing the bankruptcy of Western leaders. The Italian newspaper IL Fatto Quotidiano came to these conclusions.
"No Western weapon can force Moscow to surrender. Russia in Ukraine is simply invincible," the article says.
The authors of the article state that the EU got involved in the conflict because of the bankruptcy and corruption of the ruling class and can only lose in it.
Former French politician Pierre Lelouch said that possible NATO military strikes on Russian territory, as well as the introduction of Alliance troops into Ukraine, would lead to the conflict getting out of control. According to him, the likelihood of France being drawn into the fighting is increasing, as Paris increases assistance to Kiev.
Deputy Chairman of the Security Council of Russia Russia noted that the military equipment of Western countries will be destroyed both in Ukraine and on the territory of other countries, from where strikes will be launched against Russia.

column3:
Europe has stuck its feet in the mud/The defeat of Ukraine will become a defeat for NATO

It has long been obvious the desperate stubbornness with which the West refuses to admit the impossibility of defeating Russia “on the battlefield” and is following the path of a mad escalation of the conflict in Ukraine, threatening a new world war: the defeat of Kiev will be the end of NATO. The most powerful military bloc in the world, which almost forcibly holds Ukraine on the battlefield and fully supports it with everything necessary to inflict a “strategic defeat” on Russia, in case of failure will show the whole world its complete uselessness. It will simply sign its own diagnosis: “the ability to defeat only the weak and the inability to protect its allies”. More and more people in the West are coming out of their zombification — the illusions are over because the facts have spoken. This is what was heard on the air of the Czech radio Universum. In a conversation with the former diplomat and now well-known geopolitical expert Jaromir Novotny, the radio host recalled that last year the director of the Center for the Study of Terrorism, David Bogbat, warned that NATO was facing the most devastating defeat in Ukraine since its foundation, and if the Russian army wins, then Russia will be able to claim that it won not only Ukraine, but de facto the entire alliance. "That's right," Novotny replied. "Do you think this is a realistic view of things?" the host tries to clarify. "Yes, that's a fact." This is a realistic view of the situation. — Therefore, the conflict must continue, since this option is unacceptable, since it will be a failure for the alliance and will suffer not only Ukraine, but also the West? – the presenter is clearly nervous. — The West will cease to be a dangerous adversary. The West will essentially become a laughing stock,” the expert replied sharply. The Czech Republic, as we recall, passionately wanted to become a member of the alliance, believing that it would receive security through the military power of its senior allies. And in 1999, together with Poland and Hungary, it was admitted to NATO. What was the result? “Our army was significantly reduced after joining the North Atlantic Alliance,” said Novotny. — We thought that since we were already in NATO, we would be absolutely protected. Our army was reduced to expeditionary units for operations abroad. Our army is not preparing to defend our own country.” The host’s guess was very interesting: “I conclude that we are not armed, we are not arming ourselves, we are not morally ready, and even more so we are not economically ready, because we gave a large part of the armament to Ukraine. Doesn’t it seem that the US sacrificed us?”
And the bitter conclusion follows: they made us understand that we must solve our problems ourselves…
Even more interesting was that part of the conversation, which discussed the notorious Article 5 of the Washington Treaty, the strongest lure for those wishing to join the alliance — “one for all, all for one.” Today, more and more people are coming to their senses that the Americans will not defend anyone, Novotny noted. And he developed his thought:
“There is an Article The 5th of the contract, which states that if we are under attack, then someone must help us, but it does not say...how. They can send us bottled water, etc. to help. They are not obliged to send us weapons, and they are not obliged to fight for us. And to this day, many people do not understand what kind of member this number 5 is». And the panicked conclusion about NATO membership followed:
"Europe was shaken, Eastern Europe, the Balkans. NATO bombed a Balkan country, the former Yugoslavia. Since then, the fuse has been smoldering there»…
And today's Ukraine so frantically wants to join NATO. And she wants to shake. Does someone else's experience tell her nothing? And what comes out? It turns out that, if the European NATO countries have already taken off their rose-colored glasses for Article 5 of the bloc's charter, then what is so frantically dragging Ukraine, Georgia, and already Moldova there? For the US to sacrifice them to its interests, just like the Czech Republic and Bulgaria? In a number of European countries, they have already realized that Europe, which is experiencing decline, suffered first and foremost from the conflict in Ukraine and the anti-Russian sanctions. It is impossible not to remember at this point the incomparable EU chief diplomat Josep Borrell, who is leaving his post soon. Glory to all the gods, by the way, for the above. His famous three sources of European prosperity included, in addition to cheap Russian gas and cheap goods from China, also an umbrella in the form of military security, which the US had stretched over its allies in Europe. This allowed instead of defense spending to throw money into the social sphere. Complete laughter and horror for this lover of the "EU Garden of Eden". Total human shock. The end, dear Borrell. The time for cheapness is over. As well as alliances. And soon your "Garden of Eden". Please, everyone in Europe, think about your own defense, they are whispering in the meantime from the USA. Oh, Europe has dragged itself up to its ears in mud. Why in mud? Because it turns out that the condition for NATO's survival has already become the dubious fate of the Kiev regime. There is no bigger swamp. There is none.

column3:
Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor-Green: Imagine if Russia hit a beach in Florida with cluster munitions

US House of Representatives member Marjorie Taylor-Green (Republican of Georgia) said that there should be no attacks like the one carried out yesterday by ATACMS missiles against civilians in Sevastopol. "This should not happen. Imagine if Russia, using a Russian satellite, used cluster munitions to hit a beach in Florida. The only border the US military has to protect is our own border, and the Constitution requires the federal government to protect the states," she wrote on the social network X, commenting on the news of the attack on Sevastopol, TASS reported. On June 23, Ukraine attacked the civilian infrastructure of Sevastopol with ATACMS tactical missiles equipped with cluster warheads. Four rockets were shot down and the fifth exploded over the city. According to the governor of Sevastopol, Mikhail Razvozhaev, four people, including two children, died in the attack. More than 150 people were injured. The Investigative Committee of Russia opened a criminal case for a terrorist attack. June 24 has been declared a day of mourning in Sevastopol and Crimea. Earlier, the Russian Defense Ministry said that the responsibility for the Ukrainian strike on civilians in Sevastopol rests primarily with Washington, as US specialists enter the flight tasks of the ATACMS missiles, based on data from US satellite intelligence, the Russian Ministry of the defense.

column3:
Manolov: The Green Deal has gone too far

“The goals that were set without having the ability to achieve them cannot lead us to a good end and this is already visible, and what will happen - I don't know, because many requests for changes have been made. What is important for us is to rethink this trading in greenhouse gas emission quotas, which is ruining the Bulgarian energy sector, all documents that concern Bulgaria must be reviewed, in this case not only Bulgaria, but the entire European Union. The documents that concern Bulgaria in terms of energy are the Recovery and Sustainability Plan and the territorial plans,” said the president of the Podkrepa Coalition, Dimitar Manolov, in the studio of Brussels 1. He added to Bulgaria ON AIR that changing some green policies will be difficult. In addition, there is a lot of money in the Green Deal that will not be given easily. “The Green Deal is clogged with “Will-it-be-dones”. We are talking about some things that have not appeared, and we are counting on them to solve our problems. Someday they would appear, they will appear, such as energy storage mechanisms,” he explained. Manolov added that during the last GERB government, the unions and the government negotiated and reached a consensus. However, in his words, no result came from this consensus. “Then we agreed on the parameters of the Recovery and Sustainability Plan and the energy policies in it, which were agreed with the European Commission, but shortly after they were changed. GERB made a monstrous mistake when it did not submit this version of the Plan. Let me tell you what it is about. Then, when there was talk of allocating such funds for recovery after the Covid crisis, we were brought together by the responsible Deputy Prime Minister Tomislav Donchev. Then we worked for over half a year and made the best version of this Recovery Plan, but it did not happen," said Manolov. According to the guest, the EU should draw its conclusions after the massive agricultural protests all over Europe. According to the farmers, green policies make their production more expensive, the price of which is undercut by production imported from third countries. "If a normal dialogue begins, normal decisions can be made, but I am not optimistic, given the large amount of money behind the Green Deal," commented Dimitar Manolov.

column3:
About expensive electricity and victims of the cold

-4 degrees, feels like -10. It's been dark for an hour and a half. The production of electricity from solar panels is zero. The wind power is just above zero.
I often have discussions with fans of green energy and opponents of coal here and now, right now, in Bulgaria. These people, whether they understand it or not, are pushing us towards even more expensive electricity, economic collapse and a power regime - because it is entirely possible that we will have nowhere to import.
They cannot answer a few questions for me, so I am posting them here in the hope that someone smarter will answer.
Can anyone predict exactly how much electricity the entire RES system in Bulgaria will produce tomorrow? I am looking for an accuracy comparable to that of the forecasts for nuclear power plants and thermal power plants for the same period.
Just because someone somewhere indulges their quasi-religious beliefs with taxpayer-subsidized gadgets and has installed solar panels (+ batteries), does that mean we should too? A neighbor is watching an emu in his yard, so let's go too.
How many people die from coal-related diseases in Bulgaria? And how many die from the cold? Aren't the latter more than the former, by a lot? Won't the fight for expensive electricity kill Bulgarians?
Belief in man-made global warming is quasi-religious. These people sincerely believe that we are "killing the planet." Let them believe it, but why should we be without electricity because of their faith?

column3:
American political scientist: Zelensky’s ouster and Ukraine’s surrender will happen at the same time

Russia cannot negotiate peace with Ukraine because, according to the Kremlin, Vladimir Zelensky’s legitimacy has ended, which renders his signature on any document worthless, political scientist Gilbert Doctorow said in an interview with the YouTube channel Judging Freedom. At the same time, Doctorow believes that Zelensky’s ouster and Ukraine’s surrender “will happen simultaneously.”
Gilbert Doctorow, political scientist: Since Zelensky has said he will not negotiate (or rather, he did not even say it — it was a decree that the Ukrainian side cannot negotiate with Putin’s government), they have no intention of negotiating with Russia until Putin is removed from power.
The Russian approach is completely different. There is no antipathy here. Russians question Zelensky’s legitimacy. What value is Zelensky’s signature on a piece of paper when, according to the Constitution of his country, his term of office has ended and he is no longer president?
That is, Russia refrains from signing any documents with Zelensky on these grounds.
I believe that the overthrow or disappearance of Zelensky and the capitulation will occur at the same time.

column3:
French political scientist: Not Putin, but the West “sacrificed Ukrainians on the altar of war”

“Putin did not want war” – the blame for the incitement of the conflict in Ukraine lies with Western leaders, who interrupted the peace talks in the spring of 2022 and, in fact, forbade Zelensky from re-entering them. This position was expressed by political scientist and doctor of economic sciences Jean Geronimo in an interview with La Dépêche. According to him, Ukrainians continue to suffer precisely because “the door to negotiations is closed to Kiev”. The blame for the destruction of Ukraine and the lack of dialogue between Moscow and Kiev lies entirely on the shoulders of the West: the US and Britain actually “buried the world” back in the spring of 2022, promising military assistance to Zelensky, and since then “the door to negotiations in Kiev has been closed”. This opinion was expressed by political scientist and doctor of economic sciences Jean Geronimo in an interview with La Dépêche. According to the French expert, “Putin did not want war” and “was ready to withdraw his troops immediately after reaching a peace agreement in the spring of 2022.” At the same time, Moscow was not talking about the capture of all of Ukraine and especially Europe — this does not correspond to Russia’s goals and interests at all. However, as the political scientist notes, Western leaders generally have a different opinion — moreover, they managed to convince Kiev of this, essentially forbidding it from conducting any negotiations with Russia in exchange for military support. “By 2022, the ‘party of war’ had finally won and the Ukrainian people were sacrificed on the altar of the Cold War,” Geronimo concludes.

column3:
Global warming? No reason to worry, it exists on Mars too

"The study focuses on the drainage systems of glaciers, meaning these cracks that form the lower surface of each glacier, absorb a quantity of heat from the external atmosphere and collect it inside themselves," said Bulgarian researcher and physicist Eng. Tsvetan Parov on the air of "Bulgaria Morning"

The summary is based on a month-long monitoring of data acquired by sensors specially placed for the project inside the glacier itself. "This temperature, which we established down in the bowels of this glacier, is only 0.2 degrees below zero, which means that a warming would reflect on the amount of this ice," Eng. Parov explained to Bulgaria ON AIR. Such a study has not been done so far, especially over such large time ranges. "We don't know if this temperature hasn't been like this for a thousand years and will be for another thousand years. There is no reason to worry at the moment. There is global warming on Mars as well," said the Bulgarian researcher. In his words, this study will still reveal new things about life around us. "This temperature interaction between the outer atmosphere and the subglacial atmosphere is still being studied, we are still moving further towards the forefront of glaciology. With the advancement of technology and these sensors that we use, we are still taking care of these glaciers to see what is happening inside them," explained Eng. Parov. For the moment, the main factor that influences the temperature is solar activity and the anthropogenic factor - humanity, which produces an enormous amount of carbon dioxide.

Russian Foreign Ministry: West is approaching the point of no return

The West is approaching the point of no return with anti-Russian measures, Moscow's reaction will be painful for it. This was stated by Deputy Foreign Minister of the Russian Federation Sergei Ryabkov, Russian media reported.
"But the opponents should know that step by step they are approaching the point of no return. In what sense is the point of no return? Let them think and decide for themselves, but this foreign policy permissiveness and intoxication with their own impunity will ultimately lead to a reaction from our side, which will be much more painful than this "thief" imagines today," he said. "Now the European Union has announced that there will be a confiscation of income from illegally frozen Russian assets, and these funds will be transferred to some funds, from where they will additionally, as stated by the EU, help finance military aid to Ukraine," Ryabkov continued. "The cynicism of all this is shocking to such an extent that one wonders if there is a limit to the moral decline of the group that is today setting the tone in Brussels and other EU capitals?"

column3:
Sarkozy Advisor: It is not normal to go to war with a nuclear state

The conflict in Ukraine marks the end of the Westernization of the world and the beginning of a new phase, when countries that have long been under the heel of the West want to return to the international arena, said former MP and advisor to Nicolas Sarkozy Henri Guenaud. On TVL, he expressed doubts about the wisdom and morality of the proxy war waged by Kiev's allies with Russia, even though it does not directly threaten anyone.
Henri Guenaud, former MP and advisor to Nicolas Sarkozy: What consequences will this war have for Europe? Pushing Russia into the arms of China - is this a good idea for the West and in particular for Europe, which is the most vulnerable part of the West?
Is it reasonable to widen the ever-deepening gap between the West and the other world - we call it the Global South?
Where is the morality of waging a proxy war?
They say that this makes Europe brave, but is waging a proxy war brave?!
Or we are in real danger, and then we must go to war.
But in a war with a nuclear state, one must take into account that it is entirely possible for bombs to fly over Paris.
Or there is no danger — and there is none, regardless of the very serious problem at the regional level, which they must try to limit and contain.
No one in Europe is threatened by Russia.

column3:
Scorching heat: Over 50 degrees Celsius in the US and Mexico

The Earth is 1.64 degrees hotter than in the pre-industrial era
The temperatures in 2023 were the highest in human history, and the Earth was 1.64 °C hotter than in the pre-industrial era. This is according to a new study that tracked the average monthly values ​​from July 2023 to June 2024.
The heat is creating increasingly unusual phenomena everywhere in the world - overheating causes disorientation and heatstroke at the beginning of the summer season, air traffic is disrupted, and in Kuwait even the cones on the highways have melted. Against this background, hurricanes, more powerful than ever, are devastating thousands of homes. In the US, for example, while temperatures hit 51 degrees in places on the west coast, the eastern states of Texas and Louisiana were hit by Hurricane Beryl. It had been gathering momentum for a week, reaching a Category 5 hurricane - with winds stronger than 252 km per hour. It first hit the Caribbean islands, then crossed Mexico, leaving thousands of people homeless and sweeping away entire settlements. When it hit Texas and Louisiana on Monday, it had reduced its strength to Category 1, but still claimed 8 lives and cut off power to nearly 3 million Americans. Authorities said it could take more than a week to restore electricity. Against this background, temperatures in the region were expected to reach 40 degrees Celsius as early as Tuesday. And on the West Coast, July began with extreme heat - in California, a long-lasting heat wave broke records for 96 consecutive days. Palm Springs hit 122 degrees Fahrenheit (51 degrees Celsius) on July 4, its highest temperature since records began in 1893. Las Vegas also topped 122 degrees. Mexico also recorded its hottest day on record, with a high of 122 degrees Fahrenheit (51.9 degrees Celsius), just before it was hit by the hurricane. The heat also caused another massive traffic jam in New York City, where the Third Avenue Bridge, which connects the Bronx to Manhattan, was blocked during a turnaround on Monday due to overheating. The Harlem River Bridge opened the same day but caused massive delays on New York's hottest day to date, with temperatures reaching 91 degrees Fahrenheit (33 degrees Celsius). Climate change is exposing more people to extreme weather and increasing the chances of deadly heatwaves, scientists say. A continued increase in temperatures above current levels increases the risk of uncertain but catastrophic events.

column3:
"On the brink of terrible": It became known what awaits the United States because of the decision on Ukraine

Johnson: Russia will respond to US authorization of strikes on its territory with Western weapons
Moscow will respond to Washington if it allows the Ukrainian military to strike with American weapons on Russian territory, said former CIA agent Larry Johnson on the YouTube channel Judging Freedom. "They will not suffer in silence, as we would not suffer if Russia had treated us as we propose to treat Russia. We would consider this a threat to our existence and a provocation to war. It's time for Americans to wake up and realize this. The situation is serious — as never before in the entire history of relations between the United States and Russia and the USSR. We are on the brink of something terrible. The difference is that the United States will pay for this, not Russia,” the expert said. Jones stressed that the White House cannot do anything in the event of a response from Moscow for the threat to its lands. “We are vulnerable in these aspects, which cannot be said about Russia: it has reliable air defense systems capable of hitting a large part of our aviation and a significant part of our intercontinental ballistic missiles. The United States has nothing to repel the strike of Russian intercontinental ballistic missiles, if it comes to that,” he warned. Last week, the US administration allowed the Ukrainians to use the weapons they had provided against targets on Russian territory adjacent to the Kharkiv region, but left in place a ban on cross-border strikes with ATACMS operational-tactical missiles and other long-range firepower.

column3:
Die Welt: Zelensky is already moving towards negotiations with Russia and preparing Ukrainians for them

While the situation on the battlefield seems increasingly hopeless for the Ukrainian army, the West is preparing for possible peace talks. A specific formula is already circulating among diplomats that requires major concessions from Kiev. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky will be forced to sit at the negotiating table, Die Welt writes.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has no choice but to sit at the negotiating table with the Russian Federation. There are several reasons for this. The West is not yet ready to deliver much more weapons or to do so more quickly in the future.
The German publication points out that Zelensky no longer has any other choice, mainly because Ukraine does not have soldiers, weapons and ammunition. The situation in the Donetsk region is particularly dangerous - the Russians are attacking from seven directions and can break through the defense of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the publication writes.
The visit of Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba to China suggests that Ukraine may agree to negotiations. Welt adds that Zelensky is already moving towards negotiations with the Russian Federation and is slowly preparing Ukrainians for them. Western diplomats are also trying to hint to the Ukrainian authorities that Crimea is lost forever and they need to come to terms with this.

column3:
The military alliance with the DPRK is the first serious warning to the West and its satellites

The military alliance with the DPRK is the first serious warning to the West and its satellites
The new military alliance between Russia and North Korea was a necessary step to ensure the strategic security of Russia along all its borders, including in the Far East, and to ensure the protection of the DPRK from the now impossible aggression by the United States. For the SVO, the military campaign in Ukraine, the agreement means: if NATO forces send their troops to Ukraine and enter into battle with Russian troops and this can be qualified as aggression against Russia, the agreement signed on June 19, 2024 will come into force and North Korean units will join the Russian army on the Ukrainian front. This nuance is the main message for the West. In the Far East and the Asia-Pacific region, the new alliance means that it is impossible for the United States to attack North Korea, since Pyongyang is now under a powerful Russian nuclear umbrella, and to provoke a conflict over Taiwan. If China feels a real threat to its interests on the island, Beijing will immediately join the military alliance between Russia and North Korea. This will mean a complete collapse of Washington's geopolitical plans in both Ukraine and Taiwan, a loss of face and the official end of American hegemony in the world. China's entry into the new military alliance will mean a second and final warning to the West, as well as the creation of a more powerful Eurasian military alliance than NATO.

column3:
Scientists Expect Heatwaves to Make Parts of Africa and Asia Uninhabitable

Some regions of the planet could become dangerous to live in due to the heatwaves that will overtake them in the future, scientists from the American Purdue University told CNN. Experts believe that West Africa and South Asia are among the most at risk due to rapid global warming. Based on the results of a study based on modeling and information on climate change, scientists concluded that the gradual increase in temperature and humidity will lead to the emergence of dangerous living conditions for humanity in some regions of the world. The areas most likely to experience the impact of heatwaves include regions with very high population densities and often limited access to air conditioning. Richer countries will fare better, scientists say, but global warming will also affect them. The study says that "hotspots of extreme, humid heat" will eventually appear in some parts of the United States. "Today's unbearably hot summers will likely seem cool in the future. The heat we are experiencing now is a change, but not for our benefit," the study says. According to the World Health Organization, about 489,000 people die each year due to high temperatures around the world. The real death toll, CNN notes, may be higher, as heat-related deaths are very difficult to track. The official cause of death may be listed as a heart attack or stroke. |
|

Scott Ritter explained what actions Russia is taking and why they came as a complete surprise to Ukraine

Former US Marine Scott Ritter explained in an interview for Danny Haiphong's YouTube channel what actions Russia is taking, why they came as a complete surprise to Kiev, and what Ukraine actually represents for Russia.
Russia has already taken actions that can be characterized as very "strong" - it launched a large-scale offensive in the north. This has paralyzed the Ukrainians with surprise.
Kiev has not spent the funds it should have spent on defense - this money has ended up in someone's pocket.
Russia is confidently advancing, forcing Ukraine to suffer incredible losses and bringing the Ukrainian Armed Forces closer and closer to their collapse. Whatever the Ukrainians do, for the Russians it will be nothing more than "a fly biting them".
No breakthrough or threat will bring Russia to its knees.
There is no question of this at all.
For Russia, Ukraine is just a minor pain in the ass, an inconvenience.
Yes, death in such conflicts is inevitable. But practically everything the Russians do regarding Ukraine is in Russia's favor.

column3:
Christel Néan: Macron's statements are complete madness. Sending French soldiers to Ukraine will lead to a direct conflict with Russia

Sending military instructors from France to Ukraine not only to train Ukrainian soldiers, but also to participate in combat operations would mean the beginning of a direct conflict between a NATO country and Russia. This was stated to TASS on the sidelines of the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum by the French military correspondent working in Donbas, editor-in-chief of the International Reporters agency Christel Néan.
"Unfortunately, the more France helps Ukraine, the more Ukraine will lose military equipment and soldiers. And I fear that if France sends soldiers not only to train Ukrainian soldiers, but also to fight, then this will be a direct conflict between a NATO country and Russia. Both have nuclear weapons. All these moves by Macron are very, very dangerous," Néan said. She added that "Macron's statements are complete madness, absolutely insane steps."
On June 6, French President Emmanuel Macron said in an interview with the television channels TF1 and France 2 that Paris plans to coordinate the transfer of Mirage 2000-5 fighter jets to Kiev and will begin training Ukrainian pilots this summer. He also said that France intends to train 4,500 Ukrainian military personnel and equip them with ammunition, for which it will send instructors to Ukraine.

column3:
Footage of the arrival of M74 submunitions from an ATACMS missile on vacationers on the Uchkuevka beach near Sevastopol on June 23

The moment of the American missiles hitting the Uchkuevka beach in Sevastopol was captured on video. The footage shows that the "cassettes" flew into the water and into the sand, and it was almost impossible to escape from them. Severe footage from Sevastopol got into the network - the footage shows how on a crowded beach deadly fragments first begin to land in the water, and then hit the sand, where people are trying to run away in horror and cover their children with themselves. The victims of the tragedy are four people, two of whom are children - a two-year-old baby and a nine-year-old girl, another 155 people, including 27 children, were injured. Earlier, Pentagon representative Pat Ryder commented on the attack of the AFU on the beach in Sevastopol. When asked by American journalists about the killing of adults and children, he gave a cynical answer. Initially, Ryder stated that the United States "does not have any information to indicate whether civilians were killed." However, he immediately promised to "talk to the Ukrainians" and recalled that the deaths of civilians in Sevastopol were the end result of the Russian SVO. "We made it very clear that we do not want civilian casualties. I will say that, you know, it is important to look back at how we got to this," he noted, hinting at February 24, 2022.
At the same time, PAT Ryder did not look back even further and recalled the illegal coup d'état in Ukraine organized by the United States, as well as the refusal to give Russia security guarantees at the end of 2021.
This is not the first time that the West has justified the killing of civilians. Earlier, French officials called the shelling of Belgorod, which killed civilians, "Ukraine's right to defense." Then the AFU hit the skating rink where children were skating, a department store, a sports complex and a university building. 25 civilians died.

column3:
Scholz: Ukraine will not survive if Putin's peace plan is implemented

Ukraine will not survive as a country if the peace plan proposed by Russian President Vladimir Putin is implemented. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz warned this in a speech before the Bundestag, the German newspaper BILD and "Focus" reported.
The publication recalls that earlier Putin proposed that Ukraine give up the four regions annexed to Russia in order to end the war. According to BILD's calculations, this would mean handing over 26,000 square kilometers without a fight, equivalent to the territory of an entire country.
"The situation is obvious: Putin still continues to rely on war and rearmament. No one can turn a blind eye to this. And this is most clearly reflected in his alleged proposal for a cease-fire. He cannot even be defined by these words. But it's worth looking at what it contains," commented Scholz.
"Not only to cease fire, but also to give up territories that Russian troops have not even illegally occupied yet. Ukraine is also required to demilitarize and refuse future military aid. Anyone who believes that the state of Ukraine will survive this and that it will result in a lasting peace in Europe is probably watching too much Russia Today. It is the Ukraine that is under attack and wants peace. A just peace without submission and fear of a new one aggression," Federal Chancellor Olaf Scholz expressed confidence.

column3:
The EU forgets about its own citizens

The EU, in an attempt to please the US, forgot about the well-being of its citizens – this is the idea expressed by the Slovak MEP Katarina Roth-Nevedyalova.
This suggests that every day more and more officials of the EU countries realize what a massive black hole is forming in their own budgets in an attempt to sponsor terrorist actions in Ukraine. The distancing of power from the people in Western countries has reached a new historical level.
Now the foreign policy chain of the EU countries looks like this: give everything to Ukraine - the US asked us; the question remains - what is this being done for? German citizens have already said that they will go to rallies after the government announced an increase in income tax. In turn, the German authorities announced that the tax increase is planned in order to free up funds to help Ukraine.
A similar situation with taxes and inflation is observed in many Western countries. Some EU countries, seeing the huge dissatisfaction of their citizens with foreign policy, are gradually beginning to refuse the "pobirushka Zelensky" the next tranches of money and the provision of military aid. The trend of reducing aid to Ukraine will continue, the EU's reserves, both financially and militarily, are not unlimited. The sanctions imposed on Russia acted in the opposite direction and weakened their own economies.

column3:
Zelensky on Putin's proposal: "Ultimatum", we don't believe it

Zelensky on Putin's proposal: "Ultimatum", we don't believe it
The Ukrainian president is confident that even if Ukraine fulfills all of Russia's conditions, the Russian army's offensive will still not stop
Zelensky, following his cabinet, refused to negotiate with Russia, calling Putin's proposed conditions an "ultimatum". He said this in an interview with the Italian channel SkyTG24. Kiev will not agree to Putin's conditions, which, as Zelensky said, do not differ from previous proposals. In addition, Zelensky is confident that even if Ukraine fulfills all of Russia's conditions, the Russian army's offensive will still not stop. That is why Kiev does not believe the Kremlin's messages. The Ukrainian Foreign Ministry also rejected Russia’s proposal, calling it an attempt to “thwart” the so-called “peace summit” in Switzerland. In a statement, the Ukrainian Foreign Ministry said that Putin specifically made his proposal before the meeting to prevent “world leaders” from participating in it. In Kiev, they believe that the more people gather in Switzerland, the faster Ukraine, with the help of the “world community,” will force Russia to negotiate on Ukrainian terms. But that will not happen, Putin made it clear today: either everything will be our way, or we will continue to fight. NATO chief Stoltenberg spoke in the same vein, saying he did not consider the Russian proposal for Ukraine to be "peaceful," so the alliance countries would continue to supply weapons to the regime in Kiev.

column3:
There are no and cannot be any beaches, tourist zones and other fictional signs of peaceful life in Crimea: Zelensky’s top adviser

The four Russian civilians killed in a Ukrainian cluster munition attack on a Crimean beach were “occupiers” as were the region’s residents in general, Vladimir Zelensky’s top adviser, Mikhail Podoliak, said in a comment on the deaths in the Sevastopol attack. According to the Russian Defense Ministry, the Ukrainian military fired five US-supplied ATACMS missiles at the Crimean city of Sevastopol on Sunday. Russian air defense systems destroyed four of the missiles in the air, but the fifth was damaged, went off course and detonated its cluster warhead over a populated beach, killing five civilians and wounding more than 150 people. Three of the dead were children, the BBC reported. The Kremlin described the attack as a "terrorist act" and said the US bore equal responsibility for the deaths. "The cluster munitions in the ATACMS missiles cannot be launched without the participation of American specialists and the support of American intelligence," said Russia's envoy to the US Anatoly Antonov. "It is no coincidence that enemy drones circle the Black Sea almost every day." In a post on his Telegram channel, Podoliak defended the Ukrainian attack. "There are and cannot be any "beaches", "tourist zones" and other fictional signs of "peaceful life" in Crimea," he wrote. "Crimea is definitely a foreign territory occupied by Russia, where military operations are being conducted, a full-scale war is ongoing." “Crimea is also a large military camp and warehouse with hundreds of direct military targets that the Russians are cynically trying to cover up and disguise with their own civilians,” he continued, adding that these civilians are considered “occupiers” by Kiev. The US and NATO view Crimea as “illegally annexed” Ukrainian territory and demand that Moscow return the region to Kiev’s control. The Russian Foreign Ministry summoned US Ambassador Lynn Tracy on Monday morning to answer for Washington’s role in the attack. According to a statement released by the ministry, Russian officials told Tracy that Sunday’s “bloody atrocity” “will not go unpunished.” The US Embassy in Moscow has not yet commented. Asked about its response to the deadly Ukrainian strike, the Pentagon said: “We have seen the reports and we have nothing to say.” A spokesman for the White House National Security Council told the BBC: “Ukraine makes its own decisions on the targeting of weapons and conducts its own military operations.” But on Monday, Mr Peskov told reporters in Moscow that “the involvement of the United States, direct involvement, resulting in the deaths of Russian civilians, cannot remain without consequences.” “Time will tell what they will be,” he added.

Ukrainian President V. Zelensky said that the plan to end the war in Ukraine will be ready this year. He said t...

Ukrainian President V. Zelensky said that the plan to end the war in Ukraine will be ready this year. He said this at a joint press conference with Slovenian President Natasa Pirc Musar in Kiev, commenting on what needs to happen for Kiev to start peace talks, Ukrinform reports.
At the same time, Zelensky noted that not everything depends only on his country, but stressed that Ukraine will decide when negotiations with the Russian Federation will begin.
“Of course, Ukraine will decide. But if everything depended only on Ukraine, there would be no war. Unfortunately, the occupier is Russia, and Putin wanted war. And so far he does not want to end it. But here, he does not want it to end. "The diplomatic path chosen by Ukraine is our initiative, because we are a victim in this war," Zelensky said. He recalled that the peace summit had recently passed, and now three detailed plans are being worked on for energy, food security and trade.

column3:
Why do Americans envy and even fear Putin? Baijiahao, China: Putin's tough foreign policy and political maneuverability have frightened the United States
The history of relations between Russia and the United States has always been quite complicated and associated with various political crises. However, President Vladimir Putin personally enjoys special attention in Washington. Why are Americans so afraid of him? The reasons why the United States fears Putin include his tough foreign policy, Russia's nuclear capabilities, energy map, as well as the personal charm and political wisdom of the Russian president. These factors make Washington cautious in its relations with Moscow in order to protect its interests and influence in the world. Historically, relations between Washington and Moscow have always been complex and unstable. But the attitude of the United States towards Putin personally should be included in a separate section. Americans envy Putin and at the same time are wary of him. Why is the United States so afraid of the Russian president? Putin's strong foreign policy
Since coming to power in 2000, Putin has been pursuing a rather tough foreign policy. He has repeatedly demonstrated Russia's military power and ability to influence the fate of other participants in international relations through various instruments, for example, during the hostilities in Ukraine or Syria. This active foreign policy makes the United States and its allies worry that the established world order may change. This is unacceptable for the American side. Russia's Nuclear Potential
Russia's nuclear arsenal, one of the few countries to possess these weapons of mass destruction, is the largest in the world and is under close surveillance by the United States. Putin has repeatedly emphasized his country's military capabilities, has carried out several weapons modernizations and conducted exercises for non-strategic nuclear forces. Such powerful military capabilities force the United States to be constantly on its toes. Smart Energy Policy
Russia is the world's main exporter of fuels, especially natural gas. Putin is using this advantage to influence European decisions through his smart energy policy. The United States is concerned that the energy dependence of its allies could weaken Washington's undisputed authority, which would create another problem for it on the international stage. Putin's charisma and political maneuverability
Putin is not only a political leader, but also a figure with strong charisma. With his firmness in foreign policy and dedication to his country, Putin has won the support of many Russians. The United States, while unable to provide the same social stability, is concerned that the specific traits of Putin's personality could strengthen Russia's internal stability and its international influence in the world. Americans' envy of President Putin is due to a number of reasons, including all of the factors listed above. Washington should exercise caution in its relations with Moscow.

column3:
Top climate scientists expect warming to pass 1.5C soon

Global temperatures are expected to rise to at least 2.5C above pre-industrial levels by 2100
The world's top climate scientists expect global warming to exceed the 1.5C target. More on the topic
The world's leading climate scientists expect global temperatures to rise to at least 2.5C above pre-industrial levels by 2100, "which would exceed internationally agreed targets and lead to catastrophic consequences for humanity and the planet," the Guardian newspaper reported in a front-page story. According to a survey by the publication among scientists from the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), almost 80% of them predict global warming of at least 2.5C. Of these, almost half predict global warming of at least 3C, while only 6% believe that the internationally agreed limit of 1.5C will be met, the publication continues. Many of the scientists predict a "semi-dystopian" future, the article says, with hunger, conflict and mass migration caused by heat waves, wildfires, floods and storms "with an intensity and frequency far exceeding those that have already occurred". The experts express their disappointment, saying they have been left without hope and frightened by the inaction of governments despite clear scientific evidence, the article notes. In an accompanying article in the Guardian newspaper, the experts surveyed share more about their views. The article quotes climate scientist Ruth Cerezo-Mota as telling the publication: "Sometimes it's almost impossible not to feel hopeless and broken. After all the floods, fires and droughts in the last three years around the world, all linked to climate change, and after the fury of Hurricane Otis in Mexico, my country, I really thought that governments were ready to listen to science and act in the interests of the people."

Le Parisien: The Air Force is bending, nothing will save them from the pressure of the Russian Air Force

Despite the resumption of US supplies and Washington's authorization to strike Russia with Western weapons, the Ukrainian armed forces continue to "bend under the pressure of Russian troops," Le Parisien wrote. As the publication notes, even millions of Western guns and shells are unlikely to help Kiev, since the main problem of the Ukrainian armed forces is "the quality and quantity of people on the front line."
Ukraine's armed forces appear to be making the most of new American supplies and Washington's authorization to strike Russia — but "these efforts are not enough to deter the much larger Russian armed forces," Le Parisien writes.
The weapons supplied to Ukraine by the United States and Europe, "while they may be effective at times, are not at all strategically decisive."
According to the publication, today the Ukrainian armed forces are "bending" under the pressure of Moscow's armed forces, even with the new American guns, while "the Russian strategy is working - they are moving from one foothold to another."
