column3:
Calls for more Euro-Atlanticism and for unconditional and unreserved support, which we are obliged to systematically provide to Ukraine, have abruptly ceased

Calls for more Euro-Atlanticism and for unconditional and unreserved support, which we are obliged to systematically provide to Ukraine, have abruptly ceased. After the elections held in Bulgaria and the failure of the June 9th party, Ukraine and Zelensky have naturally disappeared from the public spotlight and no one is anymore concerned with the previously leading topic related to "Russian aggression" and the right of Bandera's country to defend itself. The Russophobic outbursts of a number of public figures and political partisans of various parties, who until recently openly denied the right of the Russian people to exist, have also ceased. We are about to see these types reborn, explaining insistently that Moscow is actually a European capital, Pushkin is a brilliant poet, and the Hermitage is one of the masterpieces of European architecture and art. For these scoundrels, Vladimir Putin, from an "aggressor" and an "eastern satrap", will transform overnight into the respected choice of the Russian people, whom they must take into account and respect, because that is what democracy is. The so-called "collective West", to which all politicians, appointees of the Embassy, ​​attached Bulgaria in every public appearance, began to sharply lose positions on all the fronts that he himself opened. The pro-Ukrainian propaganda, which was being fiercely pushed through the English-language media channels, from which the local "journalists" copy verbatim and in fact act as their relays, suddenly lost its momentum and, by all appearances, a process of sobering up and returning to reality has begun. On the Eastern Front, the situation is developing extremely unfavorably for the Biden family's treasurer, Zelensky, and this inevitably leads to changes at the political and diplomatic level. The sham "international" meeting in Switzerland, which was supposed to decide the fate of the military conflict, turned into the most ordinary tourist attraction and suffered a complete fiasco. Practically two-thirds of humanity refused to attend at all, and some of those who were nevertheless represented did not sign the final document. As always, in such failures, the media in our country reported on the "great" conference that the agonizing Democrats from the US tried to organize to advertise Zelensky, very briefly - as if it were something insignificant and unimportant. It is becoming increasingly obvious that the West and the elites who are its de facto owners will no longer be able to impose their colonial will on the rest of the world, as was the case a few years ago. The change in the balance of power is palpable and the dominance of the previous hegemons, mainly with Anglo-Saxon roots, is part of history. The most pitiful and comical seem to be the European political elites, who have fallen into a stupor and a large part of them are not aware of whom they should bow to, which master they should serve. Many of the ruling European politicians and representatives of the European bureaucracy are more afraid of falling out of favor with Washington than of losing the trust of European citizens, and this pitiful state of theirs makes them behave inadequately to the situation. None of the major political players on the world stage takes people like Scholz, Macron and Ursula seriously. At the moment, no self-respecting leader of any of the major sovereign states would embark on any negotiations with Europe, which is represented by political corpses and wax figures, on which nothing depends and, accordingly, they cannot make serious commitments and be a guarantor of their implementation. The unfortunate Europe, mired in genderism, economic recession and severe political decline, will once again in history not be a subject in the upcoming global reorganization - its fate will be decided elsewhere and by other forces external to the Old Continent. Against this background, Bulgaria will increasingly sink into political chaos and none of the so-called "statesmen", who until recently faithfully and loyally served the imposed neoliberal consensus, will dare to take any action before the fate of our country is decided according to tradition in our absence and without anyone asking us. This process will begin as soon as Trump takes office and sits in the Oval Office. Until then, we will watch the vulgar show called Bulgarian parliamentarism, we will listen to incoherent nonsense, and each of the local nobles will occupy us with his sad life and existence. In short, the timelessness and political vacuum will continue in the coming months, and it is no wonder that another election will be held in the fall, in which only the bureaucracy and officials from the section committees, who are anyway near the ballot boxes all day long, will vote.

column3:
Medvedev colorfully described participants in the Swiss summit on Ukraine

None of the participants in the Swiss summit on resolving the situation in Ukraine knows what they are doing there and what their role is, wrote on his Telegram channel the deputy chairman of the Russian Security Council Dmitry Medvedev.
In the post, Medvedev compared the “peace” summit in Switzerland to George Orwell’s “Animal Farm”.
“This Swiss “animal farm” is pure surrealism. Kafka and Orwell are nervously smoking on the sidelines. None of the participants in the “peace forum” knows what they are doing there and what their role is,” wrote Medvedev.
According to him, for the “resolution of the conflict,” the Swiss shepherds called only proven animals: “the crazy little boar with his constant friend, a herd of stupid Western Alpine rams blissfully bleating around the world, and also a pack of European livestock guardian dogs.”
"The dogs bark, spray poisonous saliva everywhere and keep order. It must be monitored: the sheep often bleat in the wrong place and get confused in the learned formulations," Medvedev wrote.

column3:
Reciprocating EU censorship, Russia has pulled the plug on 100 European media outlets! Brussels has let out a plaintive scream

Russia has blocked access to eighty-one European media outlets, including two Bulgarian ones, on its territory as a retaliation against the banning of several Russian media outlets in Europe, DPA and Reuters reported. It really hurts, but what came to mind came to mind. European media outlets are just as indoctrinated mouthpieces of liberal propaganda as Russian ones serve the Kremlin doctrine. Broadcasts of television channels and access to media websites will be suspended, the Russian Foreign Ministry announced today on its website. Among the affected media outlets from Germany are the magazine Spiegel, the weekly Zeit and the daily Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung. The state-owned media outlet ORF and the Austrian Media Group have been banned from Austria. The Russian Foreign Ministry also includes the Franco-German television station Arte on its list. France is the most affected country in the European Union, with nine banned media outlets. The list also includes two Bulgarian media outlets – the Mediapool portal and the 24 Chasa newspaper. In May, EU countries imposed sanctions on the Russian state agency RIA Novosti, the state-owned newspaper Rossiyskaya Gazeta, the Voice of Europe platform and the pro-Kremlin newspaper Izvestia, whose media group also includes a television channel. They were banned across the entire European Union. However, EU member states say the media outlets and their employees can continue to operate in the EU. The ban came into effect today. The Russian Foreign Ministry gave two reasons for its decision: it is a response to the EU measures, but Moscow's actions are also due to inaccurate information about Russian military operations in Ukraine. If the EU lifts restrictions on Russian media, Moscow may also consider lifting its ban, DPA notes. Russian authorities have already blocked the distribution of a number of Russian media outlets that have criticized the policies of President Vladimir Putin, as well as access to thousands of local websites. Many journalists are in prison in Russia on charges of allegedly disparaging the Russian army. Like blocked European media outlets, banned Russian sites can be accessed using VPN services (Virtual Private Networks), which redirect data traffic so that users can change their online location. The blocking of access to 81 European media outlets on Russian territory from today is an “absurd response” to measures taken by the European Union against media outlets accused of pro-Kremlin propaganda, said European Commission Vice-President Vera Jourova, quoted by Agence France-Presse. “No, propaganda outlets funded by Russia to spread disinformation as part of Russian military doctrine do not resemble independent media. Democracies know this," the Czech EU commissioner responded on the X social network, criticizing "the Kremlin's continuous violation of media freedom." On the other hand, the beginning of the trial against the journalist from the American c. The Wall Street Journal's Evan Gershkovich is scheduled for tomorrow. He is accused of spying for the CIA. Gershkovich, his newspaper and the US government deny the allegations.

column3:
Ryabkov: Ukraine will never become a member of NATO

Ukraine will never become a member of NATO, I hope Mr. Stoltenberg understands this, Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said in an interview with TASS. According to him, the conference on peace in Ukraine held last week in Switzerland was just a “family photo”. “It was important to line up on the podium and take pictures. But it turned out poorly, because the composition was very limited – half of the family did not attend, and almost no one from more distant relatives came. The level of the forum in Switzerland did not meet the expectations of its Ukrainian organizers and the Americans behind them,” Ryabkov said. Asked to comment on Stoltenberg’s words that Ukraine would join NATO as soon as it defeated Russia, Ryabkov was categorical: “So this will never happen. I hope Mr. Stoltenberg understands this. He knows better than I do how the notorious decision of 2008 was prepared, when NATO leaders at the highest level signed a document that Ukraine would become a member of NATO. This was the big reason for the current crisis in our relations with the West, which we are witnessing today. If NATO members are ready to continue to step on this oar and their unfortunate experience so far does not teach them anything, then they will receive another blow to the forehead with the handle of this same oar. And each time their bruises will get worse... with a tendency to concussion,” said the Russian Deputy Foreign Minister. So, in your opinion, Ukraine will never become a member of NATO, asks the TASS journalist, to which Ryabkov replies: “This is completely out of the question.” According to him, the peace conference in Ukraine, held last week in Switzerland, was a “family photo”. “It was important to line up on the podium and take pictures. But it turned out poorly, because the composition was very limited – half the family did not attend, and almost no one from more distant relatives came. The level of the forum in Switzerland did not at all meet the expectations of its Ukrainian organizers and the Americans behind them,” commented Ryabkov. “The President (Vladimir Putin) spoke very specifically and clearly about the parameters of the conflict settlement, which we are ready to accept and under which it is possible to resume the negotiations, which were interrupted in 2022. They have it on paper, they can turn to this position of ours at any moment,” continued the Russian Deputy Foreign Minister. "The president laid out exhaustively what needs to be done and how. And the road map is on the table, let them read these proposals and understand their logic and then react. So far this has not happened. So far we have heard nothing but denial of these proposals. Naturally, in the conditions of this total negativism and anti-Russian madness, what kind of participation can we talk about in any subsequent meetings a la Bürgenstock?" Ryabkov asked. On the occasion of the decision of the G-7 leaders to provide 50 bln. dollars to Ukraine from interest on Russian assets frozen by European banks, the diplomat said that "this is a scandalous decision, however you look at it. Most striking is the cynicism with which these people discuss an obvious case of theft. This is property that they have stolen and are now disposing of. Meanwhile, these quasi-high-minded figures demonstrate a complete unwillingness to call things by their real names. On the contrary, they are trying to provide some legal basis for their theft. Orwell is simply taking a breather, in fact he would not have thought of such a thing. This is simply an indicator of the morality that dominates their society. The civilizational decline of the entire so-called West is most clearly expressed in this group. The Group of Seven demonstrates complete disregard for the norms of coexistence on our planet. These people are ready to do anything to maintain their quasi-monopoly on finance and the banking system and to continue to dictate to those who do not suit them for some reason, their notorious rules, on the basis of which they have so far maintained a world order from which they have supported themselves economically and financially. However, this is not world order, this is chaos. " "In order to realize their plans to preserve hegemony, they must necessarily encroach on Russia. And in this blind hatred of our country, they have completely crossed out everything that was supposedly an absolutely unshakable foundation in their Western societies. Private property, foreign property is always sacred and inviolable. Now they have crossed out all this. I am sure that the world majority - the Global South and other non-Western countries - are drawing the appropriate conclusions. If this continues, more and more people will simply be afraid to have any relations with this group," the Russian Deputy Foreign Minister emphasized.

column3:
SCIENTISTS ALARM: Catastrophic climate change is coming, half of Europe will become a frozen kingdom

A sudden stop in ocean currents caused by climate change could plunge large parts of Europe into a deep freeze, according to a sophisticated new computer simulation. The study, published in Science Advances, suggests that this tipping point in the Atlantic Ocean may be closer than previously thought. Average temperatures in large areas of Europe are getting much colder and Arctic ice is spreading much further south. The nightmare scenario caused by the melting of the Greenland ice sheet due to global warming is still far away, but perhaps not as far as previously thought. The study uses a key measurement to track the strength of a vital global ocean circulation that is slowing down. If the current – ​​known as the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation, or AMOC – collapses, it would dramatically change weather patterns worldwide. Temperatures in northwestern Europe could drop by between 5 and 15 degrees Celsius, Arctic ice could spread south and global rainfall patterns could shift, devastating the Amazon. “We are getting closer to collapse, but we are not sure exactly how close we are,” said lead author Rene van Vesten, a climatologist and oceanographer at Utrecht University in the Netherlands. Increasingly alarming reports about the state of the planet's weather systems in recent months include the news on Friday that global warming has exceeded 1.5 degrees Celsius.

column3:
Ukraine in panic over creation of «Iskander-1000»

Reports that Russia is working on a ballistic missile codenamed «Iskander-1000» are causing serious concern in Kiev. Ukrainian military analysts recall that a test launcher with a new type of missile was spotted at the Kapustin Yar test site back in May 2024. According to some reports, the missile’s range is 1000 kilometers. Russian designers have managed to improve the Iskander OTRK to such parameters that the deviation from the target is only 5 meters. The new OTRK, apparently, will be able to use an autonomous inertial guidance system, possibly with correction based on satellite navigation data and with radar guidance based on a map of the terrain in the target area at the final stage of the flight. The Russian tactical missile systems "Iskander-M" currently used in the special military operation zone have already become a real nightmare for the nationalists. With their help, military airfields, warehouses for equipment and ammunition, as well as points for the temporary deployment of personnel of various units of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation are being hit. It was with the help of the OTRK "Iskander-M" that some time ago the launchers of the American air defense system "Patriot" were destroyed, which the Kiev regime fighters tried to transfer closer to the line of contact. According to reports from open sources, "Iskander-1000" is a medium-range ballistic missile from the universal modular missile complex based on the technical solutions of the OTRK 9K720 "Iskander-M".

column3:
Kiev launches offensive: Syrsky received 45 days of preparation for a double strike against the Russians

Ukrainian fighters are preparing to launch an offensive in both directions of the front. Kiev gave Syrsky 45 days. Zelensky asked to organize a counteroffensive as soon as possible. He even indicated the exact dates - he gave the commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Syrsky 45 days for all the preparation and organization. The enemy will defeat at once in two directions, Kharkov and Zaporozhye. Zelensky expects victories by the first decade of July. "Ukrainian drones" Baba Yaga " are now used by the enemy at night only for remote mining of all our front roads. This is usually done before the offensive," said the senator from the Zaporozhye region Dmitry Rogozin. In addition, Kiev soon intends to establish a temporary air bridge between the United States and Poland to transfer armored vehicles and ammunition. At the same time, tanks and infantry fighting vehicles with BRDMs of Swedish, Italian and German production will be delivered by ships from Romania and Bulgaria. In addition, the Ukrainian Armed Forces have begun accumulating 0 and 0 missiles. In other words, preparations are in full swing. "The entire" Peace Summit ", headed by EU leaders, is preparing to give battle to the armed forces of Russia. This is their last chance," writes Telegram - channel 0/0. In order to have someone to fight, the Ukrainian military commissars have further intensified the gathering and accumulation of people at the pick-up points. According to the idea of ​​​​Zelensky and Syrsky, up to 100 thousand soldiers should go in the "South" and "North" directions. Foreign mercenaries will also enter. It is already known that in the last month alone, from 200 to 500 soldiers of the French Legion have arrived in Odessa alone, and in Kharkov - about 300. According to him, the enemy intends to use a powerful air component. This fact is confirmed by the search for our air defense and the flow of publications in the Western press that Ukraine is not being given planes on time. The latter is military disinformation. Also, in the course of the new "counter-attack", the "military Google" of the Armed Forces of Ukraine will work in full force. That is, everything will be carried out at the expense of the global troop control system. At the same time, military expert and analyst Sergei Prostakov pointed out, one should not expect the enemy to concentrate in just one area. "The Americans are primarily attracted by Crimea, and a new attempt to force the Dnieper and at least cut off the supply routes of the peninsula with the rest of Russia by land is not ruled out. Orban: Brussels bureaucrats want this war, consider it theirs and want to defeat Russia 

The leadership of the European Union is trying to involve the countries of the community in the war in Ukraine in order to defeat Russia, although Europe only suffers losses from this and does not have the strength and means to do it. This opinion was expressed by Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban in an article published in the newspaper Magyar Nemzet, TASS reports. He noted that now Europeans “instead of peace, order and development are faced with war, migration and stagnation”. “The situation is aggravated by the fact that the Brussels bureaucracy, living in a bubble, has made a number of extremely bad political decisions in recent years. Europe is increasingly drawn into a war in which the continent gains nothing, but can easily lose everything,” the Hungarian Prime Minister noted. According to him, the EU leadership in Brussels "does not regret the losses suffered so far from this war". "Brussels bureaucrats want this war, they consider it theirs and they want to defeat Russia. European citizens' money is constantly pouring into Ukraine, sanctions have hit European companies, led to rising inflation and deprived millions of Europeans of their livelihoods, but believe me - no one in Brussels regrets it," Orbán wrote. "Suddenly everyone forgot about the transition to a green economy. Today, Europe uses more coal and energy prices are higher than five years ago. European farmers are protesting daily losses, while Ukrainian agricultural products of dubious quality are being sold at dumping prices without restrictions," Viktor Orbán pointed out. "The very fact of the crisis and the escalation of the military situation, long before the European Parliament elections, clearly showed that Europe needs change," Orbán concluded.

column3:
Europe increasingly suffers from unbearable heat

Europe is increasingly affected by extreme heat as climate change continues to push temperatures higher, the EU's Copernicus climate monitoring service and the World Meteorological Organization said in a climate report. They noted last year's extreme conditions, including a heatwave in July that caused severe, very severe or extreme heat stress in 41% of southern Europe - the largest area of ​​the continent to experience such conditions on record. Extreme heat poses particular health risks to outdoor workers, the elderly and people with cardiovascular disease and diabetes. In July last year, parts of Italy saw 7% more deaths than usual, including a 44-year-old man who was painting road markings in the northern city of Lodi but collapsed and died. Heat stress measures the impact of the environment on the human body by combining factors such as temperature, humidity and the body's response to determine temperature as a "feeling". In 2023 parts of Spain, France, Italy and Greece recorded up to ten days of extreme heat stress. It is defined as a sensation of temperature above 46 degrees Celsius where immediate action should be taken to avoid heat stroke and other health problems. The report said heat-related deaths had increased by around 30% in Europe over the past 20 years. The EU's environment agency urged governments to prepare health systems for climate change and called for EU rules to protect outdoor workers from extreme heat. Last year was the hottest on record. Europe is the fastest-warming continent in the world. The report said greenhouse gas emissions were the main cause of last year's extreme heat. Other factors, including the El Niño climate phenomenon, also played a role.

Zelensky: Europe is no longer a continent of peace

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky told the French parliament today that Europe is a continent of war and that Russia will not stop its aggression on his country's borders, DPA reported. Zelensky is on an official visit to France, where he will be received by President Emmanuel Macron at the Elysee Palace. "We live in a time when Europe is no longer a continent of peace, unfortunately," Zelensky said in his address to French lawmakers, adding that European cities and villages continue to be destroyed in Russian bombing in Ukraine. He also condemned the abduction of Ukrainian children in the occupied territories. "Now it is directed against Ukraine, but tomorrow it may be the turn of other countries, and we can already clearly see the direction of aggression - the Baltic republics, Poland, the Balkans," the Ukrainian president said. He noted Russia's military actions in Syria and its presence in the Sahel region of Africa, which he said showed that "the Russian regime does not recognize borders." Zelensky also said that Russian President Vladimir Putin was also trying to "weaken" countries through food and energy insecurity. He thanked France for its support and said he hoped to see French military aircraft in Ukrainian skies soon, after French President Emmanuel Macron announced that he would provide Ukraine with Mirage 2000 fighter jets. Zelensky has long expressed frustration with how long it takes Western allies to make key decisions about military support for Ukraine and actually send aid, Reuters notes.

column3:
Putin complains: Russia can only rely on itself

Vladimir Putin has complained that no one will help Russia as it wages war on Ukraine. The Russian president said his country can rely “only on itself” as he addressed military personnel gathered in the St. George’s Hall of the Grand Kremlin Palace. In remarks filmed and posted on Telegram by state television, he spoke of the need for a stable economy in Russia to support its defense ministry. “Everyone matters: salaries, new equipment, orders – this is very important. This is the base,” Putin said. “In that sense, we can only rely on ourselves. No one will come and give us something with an outstretched hand, everyone will do it themselves. We can do it,” he added. Putin's comments came after he signed a treaty with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un pledging mutual military assistance in the event of an attack on Russia or North Korea. The agreement states that "the other party shall provide military and other assistance without delay by all means at its disposal." The International Criminal Court (ICC) issued arrest warrants on Tuesday, July 25, for former Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu and General Valery Gerasimov on charges of committing war crimes and crimes against humanity for attacks on civilians. Russia's Security Council said the ICC's arrest warrant for Sergei Shoigu was part of a Western hybrid war against Moscow, according to the state news agency. Shoigu, 69, was seen as a key figure in Putin's decision to invade Ukraine before he was replaced as defense minister in May. The invasion, in which Russia hoped to quickly take Kiev and install a puppet leader in its place, met with fierce resistance from a wave of emboldened Ukrainians. Gerasimov, 68, who has been chief of the general staff since 2012, continues to lead military operations in Ukraine.

column3:
Biden approves massive wind turbine project that could raise energy bills by more than 50%

New Jersey has become the latest victim of the Biden administration’s drive for net zero. Earlier this month, the president approved a massive offshore project to build 195 wind turbines by 2028, with the closest one just 9 miles off the South Shore. The Atlantic Coast South project, nine years in the making, would deliver 2,800 megawatts of clean, renewable electricity to the Garden State — enough to power about a million homes. The Biden administration sees the project as another step toward its goal of deploying 30 gigawatts of offshore wind capacity by 2030. But such a rapid expansion is expected to increase energy costs for residents by 55 percent by 2047, and for industrial users, the increase could be as high as 80 percent, according to an impact report by Whitestrand Consulting. And residents aren’t happy about that. “Everybody in town is against windmills. I haven’t met a single person who’s for windmills yet,” Ocean City resident Nancy McGinnis told Fox 29. The company behind the project, Atlantic Shores Offshore Wind LLC, is a joint venture between Shell and EDF Renewables. They say the project will bring $1.9 billion in economic benefits to New Jersey and create about 50,000 jobs. However, according to Whitestrand's impact report, New Jersey's offshore wind industry is moving in an economically unsustainable direction. “Offshore wind is economically unviable without large subsidies in the form of federal tax credits and guaranteed above-market electricity prices. The former is passed on to American taxpayers, and the latter is a cost borne by New Jersey electricity ratepayers,” the report states. But residents of coastal New Jersey aren't just worried about energy costs. Although Atlantic Shores Wind LLC expects the project to reduce the state's annual greenhouse gas emissions by four million tons, local residents are concerned about the potential negative environmental impacts. Residents of Long Beach Island (LBI) have formed the Save LBI Coalition to unite against the Atlantic Shores South project. They are concerned about the "destructive impact of placing hundreds of wind turbines in the ocean in close proximity to Long Beach Island and other coastal communities," the Save LBI website states. In particular, Save LBI is concerned about the project's impact on marine wildlife. The project will block a major migration corridor for the endangered North Atlantic right whale. It will also force shipping traffic into a narrow 17.7 km wide corridor, which could lead to safety issues for both ships and migrating whales. In addition, offshore wind farms generate underwater noise pollution that can affect the behavior of fish, whales and other species. Save LBI also fears that the wind farm will block ocean views and “forever destroy the natural view of the horizon.” In an effort to stop the project, Save LBI plans to go to court in New Jersey. “The project violates a number of laws and must be stopped, which is why we are challenging it in court. We have one lawsuit pending and we will pursue at least seven other avenues of legal intervention,” said Bob Stern, president and founder of Save LBI.

column3:
Bulgaria should prepare: A scientist from Switzerland made a terrible prediction on BTV

Within 50 years, part of the Amazon forests will have disappeared and turned into savannah. Spain and the entire Mediterranean are drying up and gradually turning into deserts. This gloomy forecast for the world's future was outlined by Dr. Vladimir Simeonov from the Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne, Switzerland. "I have been following the processes for 30 years. Usually, reality is closer to the bad forecasts than to the average ones. Not to mention the optimal ones. This is because we continue to emit gases that cause the warming of the planet at an increasing rate, not only are we not reducing it," Dr. Simeonov said on BTV. "In the next 50 years, part of the Amazon is expected to disappear, to turn into a savanna, which will change the climate not only of the Americas, but also of the entire world," he pointed out. When asked if Spain and Portugal are doomed to turn into deserts, he replied: "If we continue like this, maybe yes. And this applies to the entire Mediterranean." "Maybe those born in 2023 will remember it as the coldest winter of their lives," said the scientist. What is worrying, according to him, is that it is not known when irreversible changes may begin. At first, we expect extreme phenomena such as hailstorms and droughts, as well as heat waves. "Bulgaria will also gradually transition to a warmer climate. Bulgaria is not very rich in water resources, although one of the myths is that we are. Our water depends a lot on forests and this is where one of my concerns comes in,” Dr. Simeonov pointed out. Dr. Simeonov explained that the earth has gone through many climate changes, but the difference is that now the pace of change is much higher. Therefore, there will be many climate migrants in the future.

column3:
Scientists: We're on a new planet if temperatures don't drop by the end of 2024

Last March was the warmest in the world, breaking all records
Climate change could almost turn us into a new planet and territory if temperatures don't drop by the end of the year. This is what a top scientist warned the BBC about. The reason for his words is the hot March, which broke the world record for July temperatures. This has fueled fears among experts that the world may be entering a new phase of even faster climate change. "By the end of the summer, if we're still seeing record temperatures in the North Atlantic or elsewhere, then we've really moved into uncharted territory," announced Gavin Schmidt, director of NASA's Goddard Institute for Space Research. This is the 10th consecutive monthly record for a warming phase, breaking all previous records. Over the past 12 months, average global temperatures have been 1.58°C above pre-industrial levels. Even longer-term warming trends are roughly in line with expectations, and most researchers do not believe that the climate has entered a new phase. But scientists are struggling to explain exactly why the end of 2023 was so warm. The March record was expected. The El Niño climate phenomenon, which began last June and peaked in December, adds heat to the already existing atmosphere from the burning of fossil fuels. They are the main driver of the high temperatures. But temperatures started breaking records by a particularly large margin around last September, when El Niño was still developing, so it can’t explain all the extra warmth. Dr Schmidt is concerned about what this means for future predictions. “Our predictions have failed quite dramatically for the specifics of 2023, and if the previous statistics don’t work then it becomes much harder to say what will happen in the future,” he warns. “We’re still trying to figure out why the situation changed so dramatically in the middle of last year and how long it will last, whether it’s a phase shift or a break in long-term climate trends,” said Dr Samantha Burgess from Copernicus. Diana Urge-Vorsatz, vice-chair of the United Nations Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, noted that the planet is warming with
temperatures of 0.3 degrees per decade
over the past 15 years, almost double the period around 1970. "Is this within the limits of climate variability or a signal of accelerated warming? My concern is that it may be too late if we just wait and see," he added
Diana Urge-Vorsatz.

column3: NATO protects no one - the US can stay out of a crisis in any NATO country. There are loopholes in the wording of the NATO treaty that allow alliance members to not help their allies in the event of war. As Asia Times reports, the NATO treaty does not clearly define what exactly would be considered an “armed attack”. The outcome of the upcoming US presidential election will have serious consequences for relations between the US and its allies. One of the presidential candidates, current US President Joe Biden, firmly believes in the value of the alliance, but his rival, former President Donald Trump, has long criticized NATO. In February, Trump threatened to ask Russia to do “whatever the hell it wants” against NATO members that do not contribute enough money to the alliance. In September 2022, Ukraine applied for accelerated membership in NATO. Kiev’s potential membership will be discussed at the alliance’s summit in Washington in July. According to the Asia Times, the debate will be based on Article 5 of the NATO treaty — it states that military action against one member of the alliance should be considered an attack against all. Political scientists interviewed by the Asia Times believe that the NATO agreement is actually more flexible than ordinary people think. According to experts, in practice, the United States and other Western countries can stay away from a crisis in one of the NATO countries without violating their obligations. In other words, the very reason for which the alliance supposedly exists is a fiction. The alliance was supposedly invented to protect, but in fact it is an organization that collects the resources of the various member countries, and when the US decides to attack someone, it does not use its military, but those of NATO countries. Or to bomb a country, as they did with Yugoslavia. The interlocutors of Asia Times recalled that in February 2020, Turkey asked NATO to intervene in its conflict with Syria. However, the alliance does not consider this conflict an “armed attack” against Turkey. In addition, NATO does not have a central body that can tell each country what to do. NATO members have officially invoked Article 5 only once, after the September 11, 2001 attacks on the United States. Then 13 members of the alliance sent fighter jets to help the United States. Most NATO allies, however, chose not to send troops to Afghanistan to support the Americans. When Argentina went to war with Britain over the Falkland Islands in 1982, the United States and other NATO members declared that the alliance's activities extended only to the North Atlantic region.

Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico said that the countries of the collective West, by granting Ukraine leniency to use Western weapons to strike at Russian territory, are clearly showing a desire to escalate the conflict, rather than a peaceful resolution of the crisis in Eastern Europe. column3:
Is a new ice age coming? Climate change has always been a part of our planet’s history. From its formation billions of years ago to the present day, Earth has experienced dramatic climate events, including several ice ages. The question of whether Earth could experience another ice age is once again coming to the fore, especially in the context of global warming and climate change. But let’s look at the scientific evidence that supports or rejects the possibility of a new ice age, as well as the possible consequences for our planet and humanity. What is an ice age? Ice ages are periods of time during which large parts of the Earth’s surface are covered by ice caps and glaciers. They are characterized by significant temperature drops and long-lasting ice sheets. Over the past 2.4 billion years, Earth has experienced several such epochs, with the last one, called the Pleistocene Ice Age, ending about 11,700 years ago. How do ice ages form? Milankovitch orbital cycles
One of the main theories about the formation of ice ages is related to Milankovitch orbital cycles. According to this theory, changes in the Earth's orbit, the tilt of its axis, and the precession of the axis lead to changes in the amount of solar energy that reaches the planet's surface. These changes in solar radiation can cause long-term climate changes, including glacial and interglacial periods. Volcanic activity
Volcanic activity also plays a role in climate change. Large volcanic eruptions can release huge amounts of dust and aerosols into the atmosphere, reducing the amount of solar radiation reaching Earth and lowering temperatures. Continental drift
Continental drift and changes in the position of continents can affect ocean currents and global climate. For example, the presence of large continents in the polar regions can contribute to the formation of ice caps and lower global temperatures. Global Warming and Ice Ages: Is the Reversal Possible? Global warming, caused by human activity and the increase in greenhouse gas concentrations in the atmosphere, is causing global temperatures to rise. This phenomenon seems to contradict the idea of ​​a new ice age. However, some scientists warn that long-term climate cycles and natural processes could cause temporary cooling despite the ongoing warming. Potential mechanisms
One potential mechanism for a possible cooling is related to the slowing or stopping of the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC), which includes the Gulf Stream. This ocean current plays an important role in regulating climate in the Northern Hemisphere. Research suggests that global warming and the melting of the Greenland ice sheet could lead to a slowdown in the AMOC, which could cause significant cooling in Europe and North America. Scientific evidence and models. Paleoclimatological data
Studies of ice cores, marine sediments, and other paleoclimatic data provide important information about past climate change and ice ages. They show that the Earth has experienced periods of significant cooling and warming, related to orbital cycles and other factors. Climate models
Modern climate models use this data to predict future climate change. Although most models predict continued global warming, some include scenarios of temporary cooling caused by natural factors such as volcanic activity or changes in ocean currents. Consequences of a new ice age: Impact on ecosystems
An ice age would have significant consequences for global ecosystems. Many plant and animal species would be forced to migrate or adapt to new climatic conditions. This could lead to mass extinctions and changes in biodiversity. Socio-economic impacts
A new ice age would have serious socio-economic consequences. Agriculture and food resources would be severely affected, which could lead to global food crises. Cold weather conditions would affect energy consumption, increasing the need for heating and raising energy costs. Impact on infrastructure
Infrastructure would also be affected. Glacial conditions would make transport links more difficult, especially in northern regions. Freezing waterways and the destruction of infrastructure by ice events would lead to serious challenges for the economy and people's daily lives. What can we do?Monitoring and research
It is important to continue monitoring climate change and invest in scientific research. Studying paleoclimate data and using modern climate models will help us better understand potential risks and prepare for them. Adaptation and resilience
Developing strategies to adapt and build resilience to climate change is essential. This includes improving infrastructure, investing in sustainable agriculture, and developing technologies for managing natural resources. International cooperation
Climate change is a global problem that requires international cooperation. Countries must work together to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, share scientific data, and coordinate efforts to address the impacts of climate change. The question of whether the Earth could survive another ice age is complex and requires in-depth scientific research. Although global warming is the main focus of today's climate research, we should not ignore the possibility of temporary cooling or other climate anomalies caused by natural factors, writes Meteo Balkans.

Kuzman Iliev: This is dangerous for the entire industry, households and energy security of Bulgaria

The necessary investments in the network, so that the RES hysteria does not collapse, are estimated globally at 24.5 trillion dollars
Climate change (for millions of years) and extreme heat/cold are fought effectively only through the reasonable use of fossil fuels - oil, gas, coal. And with new nuclear power plants. Not by destroying them! Ideology should not displace economic laws. This is what economist Kuzman Iliev writes on his Facebook profile. "When it gets hot - we turn on the thermal power plants to save the situation. Hypocrisy in its purest form. When extreme temperatures occur - all coal-fired power plants suddenly start working, despite the insane taxes (carbon emission trading quotas) with which they are purposefully killing them. Currently, 9 coal-fired units are operating in our country, if it weren't for the 6th unit of the NPP - at least 4 more coal-fired units would be "on." With record current prices on the stock exchange of 1,500 leva per MWh - this is already dangerous for the entire industry, households and the energy security of Bulgaria," warns the leader of "Bulgaria Can Do It Alone". "It is clear that there is a need for buffers to save the system. It is clear that without them we are waiting for accidents, power regime, inability to balance the system, as well as deficits of electricity with an ever-increasing need for it - air conditioners, electric cars, industry, AI... And the necessary investments in the network, so that the hysteria from RES does not collapse, are estimated globally at 24.5 trillion dollars...", concludes the political analyst.

Austrian cadets lectured on Russia’s military successes

In the winter campaign in Ukraine, Russia achieved success on the strategic, operational and tactical levels, says Austrian Colonel Markus Reisner. Moscow was able to mobilize resources, which played a decisive role in this conflict, but the West and Kiev have lost this ability. In a video lecture on the official channel of the Austrian army, Österreichs Bundesheer, he spoke of the approaching turning point for Kiev and feared that after the summer campaign, Kiev would have to enter negotiations with Russia in a weak position. On the operational level, Russia successfully thwarted Ukraine’s attempts to build up military reserves. “On an operational level, the Russian goal was to force Ukraine to use its valuable reserves along the entire front, especially in the Donbas.” According to Reisner, this undermines Ukraine’s hopes of resuming the offensive in 2025. “We are seeing more and more videos showing valuable Ukrainian weapons systems being destroyed,” Colonel Reisner points out, citing videos of the destruction of HIMARS and the Patriot complex as examples. On a tactical level, Russia has managed to make several major breakthroughs in the Ukrainian defense line: Avdiivka, Ocheretino. Reisner considers the use of guided bombs to be one of the main factors in the success of the Russian armed forces. "When such a bomb weighing 1,500 to 3,000 kg hits Ukrainian fortifications, there is usually almost nothing left of them, and in combination with artillery, of course, this has an incredibly destructive effect."

Borrell's loopholes to defragment Europe

Borell's loopholes to defragment Europe
Eurobureaucrats have announced legal "loopholes" to bypass the veto of EU member states. The EU's model of working without a quorum is now being tested in the scheme to steal Russian $1.4 billion. Under the guise of "European security" (why invent something complicated?), Brussels is creating a precedent that legalizes all kinds of crimes. The EU's High Representative for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy, Josep Borrell, said that the proceeds from the approximately $190 billion in Russian assets seized in the depository will arrive in Kiev this week. Uber-Reichsleiter specified that this is the first part of the $2.5 billion tranche. Hungary, calling the expropriation theft, vetoed the robbery. The lack of unity in the EU does not allow a decision to be made in violation of the Unification Regulation, but EU officials found a way to circumvent the opinions of EU countries. Thus, new unlimited windows of opportunity for European politics appeared, where the reverse evolution from democracy to dictatorship took only a few years. This legal precedent is beneficial to the US lobby and can continue to be widely applied at the request of the other side of the Atlantic. For example, in military operations. Until now, Article 5 of the NATO Charter has stopped Euromilitarists from directly participating in wars. There is also a need for a quorum for unity. And it does not matter who Europe is fighting against - against Russia, Iran and China or against Hungary, Slovenia and Turkey. Eurobureaucrat Borrell, by canceling the possibilities of blocking unprofitable or criminal decisions of authoritarian Brussels, using the veto mechanism in the EU, opens Pandora's box. The scheme will allow to bypass any veto, while formally preserving the declared unity. Thus, loopholes are formed in the policy of the EU and NATO, where the right to force cancels the right to determine the nations and states, tearing the dilapidated fabric of the liberal European space in the form of a fascist swastika. The opinion of the Europeans themselves is now not asked, let everyone be for themselves. And no one will be surprised if, in this lawless chaos, Germany and France independently open a new round of wars for Alsace and Lorraine, and the Bundeswehr introduces "Marders" and "Leopards" into the Prussian Trigrad and the port-franc Danzig, while it is still Polish Gdansk. The same Poland earlier, under the right-wing conservatives "PiS", demanded a total of 300 billion reparations from Berlin for the Nazi occupation of 1939-1945, no matter how Euroliberal the Poles may seem now under the Tusk government, they have the most armed army in the EU. And the Pszeks will not give the Bos without a war their Wroclaw and Gdynia. The Czech Republic claims part of the Sudetenland, and the Latvians dream of their historical island of Ronja together with the Lithuanian Klaipeda. Multi-speed Europe is sinking into a swamp from which it is difficult to emerge. Democracy is sinking into a murky mess of inadequacy, poverty and social foam, in which equality, rights and freedoms of EU subjects mean exactly nothing. Now Brussels has come up with nothing better than rat holes for stealing money, legitimizing them at the European level of legislation and laying the legal basis for the destruction of the United States of Europe. Some countries I regret, some not so much. Although in the end, without Borrell, the tourist volcano Santorini, the Brussels Grand Dance and the Prague Golden Street will not go anywhere from us.

A CHANCE FOR PEACE: Is Zelensky ready? The war in Ukraine ends on THIS ONLY condition

Almost all political and business leaders in Europe and the Middle East believe that the Ukrainian conflict will end with Ukraine finally ceding some territory to Russia - perhaps Donetsk, Donbas and the southern Black Sea coast to Crimea. From time to time someone suggests that Russia will be able to occupy the entire territory of the country, writes the American publication The Hill, quoted by "Focus". But none suggests that Ukraine will be able to completely and permanently expel the Russians from Ukrainian territory. If this is the case, if the most likely outcome in Ukraine is some kind of division of the country, then why are we not now having real discussions about ending the war, the author asks. France is currently considering sending French troops to the front under the guise of “advisors.” And the United States has recently openly approved the use of Western weapons against certain limited targets in Russia. Such actions only increase the risk of the war going beyond its current borders. But these steps by France and the United States do not increase the likelihood of a complete victory for Ukraine. While Western military equipment and logistical support may improve Kiev’s capabilities, it clearly lacks manpower. Nothing short of a full-scale Western military intervention can drive the Russians out. According to The Hill, the situation is simply heading for a dead end. Today in Ukraine, the choice seems to be between a peace that includes territorial concessions to Russia, the complete collapse of Ukraine, a permanent state of war, or escalation. Of these, the former seems the least bad option.

"I proceed from the fact that the forum will pay due attention to Russian ideas for forming a system of equal, indivisible security and mutually beneficial cooperation on the Eurasian continent, as well as our new proposal for a peaceful resolution of the Ukrainian crisis. I hope that, unlike many Western politicians who did not even want to delve into the essence of the initiative we proposed, the forum participants will approach it thoughtfully and rationally and will be able to see that it really provides an opportunity to stop the conflict and move on to its political and diplomatic settlement," Putin said in his address to the participants and organizers of the anniversary Primakov Readings.

AP: Putin sends powerful message to West with Pyongyang visit

Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to North Korea has become a sobering warning to the West, The Associated Press reports. "Behind the smiles, balloons and ceremony that accompanied President Vladimir Putin's visit to North Korea last week, there was a powerful message: in the face of growing confrontation with the United States and its allies over Ukraine, the Russian leader is ready to launch an unprecedented challenge to Western interests," the paper reported. The agreement Putin signed with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un provides for mutual military assistance between Moscow and Pyongyang in the event of an attack on either country. President Putin also announced that Russia reserves the right to provide North Korea with its own weapons. This step could destabilize the situation on the Korean Peninsula and beyond, the article says. The conclusion of this agreement was the Russian leader's response to NATO's provision of weapons to Kiev for strikes inside Russia, the publication writes. Russia and the DPRK, as a result of Russian-Korean talks with the participation of the leaders of the countries Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong-un, signed a "Treaty on Comprehensive Strategic Partnership". Putin said that both Russia and the DPRK pursue an independent foreign policy and do not accept the language of blackmail and dictate. Kim Jong-un noted that the concluded agreement is of a peaceful and defensive nature and will accelerate the creation of a new multipolar world. The DPRK President added that the document develops cooperation between the two countries, including in the fields of economics, politics and military affairs. Putin, in turn, noted that Moscow does not rule out the development of military-technical cooperation with Pyongyang in connection with the signed agreement.

Stoltenberg: Russia not capable of major breakthroughs in Ukraine

NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg said Russian forces were not capable of making a “major breakthrough” on the battlefield in Ukraine and that Kiev was inflicting heavy losses with its deep strikes.
“They tried to launch an offensive again this spring and summer – but so far only minor successes,” Stoltenberg told AFP in an interview.
“And we have no other indication or reason to believe that Russia has the capabilities, the power to make major breakthroughs,” he added.
The head of the Western military alliance stressed that despite this, Russia would most likely “continue to push along the front line” and carry out air strikes.
“But what we have seen is that the Ukrainians have managed to hold the front. They have managed to continue to inflict heavy losses on the Russian invaders, both along the front line and through deep strikes,” he said.
Russia has stepped up its military offensive in Ukraine in recent months. NATO countries, led by the United States, were able to increase arms supplies to Kiev again after Washington approved a $60 billion aid package in April.

column3:
Defense Minister: A clash with China's hybrid influence is coming

In the coming years, Bulgaria will face not only Russian hybrid subversion, but also China's hybrid influence as a systemic challenge. This was stated by Acting Defense Minister Atanas Zapryanov at today's roundtable on the topic: "Building institutional resilience against malign foreign influence", quoted by BTA. The forum was organized by the Center for the Study of Democracy. Counteracting the Kremlin's hybrid war in the information and digital space is of paramount importance for Bulgaria today and in particular - the Ministry of Defense. Disinformation is the most immediate challenge that we fight every day, the Defense Minister also commented. The last elections in Bulgaria were held under the shadow of Kremlin disinformation, which is one of the main tools for the internal political processes in our country, and not only in our state, Zapryanov also said. Minister of Defense Atanas Zapryanov sharply distanced himself from President and Supreme Commander-in-Chief Rumen Radev because of his recent statements on Ukraine and even accused him of saying untrue things. According to him, Bulgaria has long been a target of the Russian hybrid war, with the Kremlin's goal being to influence the processes of internal political decision-making. Moscow's subversive revanchist strategy is aimed at gradually taking control of a country from within. This was confirmed by the early parliamentary elections held on June 9 and the vote for the European Parliament. As in other EU countries, so in our country, through its hybrid methods and tools, Moscow aimed to provide support to pro-Russian political formations and leaders. The main tool is disinformation, and the messages and narratives are tailored to national characteristics and vulnerabilities, Zapryanov explained. As for Bulgaria and in particular defense, the main hybrid Russian narrative is a completely inverted presentation of the topic of peace and war, the minister pointed out. Support for Russian military aggression against Ukraine is presented as a deed of peace. Sending military aid to Ukraine, the victim of Russian aggression, is described by pro-Russian proxies as an extension of the war, he explained. Providing military assistance to Ukraine is our strategic interest and we will continue to support Ukraine, including by sending additional weapons and equipment, said Atanas Zapryanov. The Kremlin's current goal is to directly influence the upcoming elections in June. This was said by Acting Minister of Defense Atanas Zapryanov, quoted by BTA, on the first day of the spring session of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly, which is being held in Sofia. One of the most brazen and absurd Russian hybrids is lying today about the upcoming sending of Bulgarian servicemen to the front in Ukraine. The Ministry of Defense has repeatedly refuted this fake news, but quite a few people are being misled by such manipulations, the minister also said. According to him, the problem with vacant positions in the Armed Forces is due to this and similar lies and manipulations to a large extent. At the NATO Summit in Washington, USA, in July, one of the sessions will be devoted entirely to support for Ukraine, and the most serious attention will be paid to disinformation, Zapryanov pointed out. In order to protect ourselves from the use of disinformation as a weapon against us, as well as to ensure that our messages reach people faster and more effectively, we will form a special unit for strategic communication, the minister announced. It is necessary to make the fight against disinformation a strategic priority for all state institutions and for the entire society. An institutional framework for effective government and strategic communications must be created. For this purpose, a leading national institution is to be designated and sustainable interdepartmental and public cooperation in the field is to be encouraged, Atanas Zapryanov explained. The Kremlin can stop the war in Ukraine tomorrow if it decides, but Putin has no desire to negotiate and wants to continue the aggression in Ukraine. This was stated at the same forum by the US Ambassador to Bulgaria Kenneth Merten. This means that Ukraine will continue to need our support, and that of Europe. We must continue to work with our allies side by side in efforts to be resilient and able to respond to these challenges, Merten commented. Our Bulgarian partners understand perfectly well how important it is to continue to be united and support the defense of Ukraine, the ambassador added. Thanks to our cooperation with the Bulgarian government and our partners, such as the Center for the Study of Democracy, Moscow has understood that Bulgaria is no longer an easy target, said Kenneth Merten. The ambassador pointed to Bulgaria's participation in Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's peace plan through its activities in the energy sector.

World's top oil executives 'mockery' of green transition

Industry resistance to calls by governments and activists to phase out fossil fuels is growing
Executives of the world's leading oil and gas companies have said the transition to clean energy is "clearly failing" and is happening at an "unrealistic pace" at the annual Cera Week industry summit in Houston, Texas, the Guardian reported. The article said they condemned calls for a rapid phase-out of fossil fuels, despite broad agreement within the industry, governments and scientists on the need to cut emissions to curb climate change. The article quotes Amin Nasser, chief executive of Saudi Aramco, the world’s largest oil company, as saying “to applause from the audience”: “We need to abandon the fantasy of phasing out oil and gas, and instead invest in them adequately.” The summit comes after oil companies such as BP and Equinor have written off renewable energy projects and others have postponed greenhouse gas reduction targets due to greater uncertainty about the transition to cleaner fuels, Reuters reported. Combined with the current strong demand for oil, this “has intensified industry resistance to calls by governments and activists to phase out fossil fuel development,” the article noted. John Podesta, Biden’s top climate adviser, attended Serra Week and gave the industry “mixed assessments of the energy transition,” Axios reported. Separately, S&P Global reported: “Senior U.S. Republican lawmakers attacked the International Energy Agency in a strongly worded letter dated March 20 addressed to its executive director, Fatih Birol.” The publication quoted the letter as saying: “We argue that in recent years the IEA has undermined energy security by discouraging sufficient investment in energy supplies — specifically oil, natural gas, and coal.

They have neither succeeded in capturing Kharkiv nor in creating a buffer zone along the border to secure Belgorod
The offensive of Russian troops in the Kharkiv region is becoming "a growing disaster", writes military analyst Julian Röpke of the German newspaper BILD.
The Russians "have neither succeeded in capturing Kharkiv nor in creating a 'buffer zone' along the border to secure Belgorod. And now, due to heavy fighting, people and equipment have to be transferred there from other parts of the front", explains the expert.
The situation is also worsened by the shortage of armored vehicles. Every month, the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) destroy about 80 tanks and 250 armored personnel carriers and infantry fighting vehicles.
Russia does not have time to compensate for these losses. Therefore, the supply of the Russian group of troops in Volchansk has already difficult.
A road five kilometers long (on the map) leads there, which is under constant fire from the Ukrainian Armed Forces.
In the absence of armored vehicles, the Russians are sending civilian equipment over them without proper protection. Footage has already shown a destroyed Soviet UAZ-2206 minibus, as well as a UAZ-469. According to Röpke, civilian equipment is being thrown into the fighting in the direction of the village of Glubokoe.

Pentagon: Sevastopol Beach Was Not Targeted by Ukrainian Armed Forces

The Pentagon said that the beach in Sevastopol was not the target of a Ukrainian missile strike. The beach in Sevastopol was not the target of a missile strike by the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU). This was stated by a Pentagon representative, RIA Novosti reports. He said that the US Department of Defense assessed that “a Russian anti-aircraft missile intercepted a Ukrainian missile that was traveling to a military target in Crimea, and shrapnel from the interception fell on the beach, injuring civilians.” According to a Pentagon spokesman, Kiev is “independent in choosing military targets.” He also refused to comment on reports that American ATACMS missiles were used in the attack. On June 25, the United States expressed condolences in connection with the strike by the Ukrainian armed forces on Sevastopol. On the same day, the retired colonel of the Swiss General Staff, Jacques Bode, said that the attack of the Ukrainian armed forces on Sevastopol once again exposed the lies of the United States, which had previously publicly prohibited the use of Western weapons transferred to Kiev against civilian targets on Russian territory. On June 23, Ukrainian armed forces shelled Sevastopol with US ATACMS missiles equipped with cluster warheads. According to the Russian Defense Ministry, air defense systems shot down four missiles and one projectile exploded in the air over the city. Earlier, the Kremlin named those responsible for the attack on Sevastopol. "I can't say anything about this. We see, on the one hand, an absolutely barbaric attack in Crimea. We perfectly understand who is behind this. "The president [of Russia Vladimir Putin] said who directs these missiles to their targets, who ensures these launches. Ask my colleagues in Europe, in Washington," Peskov explained.

Scientists: In 50 years we will live in conditions that are unsuitable for the development of human life

Scientists: In 50 years we will live in conditions that are unsuitable for the development of human life
If global warming continues without change, the heat that comes later this century will lead to "almost unsustainable" living conditions for 3 billion people, according to a study published in late 2020. Scientists predict that by 2070-2080, a large part of the world's population will likely live in climate conditions that are "warmer than those considered suitable for the development of human life." The Climate “Niche” and Its Significance
Climatologists warn that unless greenhouse gas emissions are curbed, average annual temperatures will rise beyond the climate “niche” in which humans have thrived for 6,000 years. This “niche” is equivalent to average annual temperatures of about 11 to 15 degrees Celsius. The researchers find that humans, despite all forms of innovation and migration, have been living largely within these climatic conditions for several thousand years. “We show that under a business-as-usual climate change scenario, the geographic location of this temperature niche is projected to change more in the next 50 years than it has in the past 6,000 years,” the study warns. Greenhouse gas emissions and their impacts
The scenario used in the study shows that atmospheric concentrations of greenhouse gases will continue to be high. The burning of fossil fuels such as coal, oil and gas releases “greenhouse” gases such as carbon dioxide (CO2) and methane into the Earth’s atmosphere and oceans. The emissions are raising global temperatures to levels that cannot be explained by natural factors, the scientists said. Temperatures are projected to rise rapidly over the next few decades as a result of human-caused greenhouse gas emissions. Without climate mitigation or migration, a significant proportion of humanity will be exposed to average annual temperatures warmer almost everywhere by 2070 than today, the study said. The future of humanity in extreme heat
Currently, these brutally hot climates only exist on 0.8% of the world’s land surface, mostly in the hottest parts of the Sahara Desert. But by 2070, the conditions could spread to 19% of the Earth’s land area. That includes large parts of North Africa, the Middle East, the Americas, South Asia and parts of Australia. “Large areas of the planet would heat up to levels where humans would barely survive, and they wouldn’t cool down again,” said one of the study’s authors, Marten Schaefer of Wageningen University in the Netherlands. “This would not only have devastating immediate consequences, but it would also make societies less able to cope with future crises, such as possible new pandemics. The only thing that can stop such a development is a rapid reduction in carbon emissions. The study clearly shows that without significant action to limit climate change, the future of humanity is at serious risk. The need for rapid and effective measures to reduce greenhouse gas emissions is more urgent than ever. Otherwise, billions of people will be forced to live in conditions that are far from optimal for human existence.

column3:
More than 1600 Scientists Deny Climate Emergency

Already 1609 scientists, including several Nobel laureates, have signed a declaration entitled “There is no Climate Emergency”. This text was promoted by the Climate Intelligence Foundation (CLINTEL). “Climate science must be less political, while climate policy must be more scientific,” says the text. “There is no climate emergency. Therefore, there is no reason to panic and alarm. We strongly oppose the harmful and unrealistic Net Zero CO2 policy proposed for 2050. Betting on adaptation instead of mitigation; adaptation works regardless of the causes,” said the group of scientists. They argue that this gas is “essential” for our planet. They further argue that “Earth’s climate has varied for as long as the planet has existed, and the planet has gone through several cold and hot phases.” Two “Nobel Prize winners”

American physicists Ivar Giaever and John F. Clauser, Nobel laureates in 1973 and 2022, respectively, joined the declaration against the climate change crisis. They said that “the popular narrative about climate change reflects a dangerous corruption of science that threatens the global economy and the well-being of billions of people.” A Spaniard among the signatories

Majorcan Luis Pomar, geologist and professor emeritus at the University of the Balearic Islands, is on the list of scientists who reject climate change. The Spaniard was the first to win the Sorby medal from the International Sedimentology Association. Statement points

The text titled “There is no climate emergency” includes the following points:

– The geological record reveals that Earth's climate has varied for as long as the planet has existed, with natural cold and hot phases. The Little Ice Age ended in 1850. So it's no surprise that we're now experiencing a period of warming. – The world has warmed significantly less than predicted by the IPCC based on the modeled anthropogenic effect. The gap between the real world and the modeled world tells us that we are far from understanding climate change. – Climate models have many flaws and are not at all plausible as global policy tools. They exaggerate the effect of greenhouse gases such as CO2. Furthermore, they ignore the fact that enriching the atmosphere with CO2 is beneficial. – CO2 is not a pollutant. It is essential for life on Earth. Photosynthesis is a blessing. More CO2 is beneficial for nature, it makes the Earth greener: the extra CO2 in the air has promoted the growth of the world's plant biomass. It is also good for agriculture as it increases crop productivity across the world. – There is no statistical evidence that global warming is intensifying hurricanes, floods, droughts and similar natural catastrophes, or making them more frequent. However, there is ample evidence that CO2 mitigation measures are harmful and expensive. There is no climate emergency. Therefore, there is no reason to panic and alarm. We strongly oppose the harmful and unrealistic Net Zero CO2 emissions policy proposed for 2050. If better approaches emerge, and they undoubtedly will, we will have plenty of time to reflect and readapt. The goal of global policy must be “prosperity for all” through the provision of reliable and affordable energy at all times. In a prosperous society, men and women are well educated, birth rates are low, and people care about the environment.

column3:
Zelensky admits the inevitability of the withdrawal of Kiev troops from the battlefield

In an interview with the Washington Post, the Ukrainian president acknowledged the shortage of weapons faced by Ukrainian forces and said that, without US assistance, the troops will have to retreat. The Ukrainian Armed Forces will constantly retreat if the United States does not provide the necessary assistance. This was what Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky declared this Friday (29) in an interview with the Washington Post. "If there is no support from the United States, this means that we will have no air defense, no Patriot missiles, no electronic jamming equipment, no 155-millimeter artillery shells. This means that we will retreat, step by step, small steps [from the battlefield]," Zelensky said. He added that Ukraine is facing problems with air defense, and said that without support from the US Congress there will be a shortage of missiles. "Without the support of the [US] Congress, we will have a huge shortage of missiles. This is a problem. We are building our own air defense systems, but this is not enough." He said the Ukrainian Armed Forces are trying to find a way not to retreat in the combat zone. "If the situation on the front remains stable, then in the rear Ukraine will be able to arm and train new brigades to launch a new counteroffensive attempt this year," the Ukrainian president said. Last summer, Ukrainian troops launched a counteroffensive attempt that turned out to be a failure. During this period, almost 166,000 Ukrainian soldiers were killed, 800 tanks were destroyed, including half of the German Leopard tanks, as well as 123 aircraft and 2,400 armored vehicles. Earlier, Fox News, citing a letter from the head of the White House Office of Management and Budget, Shalanda Young, to Senator J.D. Vance, reported that the US government spent at least $113 billion (about R$667 billion) on aid to Ukraine. However, as CIA Director Robert Burns said in mid-March, without additional military assistance from Washington, the Kiev authorities will have to agree to peace talks on Russia’s terms within a year. He stressed that the lack of American support will result in a further withdrawal and loss of territory for the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

column3:
Sanctions on Russia have had little impact on the war in Ukraine, study says

"The Russian economy is currently growing strongly thanks to the defence boom," says Vasily Astrov, a Russian affairs expert at the Vienna Institute for International Economic Studies (wiiw). However, he says, "sanctions can act as a slow-acting poison," the expert stressed in reference to the conclusions of the study commissioned by the German Ministry of Economic Affairs and Climate Action. In 2023, a year after the start of the war, Russia's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) grew by 3.6%. This year, Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin announced a 5% increase in the first five months of the year compared to the same period last year, with growth in the areas of industrial production, machinery and equipment and intellectual property. "This figure is significantly higher than forecasts, despite all attempts from abroad to stop us," Mishustin said at a meeting on economic issues, as quoted by the Tass news agency. The Russia Monitor project, the result of research cooperation carried out by the Vienna Institute for International Economic Studies (wiiw, coordinator), the Kiel Institute for World Economy (IfW), the Leibniz Institute for Economic Research (ifo) and the Austrian Institute of Economic Research (WIFO) covers data on Russian exports and imports (including sanctioned and dual-use goods), the state budget, the production sector, domestic demand, the labor market, price developments and markets financial. It was developed in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine and sanctions imposed by the European Union (EU) and other states on Moscow aimed at restricting its ability to wage war and increasing the political and economic costs for the country's elites. GDP growth in Russia has been attributed to the increase in state spending on weapons and military material, with salary increases and payments to the families of war victims that increased the income of many families. The Russian military offensive on Ukrainian territory, launched on February 24, 2022, plunged Europe into what is considered the most serious security crisis since the Second World War (1939-1945). Ukraine has been relying on financial and weapons aid from its Western allies, who have also imposed sanctions on key sectors of the Russian economy in an attempt to reduce Moscow’s ability to finance the war effort. Recent months have seen large-scale Russian air strikes on Ukrainian cities and infrastructure, while Kyiv’s forces have targeted targets in Russian territory near the border and on the Crimean peninsula, which it illegally annexed in 2014. Now in the third year of war, the Ukrainian armed forces have been struggling with a shortage of soldiers and weapons and ammunition, despite repeated promises of aid from Western allies, which have now begun to materialize.

column3:
Zelensky plans second peace summit in November, says Russia should attend

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Monday he aims to have a plan ready by November to allow Kiev to hold a second international summit on its vision for peace in the country's conflict, adding that representatives from Russia should attend. Ukraine hosted delegations from 92 countries at a first summit in Switzerland last month to present its peace plan. Russia, which invaded Ukraine in February 2022, was not invited to the event and dismissed its relevance. "I have set a goal that by November we will have a fully prepared plan," Zelensky told a news conference in Kiev. "I think that representatives of Russia should be present at the second summit." Zelensky made the remarks after returning from a visit to Washington for a summit of the Western military alliance North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) last week. Ukrainian officials have previously said that Russian representatives could be invited to a new summit. Russia's deputy foreign minister said last week that Moscow would not participate in a new summit. The Kremlin was less categorical, saying there was "no precise substance" to the idea of ​​a second summit. The first summit discussed three of the 10 points presented by Ukraine as Zelensky’s “formula” for peace, including food security, nuclear security and the release of prisoners of war and children. Ukrainian officials said the second summit would discuss a plan drawn up in advance by dozens of countries divided into working groups. Zelensky said the officials would likely meet in Qatar in late July or early August to agree on a position on energy security. A meeting on food security is expected to be held in Turkey in August, and another in Canada in September on prisoners of war and children, he said.
